loans.name: Chukiluoda Shg Group

texts.en:
Teresa A. is an average Kenyan housewife, kept busy by the demands of caring for three children of her own, three young relatives, and one child orphaned by HIV/AIDS. To help her husband out with the costs of daily life, she started a fruit stand in 2000. Seasonal fruit prices meant it was difficult for her to regularly stock her fruit stand, and she had to give up on the business. Her husband gave her the start up capital to begin another small business, this time selling charcoal. 

Most people in the rural parts of Kenya buy charcoal or kerosene on a regular basis as they have no access to electricity. Teresa now sells ten large bags of charcoal per day, each one with a retail value of about ten US dollars. The profits from her charcoal business have enabled her to start selling kerosene, which she buys in bulk from the oil companies and sells in small quantities to rural households. The capital from her loan will enable her to buy larger quantities of kerosene from the oil companies, which gives her a reduced price per liter. Currently she purchases 40 liters for one week of sales. With the help of her loan, she will be able to purchase 160 liters per week.

loans.use: To purchase kerosene in bulk

loans.name: Ruhsora

texts.ru:
Ruhsora K., who is 25, was originally an elementary school teacher. She is married without children. Ruhsora specializes in sales of fabrics for traditional women's clothing. Her business is located in the central market in the city of Kurgan-Tube, where she rents a space. There are a lot of women who live in the city and the surrouning areas and exclusively wear traditional clothing. For this reason, using the new loan, she plans to purchase new fabrics to increase the variety of her inventory. By renewing the assortment of her goods, she will give local residents an opportunity to purchase stylish fabrics for women's clothing. Ruhsora plans to pay off the loan with 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova. Kiva Volunteer.

Хайдарова Рухсора, возраст – 25 лет, образование среднее, по специальности преподователь начальных классов, замужем, детей не имеет. Рухсора занимается продажей женских национальных тканей на центральном рынке в городе Курган-Тюбе, для этого она арендует торговую точку. На полученный кредит она планирует приобрести новый ассортимент товара для пошива женской одежды, так как в городе Курган-Тюбе и близлежащих районах живут женщины, которые носят только национальную одежду. Обновив свой ассортимент предлагаемых товаров, она даст возможность местным жителям приобретать модные женские ткани для пошива одежды. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of additional sets of new fabrics.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en: I was born and brought up in a small city, Sargodha, but moved to the big city of Lahore after my marriage in Pakistan. I am the mother of four kids: two sons and two daughters. All of my children attend school except the youngest who is too young to attend school presently. My husband operates a men's beauty salon where he offers haircuts and facial services. I mostly do my household chores but whenever I get time, I stitch clothes for my neighborhood clients. My husband holds a hair cutting diploma and now he wishes to expand his business further. He needs a loan of $200 for this purpose. He will buy some required equipment with this money.

loans.use: Buy equipment for the salon

loans.name: Rukkiah

texts.en: My name is Rukkiah B.. I was married 12 years ago and I am a mother of four: three sons and one daughter. Currently, three of my children attend school and the youngest is too small to attend school. My husband runs a salon and he is in this business for past seven years. He possesses a strong client base and wants to expand his business further for which he requires a loan of $300. With the previous loans our income increased substantially and we bought a fridge for our house. With this loan, he wants to buy  facial equipment and towels for his business.

loans.use: Buy facial equipment and towels for the salon

loans.name: Zarniyar

texts.en: Zarniyar (her son is pictured) is a widow with 3 children. She was born in 1953. This woman lives with her 3 children in the Salyan region, Khaladj village. 15 years ago Zarniyar started a farming business to meet the demands of her family. Now she needs a loan of $1200 to buy fertilizer for improving her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Umoja Group

texts.en: Umoja group is made up of four hardworking ladies, from left to right: Laurent F., Zabiba K., Salima O. and Weda J.. They are all residents of Makangarawe near Dar es Salaam. Mariam and Wada own stationery shops in Tandiika market and the rest have grocery shops, businesses they have been doing for the past five years. They are each in need of USD 400 to help them expand their businesses.

loans.use: Expand businesses

loans.name: Javhar

texts.ru:
Javhar R. is 42, has a high school education, is married and has two sons. Javhar sells national items on the market in the city of Kurgan-Tjube. The market is called "Atush." She has been working in this business for the past 6 years. She is one of the few people in the region selling national items that are used in traditional rituals such as marriage, birth of a sun etc. With the obtained loan she plans to increase the variety of goods she has for sale. In this manner she will allow the locals to acquire the necessary items to conduct traditional national rituals. She plans to repay the loan withing 12 months

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Расулова Джавхар, возраст – 42 года, образование среднее, замужем, имеет 2 сыновей. Джавхар занимется продажей национальных вещей на рынке города Курган-Тюбе под названием «Атуш». Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже в течение 6 лет. Она является одним из немногих предпринимателей, которые занимаются продажей местным жителям продукции предназначенной для проведение национальных обычаев, таких как свадьба, рождение сына и т.д. На полученный кредит она планирует закупить новый ассортимент товра. Таким образом она даст возможность местным жителям приобретать необходимые товары для проведения национальных обрядов. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: increase the variety of goods sold

loans.name: Mamlakat

texts.ru:
Mamlakat M. is 52, has a college degree in economics, is married and has 10 children. Mamlakat is in the business of selling fabric that is used to create national female gowns. She cells on the central market of the city of Yanvana that is called "Tidjorat". She has been working in this business for the past 11 years. Currently she has purchased another sales location on the same market. Because she has used her savings to purchase this sale location, she is asking for a loan that will allow her to purchase goods to sell at this second sales location. She is planing to purchase children's winter clothing. This will allow the locals to purchase children's clothing on the local market, while Mamlakat will have an additional source of income that will help her take care of her large family. Her son helps her with the business. She is planing to repay the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Мардонова Мамлакат, возраст – 52 года, образование высшее, по специальности – экономист, замужем, имеет 10-х детей. Мамлакат занимается торговлей тканями для пошива национальной женской одежды на центральном рынпке города Явана под названием «Тиджорат». Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже в течение 11 лет. В данный момент она дополнительно приобрела еще одну торговую точку на данном рынке. Так как средства были напрвлены на приобретение торговой лавки, полученный кредит поможет ей приобрести товар для новой торговой точки. На полученный кредит клиент планирует приобрести новый товар – зимние детские вещи. Это даст возможность местным жителям приобретать необходимые детские вещи на местном рынке, а Мамлакат получит дополнительный источник дохода, который поможет обеспечивать ее большую семью. В этом бизнесе ей помогает ее сын. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: purchase children's clothing to sell at a new sales location

loans.name: Holikul

texts.ru:
Holikul M. is 65, has a college degree in physics and mathematics, is married and has 9 children. Currently Holikul is retired and is in business of raising and selling cattle. With this loan he will be able to purchase and feed two animals. According to his calculations he will be able to sell animals each 40-45 days. He will purchase new animals and feed with the money he will obtain from the sale. He will use the remaining profit to supplement his small pension, which by itself is not always enough. He has been in this business for the past 7 years. He is planing to repay the loan withing 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Маджитов Холикул – 65 лет, образование высшее, по специальности физик – математик, женат, имеет 9-х детей. В настоящее время Холикул находится на пенсии и занимается разведением и продажей домашнего скота. Холикул на полученный кредит планирует приобрести 2 головы крупного рогатого скота и корма для них. После их откормки через каждые 40-45 дней он планирует их продавать, а на вырученный деньги приобретать новый молодняк и корм, оставшуюся прибыль использовать на удовлетворение потребностей семьи, так как он получает небольшую пенсию, которая не всегда хватает. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 7 лет. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase two animals to raise and sell

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Mrs. Beatriz lives with her parents in the Villa Nuevo zone of the city of La Paz. Her primary business activity is selling candy, soft drinks, sandwiches, coffee, and other foods in the bus station of La Paz. The credit she is requesting is to increase her cash on hand and improve the appearance of her kiosk so she can stock her products. This is her first loan with Impro, but the quality of her small business and the socioeconomic analysis performed qualify her to receive a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Beatriz vive en casa de sus padres en la calle 3 de mayo de la zona Villa Nuevo Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz. La actividad que realiza es la venta de dulces, refrescos, sándwich, café y otros en la Terminal de autobuses de la ciudad de La Paz y el crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital y mejorar la apariencia de su kiosco poder surtir sus productos No tiene antecedente con Impro pero califica para acceder a un préstamo por su calidad de micro empresaria y el análisis socio económico realizado.

loans.use: Improve the appearance of her kiosk

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
Client’s history: Mrs. Modesta buys vicuña and alpaca wool. She spins the wool to weave her shawls, and hires another person to help her with braids and fringes. Her children are now independent and work for themselves. Now that she weaves her blankets based on orders, she lives and works out of her home in the Callapa zone. She has been a client of Impro since December 2005. This is her second request for Kiva’s support; she has finished paying the last installment of her first, so she is requesting a new loan at this time. Her history in our institution qualifies her as a first rate client as far as fulfilling her payment obligations. The sum requested will be used for the purchase of raw materials (vicuña and alpaca wool). Her work and her prior credits with Impro permit her to apply for this loan as she has experience in her business that will enable her to cover the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Historia del Cliente: La señora Modesta compra lana de vicuña y alpaca. Ella hila la lana para poder tejer las mantas y para trenzado y flecadura contrata a una persona, sus hijos ya son independientes y trabajan por cuenta propia. Vive en la zona de Callapa donde tiene su taller, ya que las mantas que elabora son a pedido. Es cliente de Impro desde diciembre de 2005 y la segunda vez que requiere el apoyo de Kiva, su última cuota ha sido cancelada, por lo que solicita un nuevo préstamo. Su historial en nuestra institución la califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento Bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de materia prima (lana de vicuña y lana de alpaca) Su trabajo y antecedentes crediticios con Impro le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio. El cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of vicuña and alpaca wool to weave shawls

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Client history: Mrs. Victoria makes food in her home and sells it to the workers at construction sites. She also makes lunches and extra dishes, and her daughter helps her in her business. She lives in the Irpavi II zone of the city of La Paz, selling her food from site to site as a traveling peddler. This is the fifth time she has requested a loan, and the second time she has requested Kiva’s help. Her last payment was completed in December, so she is requesting a new loan. Her history in our institution qualifies her as a first-rate client, with good completion in the payments toward her debt. The sum she is requesting will go toward purchasing ingredients and stock such as rice, pasta, potato (fresh and freeze-dried), and pots. Her work and her prior credits with Impro allow her access to this credit. She has experience with the business, and its income will cover the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Historia del Cliente: La señora Victoria elabora comida en su domicilio y vende a los albañiles en las construcciones, también elabora almuerzos y platos extras y su hija le ayuda en el negocio. Vive en la zona de Irpavi II de la ciudad de La Paz, y su puesto es ambulante ya que vende la comida en cada construcción. Es la quinta vez que solicita un crédito, y la segunda vez que requieren la ayuda de Kiva, su última cuota ha sido cancelada en diciembre por lo que solicita un nuevo préstamo. Su historial en nuestra institución la califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento Bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de Insumos (Arroz, fideo, papa, chuño, tunta. y ollas) Su trabajo y antecedentes crediticios con Impro le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio. El cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use:
Compra de insumos - arroz, fiedo, papa, chuño,tuntas - y ollas.
Purchase of ingredients - rice, pasta, potato foods - and pots

loans.name: Elodia

texts.es:
Client details: Elodia and her husband are independent tractor maintenance mechanics. They live in the area of Callapa. Since they do the repairs at home, they don't have a separate garage set up for their work.

This is the fourth loan with IMPRO and the second one through Kiva. Her last loan was paid off in December; now she requests a new one. Her credit history with IMPRO qualifies her as a number 1 client because she has honored her financial obligations. The new loan will be used to buy tools for her business. Her job and credit history with IMPRO approve her for this loan. Her experience in her business will provide the means for loan repayment.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

Historia del Cliente: La señora Elodia trabaja independientemente con su esposo realizando mantenimiento de tractores. Vive en la zona de Callapa y los mantenimientos que realiza es a domicilio no tiene un taller establecido ya que el trabajo que realiza es de mantenimiento.

Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito en IMPRO y la segunda vez que solicita ayuda de Kiva, su última cuota ha sido cancelada en diciembre por lo que solicitan un nuevo crédito. Su historial en nuestra institución la califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento Bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de herramientas de trabajo. Su trabajo y antecedentes crediticios con IMPRO le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio. El cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: to buy tools like screwdrivers, wrenches, etc.

loans.name: Banda B9 Group

texts.en: She expects to also start outside catering if given the loan. She wants to  expand her business by carrying out outside catering,for example,on parties and other occasions rather than being limited to only a restaurant serving a limited population.

loans.use: To open outside catering service

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Client Details: Margarita promotes perfumes and cosmetics and sells her products through magazines. She works with various perfume lines from AVON, ZERMA, and YAMBAL. Her clients pay her in monthly installments from two to six months. She lives in the area of Irpavi II, which is in the city of La Paz. She does not have a fixed store since her sales are executed through orders.

This is the fifth time she seeks a loan from IMPRO and the second one through Kiva. The previous loan through Kiva has been completely paid off. Her credit history qualifies her as a number 1 client because she has honored her financial obligations. The new loan she requests will be used to buy merchandise (perfumes, cosmetics, talcs, etc.). Her job and credit history with IMPRO approves her for this loan. Her experience in her business will provide the means to pay back the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator

Historia del Cliente: La señora Margarita es promotora de perfumes y cosméticos ofrece sus productos mediante revistas, trabaja con las líneas de de perfumes de AVON, ZERMAT, y YAMBAL. Y sus clientes le cancelan en de dos a seis pagos mensuales. Vive en la zona de Irpavi II de la ciudad de La Paz, no cuenta con un puesto fijo ya que las ventas que realiza son a pedido.

Es la quinta vez que solicita un crédito en IMPRO y la segunda vez que solicita ayuda de Kiva por que solicitan un nuevo crédito. El crédito anterior con Kiva ha sido cancelado en su totalidad. Su historial en nuestra institución la califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento Bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de mercadería (perfumes, cosméticos, talcos, etc.) Su trabajo y antecedentes crediticios con Impro le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio. El cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell to her customers

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Details of Client: Justina has a truck that her husband drives in order to buy and sell sand and stones and for moving. They live in the area of Irpavil II which is in the city of La Paz. This is the fifth time she requests a loan from IMPRO and the second one through Kiva. Since her last loan was paid off in December, she now seeks a new one. Her previous credit history with IMPRO qualifies her as a number one client since she has displayed excellent payment history. The total amount she requests will be used to maintain her vehicle and to buy wheel rims and seat upholstery. Her job and previous credit history with IMPRO approves her for this loan. The experience she has in her business will provide her the means to pay back the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

Historia del Cliente: La señora Justina tiene una volqueta que su esposo la maneja, para la compra y venta de arena, piedra, y mudanzas. Vive en la zona de Irpavi II de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la quinta vez que solicita un crédito en IMPRO y segunda que solicita el apoyo de Kiva, su ultima ha sido cancelada en diciembre por lo que solicitan un nuevo crédito. Su historial en nuestra institución la califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento Bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para el mantenimiento de su volqueta y la compra de llantas y tapizado de asientos. Su trabajo y antecedentes crediticios con IMPRO le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio. El cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and to purchase wheel rims and seat upholstery.

loans.name: Iyos

texts.en: Iyos is 36 years old whose husband, S., has no fixed income. So she helps her husband provide the family needs by selling some foods at her house such as blended ice, fried snacks, etc., and usually earns US $2.50 - $3.50 per day. Iyos is a member of MBK and is requesting a loan to buy more goods and provide tuition for her children. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Pap Ndege Shg Group

texts.en:
Dorine used to work in Kenya’s capital, Nairobi, a busy industrial center. She was employed by an embroidery firm and learned how to use a variety of embroidery machines. Always ambitious, Dorine put aside a small portion of her salary every month to save for her own embroidery machine. She planned to move to a place near her rural home where she knew that embroidery work was not offered when she was able to purchase her own machine.

Once she became the proud owner of an embroidery machine in 2003, Dorine moved her business to Riat Market. In 2006, she used some of her savings from her embroidery business to start a new shoes business alongside her embroidery business. By 2007, she had accumulated enough money to start a new clothing business alongside her embroidery and new shoes businesses.

Although she is only 25, Dorine would like to start training other young women to embroider. In order to do this, she needs to buy another machine. A nice machine costs $230 dollars. She has over $70 in the bank. When she gets her loan, she plans to combine her savings and her loan and buy a new embroidery machine. She’ll take students in the morning and evening. With the profits from her business and the monthly fee her students will pay her, she’ll be able to pay back her loan.

Her additional profits will be used to send her two young children to private schools. As a single mother, Dorine’s business success is the only way her children will be able to attend school. This new sewing machine will ensure that she is able to continue paying their school fees.

loans.use: To buy a new embroidery machine

payments.comment: Pap Ndege continues to repay its Kiva loan and is now 65% complete in its repayment

loans.name: Ivana

texts.es:
Mrs. Ivana buys fabric by the yard to create blanket shawls (mantas) with braiding. She works alone as her children are young and her husband is a chauffeur. She lives in the Callapa zone and her shop is located at the same address. This is the fifth time she has requested a credit from Impro and her second request for Kiva’s support. Her last payment was completed in December so she is requesting a new loan. Her history with our institution qualifies her as a first-rate customer with good completion in the payments of her debts. The sum requested will be used for purchasing basic materials (fabric, lining, braiding, and thread). Her work experience and previous credits with Impro permit her access to this credit, and her business provides sufficient income to cover the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Historia del Cliente: La señora Ivana compra tela por corte para elaborar mantas con trencillas, trabaja sola ya que sus hijos son pequeños y su esposo es chofer. Vive en la zona de Callapa y su taller también esta ubicado en la misma dirección. Es la quinta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro y la segunda que solicita el apoyo de Kiva, su ultima cuota ha sido cancelada en diciembre por lo que solicitan un nuevo préstamo. Su historial en nuestra institución la califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento Bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de materia prima (Tela, forro, trencilla e hilo). Su trabajo y antecedentes crediticios con Impro le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio. El cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase basic materials to create shawls

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Mrs. Irene purchases pig skin and toasts it to sell as dried chicharrón (a dish similar to pork rinds) by the pound. She works alone, and her husband is the cook. She lives in Irpavi Bajo, La Paz; she does not have her own shop, but instead sells door to door and by walking through markets. This is the fourth time she has requested a credit from Impro and the second time they have needed Kiva’s support. Her last payment was paid in full in December, and she is now requesting a new loan. Her history in our institution qualifies her as a first-rate client, with good completion in the payment of her debts. The sum requested will be used for the purchase of ingredients (pig skins). Her work experience and prior credits with Impro allow her access to this credit, and the business’ income is sufficient to covers the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Historia del Cliente: La señora Irene compra cuero de cerdo y lo hace secar para luego tostarlo y venderlo como chicharrón seco, por libras, trabaja sola, su esposo es cocinero. Vive Irpavi Bajo, en la ciudad de La Paz, no tiene puesto ya que ambula casa por casa, también vende en los mercados ambulando. Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito en impro y la segunda vez que requieren el apoyo de Kiva, su última cuota ha sido cancelada en diciembre por lo cual solicita un nuevo crédito. Su historial en nuestra institución la califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento Bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de insumos (cuero de cerdo). Su trabajo y antecedentes crediticios con Impro le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio, el cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of pig skin to prepare chicharrones

loans.name: Nurhayati

texts.en: Nurhayati is 20 years old and has a small shop that sells snacks, cigarettes, and some household goods. She usually earns US $5.50 per day with a small profit. Her husband, N., has no fixed income. Nurhayati needs a loan to buy more goods for her shop. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her shop

loans.name: Maria R.

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria's daily job is the distribution and sale of merchandise such as clothing and shoes. Her work is order-based, depending on the needs of her customers. This is the fourth time she has requested a credit through Impro. Her history qualifies her as a first-rate customer with good completion in paying her debts. The sum requested will be used for purchasing merchandise. Her work experiences in this business allow her access to this credit, and the income from her business covers the loan and her personal expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Historia del Cliente: La señora Maria reparte mercadería (ropa, calzados) para cobrar diariamente, trabaja a pedido de acuerdo a la necesidad de su cliente. Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de sus cuotas. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de mercadería. Su trabajo y experiencia le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio, el cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo y sus necesidades personales.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise - clothing and shoes - to sell to customers

loans.name: Juju

texts.en: Juju is 58 years old and sells flavoured ice and drinks. She can earn US $7.50 per day. Her husband, S., sells rice and earns a small income. Juju requests a loan to expand her business to provide the family's needs. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.es:
History of the client: Valeriana makes blankets of fabric and wool. She works alone because her husband is a construction worker, and her kids are of school age. She lives in the area of Irpavi II in the city of La Paz, where she has her shop. Her objective is to have more capital so she can make more blankets.

This is the fourth time that she is requesting a loan and the second time that she is asking for Kiva's support. Her last loan was paid in full in December, which is why she is requesting a new one. Her history with our institution qualifies her as a 1-rated client, which means she has a good rating with paying back her loans. The amount requested will go towards the purchase of raw material (fabric, wool, and thread).

Her work and previous credits with Impro let her qualify to request another loan. Since she has a lot of experience in this business, the income she makes will let her pay back the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Historia del Cliente: La señora Valeriana elabora mantas de tela y lana, trabaja sola ya que su esposo es albañil, sus hijos están en edad escolar. Vive en la zona de Irpavi II de la ciudad de La Paz, donde tiene su taller, su objetivo es contar con más capital y así poder elaborar mantas en cantidad.

Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito y la segunda vez que requiere el apoyo de Kiva, su última cuota ha sido cancelada en el mes de diciembre por lo cual solicitan un nuevo crédito. Su historial en nuestra institución la califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento Bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de materia prima (Tela, lana e hilo)

Su trabajo y antecedentes crediticios con Impro le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio. El cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric, wool, and thread to make blankets

loans.name: Endah

texts.en: Endah is a 39-year-old woman who has a small shop that provides household goods, food, snacks, kerosene, rice, etc. She can earn US $33.50 per month, which is just enough for their daily needs and her children's education. Her husband, J., has no fixed income. Endah requests a loan to expand her shop. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her shop

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
History of the client: Juliana buys leather bags and wallets and sells them by traveling through the markets in the southern zone. She works alone because her husband is a bricklayer. She lives in the zone of Callapa.

This is the second time that she is requesting a loan with Impro and help from Kiva. Her last loan was paid off in full in December, which is why she's requesting a new loan. Her history qualifies her as a 1-rated client, which means she has a good payment history. The requested amount will go towards purchasing merchandise (wallets, bags, and briefcases). Her work and experience qualify her to take out a new loan. Since she has experience in this business, the income she makes will let her pay back her loan and cover her personal needs.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Historia del Cliente: La señora Juliana compra carteras y billeteras de cuero y cuerina y vende ambulando en las ferias de la zona sur, trabaja sola ya que su esposo es albañil. Vive en la zona de Callapa.

Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro y la segunda vez que solicita ayuda de Kiva. Su última cuota ha sido cancelada en diciembre por lo que solicita un nuevo crédito. Su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de sus cuotas. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de mercadería (carteras, billeteras y maletines).Su trabajo y experiencia le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio, el cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo y sus necesidades personales.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise like leather bags, wallets, and briefcases for her business

loans.name: Marila

texts.es:
History of the client: Marila sells food and prepares dishes to sell in the mornings. She lives in Irpavi II en the city of La Paz. Her stand is located at bus stop 248. This is the second time she is requesting a loan. Her history qualifies her as a 1-rated client, which means she has a good history of making her payments. The requested amount will go towards purchasing merchandise (rice, noodles, potatoes, and vegetables). Her work qualifies her to apply for this credit, and since she has experience in this business, her income will let her pay back the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Historia del Cliente: La señora Marila vende comida y prepara platos extras para vender por las mañanas. Vive en Irpavi II en la ciudad de La Paz, su puesto esta ubicado en la parada del minibús 248. Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito. Su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de mercadería (arroz fideo papa y verduras en general). Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio, el cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of inputs for her food business

loans.name: Kartini

texts.en: Kartini is a 37-year-old woman who has a small shop and sells beverages, snacks, food etc., and she usually earns US $12 per week. Her husband, R., has no fixed income. Kartini requests a loan to buy some goods to fill her shop. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy some goods to fill her shop

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Client History: Rosa makes blankets and works by order.

She lives in the Callapa zone of the city of La Paz.

This is the second time that she is requesting a loan. Her file qualifies as a category 1 client, meaning that she has paid her debts on time. The amount requested will be used to buy wool and thread that she will use to make blankets.

Her work enables her to receive this loan because she has experience in her business, which produces enough income to cover the loan and her personal needs.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Historia del Cliente: La señora Rosa elabora mantas y trabaja a pedido.

Vive en la zona de Callapa de la ciudad de La Paz

Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito Su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de lana e hilos que le servirán para la producción de mantas.

Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio, el cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo y sus necesidades personales.

loans.use: To purchase wool and thread for making blankets

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Client History : Rosa sells perfumes and cosmetics by magazine order. She does not have very much capital and her goal is to increase her capital so that she can offer her products on credit.

She lives in Callapa. She does not have a fixed post so she sells her products walking through the markets. This is the second time that she’s requesting a loan and Kiva’s support. She paid her last loan back in December and now she is asking for a new loan. Her file qualifies her as a category 1 client, meaning that she has paid her loans back on time. The amount requested will be used to buy merchandise (perfumes, cosmetics, etc.).

Her work enables her to receive this loan because she has experience in her business, the income from which is enough to cover the loan.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Historia del Cliente: La señora Rosa vende perfumes y cosméticos mediante revista, no cuenta con mucho capital y su objetivo es tener más capital para que pueda ofrecer sus productos a crédito.

Vive en Callapa, no cuenta con un puesto fijo ya que ofrece sus productos ambulando por los mercados. Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito y el apoyo de kiva, su última cuota ha sido cancelada en el mes de diciembre por lo que solicita un nuevo crédito; su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de mercadería (perfumes y cosméticos, etc.)

Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio, el cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: To purchase perfumes and cosmetics for her business

loans.name: Komariyah

texts.en: Komariyah is 34 years old. Before joining MBK, her husband, A., is the only one who works in the family. But since joining MBK, she has helped her husband by starting her own business; producing handicraft, such as purses, in her house. She usually earns US $22 per month. She needs a loan to expand her business. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana belongs to the Banco Comunal Lideres Triunfadores (The Community Bank of Leaders), and she lives in the Jr. Rosa Merino Mz. H Lt. 13 district of Calleria, in the county of Ucayali. She is 73 years old and has 7 grown up kids. She is widowed and her income does not cover the household bills. This is why Ana, with the first loan that she got from Manuela Ramos of $300.00, decided to invest in the sale of food and raising chickens and farm ducks.

Now, Ana, along with her daughter, is still selling food. First they rise early to go to the market, then they prepare the food and they sell it at night. At the same time, and with much dedication, she rears chickens and ducks for public sale.

With a loan of $1800, which she will pay back over a period of 6 months, she will buy more chickens, ducks, a sack of beans, a sack of Chiclayo (pulses), a sack of corn and two crates of fizzy drinks.

Despite Ana's advanced age she is a great example for all mothers, some of whom, despite being young, find themselves unhappy in life, but they have the strength to go on and focus on a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Ana pertenece al Banco Comunal Lideres Triunfadoras, vive en el Jr. Rosa Merino Mz. H Lt. 13, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 73 años de edad, es madre de 7 hijos independientes, es viuda, pero el ingreso que tiene no alcanza para cubrir los gastos del hogar, es así que Ana, con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00, decide invertir en la venta de comida y crianza de pollos y patos de granja. Actualmente Ana junto con su hija salen adelante con la venta de comida. Primero madrugan para realizar las compras en el mercado, luego se dedican a la preparación de sus comidas y la venta se realiza en las noches. Paralelamente, con mucho esmero, se dedica a la crianza de sus pollos y patos para la venta al público. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,800, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará mas pollos, patos de granja, un saco de fríjol, un saco de Chiclayo (menestra), un saco de maíz y dos cajas de gaseosas. Ana a pesar de su avanzada edad es todo un ejemplo a seguir para las demás madres, que siendo jóvenes se sienten derrotadas en la vida, aún le sobran fuerzas para seguir adelante y pensar en un futuro mejor.

loans.use: To buy small animals (chickens, ducks), and to buy pulses (beans, chiclayo) and fizzy drinks/Compra de animales menores (pollos, patos). Compra de menestras (frijol, chiclayo). Compra de gaseosas

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en: Zeinab is 48 years old. She lives and works in Bekaa, in a region called Al Ein (which literally means 'the eye' in English). Zeinab owns a grocery store. This is the second time Zeinab is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua. She is known to be a hard-working woman. Zeinab needs to buy new merchandise for her grocery store to sustain her business and insure its continuous growth.

loans.use: To buy new merchandise

loans.name: Cuni

texts.en: Cuni is a 27-year-old woman who sells clothes on credit door-to-door. She can earn US $33.50 per week, of which, US $11.50 is profit. Her husband, M., sells food and only earns a small income. She requests a loan to expand her business by serving more customers, so she could provide tuition for her childrens' education. Cuni is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Aquina

texts.es:
Mrs. M. is a member of the Atenas Portillanas microfinance institution. She lives in Jr. Miguel Grau 150, located in the Yarina Cocha district of Ucayali. She is a 60-year-old mother of 3 dependent children. Her husband is a merchant, but his income is not sufficient enough to cover all the household expenses. Consequently, Aquina decided to use her first loan of 300.00 soles from Manuela Ramos to set up a mini market.

Aquina currently runs her well-stocked market, but at the same time she also makes time to take care of her school age children.

With this loan of 1, 200.00 soles, which she will pay off in 6 months, she will purchase rice, cooking oil, jam, sugar, a large crate of milk, noodles, five packs of bathroom tissue, a box of detergent, and 5 cases of soft drinks.

Aquina is a hard-working woman who has been able to push her children forward with great effort and dedication. She is very happy that Manuel Ramos has supported and trusted her, in so doing giving her the opportunity to advance.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Aquina pertenece al Banco Comunal Atenas Portillanas, vive en el Jr. Miguel Grau 150, ubicado en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 60 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos que aún depende de ella, es casada, su esposo es comerciante, pero el ingreso que tienen no alcanza para cubrir los gastos del hogar, es así que Aquina, con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00, decide invertir en una bodega.

Actualmente Aquina atiende la bodega que es muy surtida, pero a la vez se da tiempo para atender a sus hijos que tienen que ir a la escuela.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará un saco de arroz, dos paquetes de aceite, una caja de conserva, un saco de azúcar, una caja de leche grande, un paquete de fideos, cinco paquetes de papel higiénico, un paquete de detergente y cinco cajas de gaseosa.

Aquina es una mujer luchadora porque supo sacar adelante a sus hijos con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, se siente muy feliz dado que Manuela Ramos le ha apoyado y ha confiado en ella y de esa manera poder seguir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase of rice, cooking oil, jam, sugar, milk, noodles, bathroom tissue, detergent, and soft drinks

loans.name: Encam

texts.en: Encam is 30 years old, and sells clothes on credit door-to-door around the village. She usually earns US $2.75 per day. Her husband, A., has no fixed income. Encam requests a loan to expand her business. She is a member of MBK, and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Clira

texts.es:
Clira is a member of the Atenas Portillanas Communal Bank. She lives in the Yarina Cocha district in Ucayali. She is 47 years old and is the mother of three children, who are all adults now. She is married and her husband is a fisherman, but their combined income is not enough to cover the expenses in their household. For that reason, Clira, with the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos in the amount of S/. 300.00, decided to invest into a business selling bananas and other fruit.

Currently, Clira rises very early and goes to the port with her children, who always support her, to purchase all the products she will be selling. In this way, she progresses with much effort and dedication.

With the loan of S/. 1.200, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy five bunches of bananas, two sacks of charcoal, one sack of cassava (a starchy root vegetable) and one sack each of lemon, fruits, etc. She will use what is left for the repair of her tricycle motor cart.

Clira is a very affable and charismatic woman, with enviable wishes of self-improvement. She is an outstanding role model for all women.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Clira pertenece al Banco Comunal Atenas Portillanas, vive en Jr Miguel Grau 139, ubicado en el distrito Yarina Cocha, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 47 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos, todos

mayores de edad, es casada, su esposo es pescador, pero el ingreso que tienen no alcanza para cubrir los gastos del hogar, es así que Clira, con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00, decide invertir en un negocio de venta de plátanos y frutas.

Actualmente Clira se levanta muy temprano para ir al puerto junto con sus hijos, que siempre la apoyan, para comprar sus productos que pondrá a la venta. De este modo ella sale adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1.200, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará cinco racimos de plátanos, dos sacos de carbón, un saco de yuca, un saco de limón, frutas, etc. Lo que le resta le servirá para la reparación de su motocarro.

Clira, es una señora muy risueña, carismática, con un deseo de superación envidiable, pues es un ejemplo a seguir para todas la mujeres.

loans.use: Purchase bananas, charcoal, cassava, lemon, fruits, etc. She will also repair her tricycle motor cart.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana is a member of the Atenas Portillanas Communal Bank. She lives in the Yarina Cocha district in Ucayali. She is 40 years old, separated, and has 5 children who still depend on her. Because her income is not enough to cover the expenses of her household, Juana, with the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos for S/. 300.00, decided to venture into the sale of meals, quinoa and bread.

Currently, Juana prepares her goods and takes them to the Bellavista market to sell to her clients. In the afternoon, she prepares quinoa and bread, which she will take with her to be sold the following day.

With the loan of S/. 1.200, which she will repay in 6 months, she will purchase a sack of sugar and another of cornstarch. She will spend S/. 60 in daily bread and the rest will be invested in the maintenance of her kitchen.

Despite not being able to count with her husband’s support, Juana raised her 5 children alone. They are her adoration and always help her. She feels very proud of them, and she told us that her every effort is for the purpose of providing them with the best and that they never lack anything. She is thankful to God that they are all healthy.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Juana pertenece al Banco Comunal Atenas Portillanas, vive en el Jr. Hugo Blanco 110 del distrito de Yarina Cocha, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 40 años de edad, es separada, tiene cinco hijos que aún dependen de ella, como el ingreso que tiene no alcanza para cubrir los gastos del hogar, Juana, con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00, decide invertir en la venta de comidas, quinua y panes.

Actualmente Juana prepara sus productos que lleva al mercado Bellavista para venderlos a sus clientes. En las tardes se dedica a la preparación de quinua y panes, los cuales llevará a vender al día siguiente.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1.200, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará un saco de azúcar, un saco de chuño, S/. 60 en pan diario y el resto lo invertirá en mantenimiento de su cocina.

Juana, a pesar de no contar con el apoyo de su esposo, tuvo que sacar sola adelante a sus 5 hijos, que son su adoración y siempre la ayudan. Se siente muy orgullosa de ellos y nos dijo que todo el esfuerzo que ella hace es para darles lo mejor, que no les falte nada y da gracias a Dios porque todos están bien de salud.

loans.use: Purchase of sugar and cornstarch, and for the maintenance of her kitchen.

loans.name: Wati

texts.en: Wati is 30 years old and has a duck livestock business at her house. She has to raise them before selling them. She can earn US $2.50 per week. Her husband, E., has no fixed income. She needs a loan to expand her business and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Rufino

texts.es:
Client History: Rufino is a salaried carpenter. He does not have his own workshop and his wife does not work. He has a 3 year-old son.

This is the second time that he is requesting a loan and Kiva’s support. He repaid his last loan in December and now he is requesting a new one. His file qualifies him as a category 1 client, meaning that he repaid his loan on time. The amount requested will be used to buy manual carpentry tools in order to increase his income, to do furniture repair in general, and to be able to work for himself.

His work enables him to receive this loan because he has experience in his business. This business produces enough income to cover the loan and his personal needs.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Historia del Cliente: Rufino es carpintero asalariado no cuenta con un taller propio sus esposa no trabaja, y tiene un hijo de 3 años.

Vive en la zona de Callapa de la ciudad de La Paz.

Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito y el apoyo de Kiva, su última cuota ha sido cancelada en el mes de diciembre por lo que solicita un nuevo crédito. Su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su obligación El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de herramientas manuales de carpintería para poder incrementar sus ingresos y realizar arreglos de muebles en general y poder trabajar por cuenta propia

Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio. Esta actividad le da ingresos suficientes para cubrir tanto el préstamo como sus necesidades personales.

loans.use: Purchase of carpentry tools

loans.name: Lucinda Viviana

texts.es:
Lucinda is a member of the Lideres Triunfadoras Communal Bank and lives in the Calleria district of Ucayali. She is 27 years old and is the mother of 2 small children. Her husband is a salesman, but their income is not enough to cover the expenses of their household. That is how Lucinda, with the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos in the amount of S/. 300.00, decided to invest in merchandise such as clothing, lingerie, beauty products, footwear and decorations.

Currently, she sells her merchandise door-to-door and in her home along with her mother. Her clients are very satisfied with the service Lucinda offers and with her good taste for choosing high-quality products.

With the loan of S/. 2.700, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase more merchandise such as three dozen blouses for women, four dozen polo-type shirts for men and two dozen for children. In terms of beauty products, she will buy ten perfumes, and she will also buy ten pairs of sandals, among other things.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Lucinda pertenece al Banco Comunal Lideres Triunfadoras, vive en el Jr Atahualpa 635 del distrito Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 27 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos pequeños, su esposo es negociante, pero el ingreso que tiene no alcanza para cubrir los gastos del hogar, es así que Lucinda, con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00, decide invertir en mercaderías como ropa, productos de lencería (leonisa), productos de belleza (unique, ebel), zapatos (azaleias) y adornos.

En la actualidad ella vende su mercadería a domicilio y en su propia casa junto con su madre. Sus clientas están muy complacidas por la atención que les brinda Lucinda y el buen gusto que tiene por escoger sus productos que son de muy buena marca.

Con el préstamo de S/. 2.700, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará mas mercadería, en esta ocasión tres docenas de blusas para damas, cuatro docenas de polos para caballero y dos docenas de polos para niños; en productos de belleza comprará diez perfumes y diez pares de sandalias, etc.

loans.use: Purchase clothing (blouses and polo-type shirts), beauty products (perfumes) and sandals.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Client History: Rosa makes macramé and wool tablecloths, all knitted on order. She works for herself and her husband is a mason.

She lives in the Callapa zone and her workshop is also located at the same address.

This is the second time that she is requesting a loan and Kiva’s support. She repaid her last loan in December and now she is requesting a new one. Her file qualifies her as a category 1 client, meaning that she repaid her loan on time. The amount requested will be used to buy raw materials (wool and thread).

Her work enables her to receive this loan because she has experience in her business. This business produces enough income to cover the loan.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Historia del Cliente: La señora Rosa elabora manteles en macramé y lana, todo tejido es a pedido ya que trabaja por cuenta propia y su esposo es albañil.

Vive en la zona de Callapa y su taller también esta ubicado en la misma dirección.

Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito y el apoyo de Kiva, su última cuota ha sido cancelada en diciembre por lo que solicita un nuevo crédito. Su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de materia prima (lana e hilo).

Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio. El cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of wool and thread to make tablecloths

loans.name: Haitali

texts.ru:
Haitali K. is 56, has a high school education, is married and has 5 children. Currently he is unemployed. Haitali wants to start his own business. He wants to purchase a car and offer taxi services to the local residents. He has some money that he was able to save up thanks to his son who is currently working in Russia. However this money is insufficient to be able to purchase a car. The loan that Haitali is requesting is the exact amount of money he needs to buy a car. The region that he lives in lacks a permanent mode of transportation that would link it to the center of the region or the center of the city. There are not that many people offering this kind of service. The appearance of an additional taxi will allow the locals to go to the center of the city or the center of the region and take care of business without having to wait an excessive amount of time for transport. Haitali is planing to repay back the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Караев Хайтали, возраст – 56 лет, образование среднее, женат, имеет 5-х детей. Хайтали в настоящее время не работает. Он хочет заняться своим видом бизнеса, а именно купить автомобиль и оказывать услуги такси населению района, где он проживает. У него есть немного своих денег, которые он накопил за счёт средств, которые ему пересылает сын из России, но этих денег не хватает на покупку автомобиля. Размер запрашиваемого кредита, это именно та сумма, которая не хвататет ему для покупки автомобиля. Так как в данном района отсутствет транспортное регулярное сообщение с центром района и города и не так много людей, оказывающие подобного рода услуги. Появление ещё одного таксиста даст возможность местным жителям ездить в город, в центр района по своим делам, при этом не ожидая транспорта. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: purchase a car

loans.name: Yati

texts.en: Yati is 35 years old. Before joining MBK, her husband, A., was the only person who worked in the family. But since joining MBK, she started her own business making handicraft at her house. She usually earns US $22 per month. She requests a loan to expand her business. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
Noemí belongs to the Atenas Portillanas Communal Bank. She lives on 239 Jr. Antunez de Manolo Street in the Yarina Cocha district in Ucayali. She is 40-years-old and is the mother of 2 children who still depend on her. She is married, and her husband works at a wood company. His income isn't enough to cover their home's expenses, so that's why Noemí, with the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 nuevos soles, decided to invest in selling the typical food of Bolivia.

Currently, Noemí and her kids do their chores at home, although they still keep up with their school work. Then Naomí goes to the market to make her purchases and prepares her dishes. With this loan of 1,800 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy a sack of rice, 10 liters of oil, a half a sack of noodles, two boxes of soft drinks, and will put 50 nuevos soles towards making ice and popsicles. Noemí is a devoted mother, and it's because of her children that through the support offered to her by Manuela Ramos, she will give her children a better life because they are her reason for living.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Noemí pertenece al Banco Comunal Atenas Portillanas, vive en el Jr. Antunez de Manolo 239 del distrito Yarina Cocha, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 40 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos que aún dependen de ella, es casada, su esposo es empleado de una empresa de madera, pero el ingreso que tienen no alcanza para cubrir los gastos del hogar, es así que Noemí, con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00, decide invertir en la venta de comidas típicas.

Actualmente Noemí, conjuntamente con sus hijos, hacen las labores de la casa, pero sin descuidar la escuela. Luego se dirige al mercado para hacer sus compras y después se dedica a la preparación de sus comidas. Con el préstamo de S/. 1.800, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará un saco de arroz, diez litros de aceite, medio saco de fideos, dos cajas de gaseosas y destinará S/. 50 en la preparación de hielo y chupetes. Noemí, es una madre que se desvive por sus hijos, es por ellos que a través del apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos sale adelante con sus hijas que son su razón de ser.

loans.use: Purchase of rice, noodles, and soft drinks

loans.name: Eshmahmad

texts.ru:
Eshmahmad A. is 51, has a college degree in economics, is married and has 6 children. Currently Eshmahmad works as an accountant in the dehkansk farming business called "A. Kodiri". He also has several acres of land. The obtained loan will allow Eshmahmad to purchase seeds. He plans to plant wheat, oat and onions on his land. He is thinking to sell part of his crops on the local market, which will allow the locals to purchase grain and onions at a lower price since the goods will go directly to the market without any intermediaries. The rest of the crops will be used to satisfy the needs of the family. Eshmahmad plans to repay his loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva voluntter

Алмухамедов Эшмахмад, возраст – 51 год, образование высшее, по специальности - экономист, женат, имеет 6-х детей. Эшмахмад в настоящее время работает в дехканско-фермерском хозяйстве под названием «А.Кодири» в должности бухгалтера, также клиент имеет несколько гектаров землию На полученный кредит Эшмахмад планирует пиробрести семена пшеницы, лука и овса для дальнейшего посева. Часть полученного урожая клиент планирует продать чтобы погасить кредит, другая часть кредита будет продана на местном рынке, что даст возможность местным жителям приобрести зерно и лук по более низким ценам, так как продукция на рынок поступит из первых рук, а оставшуюся часть клиент будет использовать для собственных нужд. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: acquire fuel, wheat seeds, oat seeds, onion seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Betty S.

texts.es:
Client History: Betty is a saleswoman and sells all types of products on order and collects payments daily. She does not have a fixed post and is a traveling saleswoman.

She lives in the Irpavi II zone of the city of La Paz.

This is the second time that she is requesting a loan. Her file qualifies her as a category 1 client, meaning that she repaid his loan on time. The requested amount will be used to purchase merchandise.

Her business enables her to receive this loan because she has experience in her business, which provides enough income to cover the loan.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Historia del Cliente: La señora Betty es comerciante y vende toda clase de productos a pedido y los cobros los realiza diariamente, no cuenta con un puesto fijo ya que es ambulante

Vive en la zona de Irpavi II de la ciudad de La Paz.

Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito. Su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de mercadería.

Su actividad comercial le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio. El cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of more merchandise to sell to her customers

loans.name: Obertilia

texts.es:
Mrs. Obertila belongs to the Lideres Triunfadoras (Triumphant Leaders) communal bank, and lives in the Calleria district of Ucayali, Peru. She is 49 years old, and a mother of two grown children. Her husband works, but his income does not cover the household expenses. That’s why Obertila invested her first loan from Manuela Ramos for S./300.00 in a small sewing shop where she makes women’s, men’s, and children’s clothing. Currently Obertila and her husband wake up very early to prepare breakfast and clean up the house. Then she opens the sewing shop and devotes herself to sewing the garments her customers ordered, as well as others to be sold in the store. With this loan for $750 that she will repay in 6 months, she will invest in expanding her business by purchasing a new sewing machine, a mending machine that will give her garments a better finish, as well as fabrics, threads of every color, elastic bands, lace, etc.

Obertila is very pleased, she told us, because she celebrated her birthday in the company of her friends at the communal bank and with her loved ones. She is overflowing with happiness at her good fortune to be part of Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Obertila pertenece al Banco Comunal Lideres Triunfadoras, vive en el Asentamiento Humano 15 de Julio Mz. H Lt. 11 del distrito Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 49 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos independientes, su esposo trabaja como empleado, pero el ingreso que tiene no alcanza para cubrir los gastos del hogar, es así que Obertila, con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00, decide invertir en un pequeño taller de costura, donde confecciona prendas para damas, caballeros y niños. Actualmente Obertila, junto con su esposo, se levantan muy temprano para preparar el desayuno, posteriormente realiza el aseo de su casa para después abrir su taller de costura y dedicarse a la confección de sus prendas, ya que trabaja con pedidos y también de forma particular para la venta casual. Con el préstamo de S/. 2.200, el cual pagará en 6 meses, invertirá en la ampliación de su negocio, ya que comprará una maquina de coser, una remalladora que le permita dar un mejor acabado de sus prendas, destinará S/. 200 en telas, S/. 50 en toda variedad de colores de hilo, S/. 20 en elásticos y S/. 20 en blondas, etc. Obertila, se siente muy feliz por que nos contó que celebró su cumpleaños con sus compañeras de su banco comunal y los seres que mas quiere, desbordando alegría por la suerte que tiene al estar en Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Purchase of hardware (sewing machine, mender). Purchase of materials (fabric, thread, elastic, lace).

loans.name: Víctor

texts.es:
Don Victor is a very honorable person with a large sense of responsibility in his life. Since he was very small he has worked in agricultural activities. His parents left him their lands in an inheritance, as well as their knowledge of such things. Today he is a responsible father that assumes his role as the provider for his family. He is the boss of his home but he is not authoritarian. His leadership abilities help him to be able to organize any type of committee to benefit his community. Victor has worked in agriculture for around twenty years. Recently the harvests were jeopardized by inclement weather but even with that he continued persevering with the sowing of potato, beans and oats. He is motivated by his wife and 4 children. He seeks to intensify his activities in raising animals so that they can become another way of maintaining his home. To do this he will buy a cow to fatten it up and sell it later. All his efforts are so that his children can have an education. He has a desire to see them succeed. Help this father to fight for the improvement of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Víctor, es una persona honorable con mucho sentido de responsabilidad en su vida, desde muy pequeño ha trabajado en las actividades agrícolas, ya que sus padres le dejaron como herencia sus tierras y también sus conocimientos en estos temas. Hoy es un padre responsable que asume a cabalidad sus roles en el sostenimiento de su familia, él es jefe de su hogar pero no por ello es autoritario y sus habilidades para el liderazgo le ayudan a poder organizar cualquier comité a favor de su comunidad.Víctor lleva trabajando en la agricultura alrededor de veinte años, últimamente las cosechas fueron perjudicadas por la inclemente fuerza del invierno pero aún así seguirá perseverando en la siembra de papa, olluco, habas y avena. Su fuerza es motivada por su esposa y sus cuatro hijos.Desea intensificar sus actividades en la crianza de animales para que este se convierta en un sostén más en la economía de su hogar, para ello comprará una vaca para engordarla y luego venderla, todos los esfuerzos los realiza a favor de la educación de sus hijos que albergan muchos deseos de superación.Apoya a este padre de familia a luchar por la superación de su familia.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of small animals and the food to feed them

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es:
Client History: Saturnina sells blankets and works with groups that buy the blankets that she makes on order.

She lives in the Irpavi II zone of the city of La Paz.

This is the second time that she is requesting a loan. Her file qualifies her as a category 1 client, meaning that she repaid his loan on time. The amount requested will be used to buy fabric to make her blankets.

Her work enables her to receive this loan because she has experience in her business. This business produces enough income to cover the loan and her personal needs.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Historia del Cliente: La señora Saturnina vende mantas y trabaja con los grupos que le compran las mantas que elabora a pedido.

Vive en la zona de Irpavi II de la ciudad de La Paz.

Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito. Su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de tela para elaborar sus mantas.

Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio y esto le da ingresos suficientes para cubrir el préstamo y sus necesidades personales.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric to make blankets

loans.name: Alisa

texts.en:
Alisa is 23 years old and an unemployed mother. Her husband is employed in a local sawmill. He does not have insurance and works for daily wage of only 15 KM. They have two children who are ages 5 and 3 years old.
This is the second time that Alisa is requesting a loan from Women for Women International. With her first loan,  she purchased herself a cow and now she needs additional money to buy hay for the cow.

loans.use: For buying hay

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga belongs to the Lideres Triunfadoras (Winning Leaders) Communal Bank. She lives at Jr. 3 D. Febrero Mz. G Lt. 3 in the district of Calleria in Ucayali. She is 52-years-old, and is the mother of 6 children, who are all adults. Her husband is a merchant, but his income isn't enough to cover all of their home's expenses. This is why Olga, with the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, decided to invest in a small grocery store.

Presently, Olga gets up very early to open her store, to which she attends with her children and husband. With this loan of 1,800 nuevos soles, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy a sack of rice, a sack of sugar, a large box of milk, a packet of oil, a box of noodles, and 6 crates of eggs.

Olga is a very charismatic person and feels very happy because her store is growing thanks to the growth from her loan. Through the efforts she puts forth as a mother, woman, and wife, she also feels proud of supporting the well-being of her family thanks to Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Olga pertenece al Banco Comunal Lideres Triunfadoras, vive en el Jr. 3 D. Febrero Mz. G Lt. 3 del distrito Calleria, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 52 años D. edad, es madre D. 6 hijos, todos mayores D. edad, su esposo es comerciante, pero el ingreso que tiene no alcanza para cubrir los gastos del hogar, es así que Olga, con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos deciD. invertir en una pequeña bodega.

En la actualidad ella se levanta muy temprano para abrir su bodega, que atienD. junto con sus hijos y esposo. Con el préstamo D. S/. 1.800, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará un saco D. arroz, un saco D. azúcar, una caja D. leche granD., un paquete D. aceite, una caja D. fideos, seis jabas D. huevos.

Olga, es una persona muy carismática y se siente muy feliz que su bodega crezca gracias al incremento D. su préstamo, a su esfuerzo que realiza como madre, mujer y esposa, también se siente orgullosa D. aportar para el bienestar D. su familia y todo gracias a Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise (rice, sugar, milk, oil, noodles, and eggs)

loans.name: Ujamoral Kafakh Group

texts.fr:
Our objective is to combat the rural exodus and poverty that characterizes our region. We intend to buy essential goods that we will then sell locally, given that we live on an island with very poor access. With this aim in mind, we decided to form a group to work together in order to create a sustainable business.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Notre objectif est de lutter contre l'exode rurale et la pauvreté qui caractérise notre zone. Ainsi nous comptons acheter des produits de premières nécessités que nous nous proposons de vendre dans le marché local, vu que nous habitons une île qui est très enclavée. C'est dans ce cadre que nous avons décidé de nous constituer en groupe pour travailler ensemble afin de créer une emtreprise durable.

loans.use: To buy essential goods, fishing products and foodstuffs

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosita is a member of the community bank Atenas Portillanas. She lives in the housing development Pedro Portillo in the Callería district in the department (region) of Ucayali. She is 53 years old and the mother of 7 children, all independent now. She is separated, but her income doesn't cover her household expenses. As a result, with the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, for 300 soles (Peruvian currency) , Rosita decided to invest in a seamstress shop making clothes for women, men and children.

Currently Rosita along with her children are doing well with the sales of the clothing she makes. Every day she has to sew 2 or 3 dresses, since she works on order. To fill her orders she works into the wee hours of the night in order to meet her commitments to her clients.

This loan for 1900 soles, which she will repay in 6 months, will buy 200 soles in cloth, 20 in elastic, 20 in lace, 20 in satin ribbon and 20 in thread.

Rosita is a very enterprising woman with a tremendous desire to get ahead. Thanks to those characteristics and Manuela Ramos she is able to work managing her own business and her own clients. She feels very happy and proud.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Rosita pertenece al Banco Comunal Atenas Portillanas, vive en el Asentamiento Humano Pedro Portillo Mz. C Lt. 02 del distrito Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 53 años de edad, es madre de 7 hijos todos independientes, es separada, pero el ingreso que tiene no alcanza para cubrir los gastos del hogar, es así que Rosita, con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00, decide invertir en un taller de costura de ropas para damas, caballeros y niños.

Actualmente Rosita, junto a sus hijos, salen adelante con la venta de la ropa que confeccionan. Diariamente tiene que coser de 2 a 3 vestidos, ya que trabaja con pedidos, para eso ella se desvela hasta altas horas de la noche para terminar su último pedido y cumplir con sus clientas.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,900, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará S/. 200 en telas, S/. 20 en elásticos, S/. 20 en blondas, S/. 20 cintas satinadas y S/. 20 en hilos.

Rosita es una señora muy emprendedora, con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es así que gracias a Manuela Ramos puede trabajar manejando su propio negocio y sus propios clientes. Se siente muy feliz y orgullosa.

loans.use: Purchase of  materials (cloth, elastic, lace, satin ribbon and thread)

loans.name: Esther M.

texts.es:
Esther lives in Manzano B, Patio 4 in the Rio Seco zone of the city of El Alto.

Her and her daughter sell food in the city's markets. She lives with her eldest daughter who is separated from her husband and has 5 kids.

She will use the credit to hire laborers and buy construction materials so that their home can have a gas supply.

This is their first credit with IMPRO, and the evaluation that was carried out qualifies them for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Esther vive en el manzano B Patio 4 de la zona Río Seco, de La ciudad de El Alto. Trabaja junto a su hija vendiendo alimentos en los mercados de la ciudad. Vive junto a su hija mayor quien se encuentra separada de su esposo y tiene 5 hijos. El crédito será invertido en la contratación de mano de obra y material de construcción, para la conexión de gas a su domicilio. Es el primer crédito con Impro. La evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito

loans.use: Construction materials so that gas can be connected to their house/Material de construccion para la conexion de gas a su casa.

loans.name: Salamah

texts.id:
Salamah is a hard-working mother. She can cover the family's living expense using the profit earned from selling food business. Her husband also helps her business. With the capital of Rp 500,000 (about $53) per day, she can earn profit of Rp 50,000 (about $5.3) if she sells all the food dishes. Salamah is pregnant at the moment so that she cannot travel to offer the food. She wants to open a new business to sell Nasi Lalap (rice with salad). She plans to hire 2 more people to help the business. She already has a stand to sell Nasi Lalap. Her husband will continue the selling food business. With the capital of Rp 4,500,000 (about $478), she hopes she can increase the profit of the food business so that she can have more capital for the Nasi Lalap business.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Salamah adalah seorang ibu yang giat dan rajin bekerja. Usaha Jual Sayur yang digelutinya mampu mencukupi kebutuhan hidup keluarga. Dia dibantu oleh suami. Modal Rp 500.000,00/hari akan memberikan keuntungan usaha sebesar Rp 50.000,00. Hal itu apabila semua barang dagangan habis. Salamah saat ini hamil, kondisi tersebut tentu tidak memungkinkan baginya untuk berjualan keliling. Dia ingin membuka usaha baru, yaitu Jual Nasi Lalapan. Dia berencana untuk mengajak 2 orang yang akan membantunya berjualan. Saat ini dia sudah memiliki rombong untuk berjualan Nasi Lalapan. Sedangkan suaminya melanjutkan Usaha Jual Sayur. Modal usaha sebesar Rp 4.500.000 dia harapkan dapat meningkatkan keuntungan Usaha Jual Sayur dan untuk modal Usaha Nasi Lalapan.

loans.use: For capital

loans.name: Ujamoral Massoumé Group

texts.fr:
We are a group of women who decided to start a business in order to support our families. We live in a very hemmed-in area where it is very difficult to find what people need. What we intend to do is provide goods to neighboring islands that have the same or even more difficulty than us in getting staples such as cosmetics, which all women of the region need.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Nous sommes un groupe de femmes décidées à faire du commerce pour pouvoir soutenir notre famille. Nous habitons un endroit très enclavé où il est très difficile de trfouver ce que les gens ont besoin/ Ce que nous comptons faire, c'est de pouvoir fournir du matériel dans les îles aui avoisinent la nôtre et qui ont les mêmes difficultés ,voir plus de difficultés que nous pour accéder aux produits de grande consomation telles que les produits cosmétiques que toutes les femmes de la zone ont besoin

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and women’s lingerie, and children’s clothing

loans.name: Juancito

texts.es:
Juancito lives on the Avenida Union Fatima in the Villa Cooperativa zone of the city of El Alto.

He lives with his mother and brothers. He works as a transport assistant in the city of El Alto.

He will use the credit to buy some raw materials to fix up his room and therefore improve his quality of life.

This is his second credit with IMPRO, and the evaluation carried out qualifies him for another loan. The last credit was paid in full and on time.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Juancito vive en la Avenida Union Fatima zona Villa Cooperativa de la ciudad de El Alto. Vive junto a su madre y hermanos. Trabaja como ayudante en un vehiculo de transporte en la ciudad de El Alto. El crédito lo destinara para la compra algunos materiales para hacer pequeños arreglos y refacciones en su habitación y así mejorar su calidad de vida. Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo. El crédito anterior fue cancelado de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.

loans.use: To refurbish the room he sleeps in/Refaccion de la habitación donde duerme

loans.name: Safrida

texts.id:
Before Safrida started her own Padang food business, she worked in a Padang food restaurant. Due to her persistence and her own capital, she started the food shop with her husband. Now she already has regular customers. She buys the materials (meat and fish) in Badung market every morning. She opens the food shop from 10am to 10pm. The profit is Rp 200,000 (about $21) per week. The loan capital will be used for capital and rent fee.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.
