Sebelum Safrida mempunyai Usaha Jual Makanan (masakan padang) sendiri, ia bekerja di sebuah warung makan padang. Berkat keuletan dan modal yang ia miliki, ia bersama suami membuka warung makan. Hasilnya sampai saat ini dia sudah memiliki langganan tetap. Ia membeli semua bahan – bahan yang ia perlukan (sayur daging maupun ikan) di Pasar Badung setiap pagi. Warung ia buka mulai pukul 10.00 sampai dengan 22.00. Keuntungannya Rp 200.000,00/minggu. Pinjaman modal senilai Rp 1.000.000,00 akan ia pakai untuk modal usaha dan sewa tempat .

loans.use: For capital and rent fee

loans.name: Nursiti

texts.id:
Nursiti deals with garbage every day. Together with her kid, she starts patrolling with her carriage in Ubung market and Pidada area from 6am to look for second-hand goods. She arrives at home at 9am and then she cooks for the family. In the afternoon, Nursiti sorts the goods. Sometimes she buys cardboard from the shops around Ubung. In the evening, she sells the goods to second-hand collectors. Her profit is Rp 35,000 (about $3.7) per day. She uses it for the business continuation, for her saving, and sometimes for her parents in Java. She runs this business together with her kid. She uses a carriage and a motorcycle. She has to help covering the daily expense of Rp 15,000 ($about 1.6) and the rent fee.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Bergaul dengan sampah merupakan pekerjaan Nursiti setiap hari. Pukul 06.00 dia sudah berkeliling dengan gerobak bersama anaknya untuk mencari barang bekas di seputaran Pasar Ubung dan wilayah Pidada. Pukul 09.00 dia sampai di rumah dan langsung memasak untuk anak dan keluarganya. Setiap siang hari Nursiti menyortir setiap barang yang didapatinya. Kadang dia juga membeli kardus dari toko - toko di seputaran ubung. Sore ia menjual barang – barang bekas yang didapatinya kepada pengepul. Keuntungan usaha Rp 35.000,00/hari yang ia peroleh diputar untuk modal usaha, juga untuk ditabung dan dikirim ke Jawa untuk orang tuanya. Bersama dengan anaknya Nursiti menekuni usaha ini. Sarana yang digunakan adalah gerobak dan sepeda motor. Biaya hidup per hari Rp 15.000,00 dan biaya kontrak tempat tinggal mereka tanggung bersama.

loans.use: To purchase second-hand goods

loans.name: Yovana Mirian

texts.es:
Mrs. Yovana is member of the communal bank, Mujeres Emprendedoras del Mercado (Entrepreneuring Women of the Market) in Huaraz. She works selling beef and prepared burger patties. Her business is located in the central market of Huaraz, Ancash department.

With this loan for S/. 300.00 (US$ 125 approx.), which will be paid in 4 months, she will buy meat wholesale to sell retail.

She is 23 years old, living in common-law marriage, and has a little boy who is 2 and a half years old. Her husband works in the mine as a laborer, and in his days off he helps out in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Yovana es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras del Mercado” de Huaraz, se dedica a la venta de carne roja (carne de res) y hamburguesa preparadas, su negocio esta ubicado en el Mercado central de Huaraz, del Departamento de Ancash.

Con este préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará carne por gancho (media res/al por mayor) para luego vender al por menor.

Ella tiene 23 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo pequeño de dos años y medio, su esposo trabaja en la mina como obrero y en sus días libres la apoya en el negocio.

loans.use: Buying beef wholesale (Compra de carne de res al por mayor.)

loans.name: Asnia

texts.id:
Asnia lives together with her mother, Fatima in Bali. Her husband and her children live in Java. She has food kiosk business in Bali. Besides selling rice dishes, she also provides drinks such as juice drinks and coffee, fried banana, spring roll, crackers and bread. Once every 2 days, she goes to Badung market to buy the materials, but sometimes she gets the suppliers to deliver the materials to her kiosk. She earns daily profit of Rp 15,000 (about $1.6). She uses the profit for the business continuation and also for her children's education (Rp 200,000 - about $21 per month). She lives with her mother who sells second-hand goods with earning of Rp 25,000 (about $2.6) per day. She shares the living and rent expenses with her mother.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Asnia bersama ibunya - Fatima - tinggal di bali. Sementara suami dan anak – anaknya tinggal di Jawa. Usaha yang ia tekuni semenjak tinggal di Bali adalah Usaha Warung Makanan. Selain menjual nasi ia juga menyediakan, antara lain : minuman berupa juice dan kopi, pisang goreng, lumpia krupuk dan roti. Setiap dua hari sekali ia pergi ke Pasar Badung untuk membeli barang dagangannya, tapi kadang ada juga suplier yang langsung membawakan barang ke warung tempat ia berjualan. Per hari ia mendapatkan keuntungan Rp 15.000,00. Dari keuntungan yang diperoleh, selain untuk modal usaha dia juga kirim ke Jawa untuk pendidikan anak – anaknya Rp 200.000,00/bulan. Dia tinggal bersama Ibunya yang berjualan barang bekas dengan penghasilan Rp 25.000,00 per harinya. Biaya hidup dan biaya kontrak dia tanggung bersama ibunya.

loans.use: To add more capital

loans.name: Tuzla

texts.es:
Mrs. Tuzla is member of the communal bank, Mujeres Emprendedoras del Mercado (Entrepreneuring Women of the Market) in Huaraz. She works selling beef. Her business is located in the central market of Huaraz, Ancash department.

With this loan for S/. 300.00 (US$ 125 approx.), which will be paid in 4 months, she will buy meat wholesale to sell retail.

She is 42 years old, married, and has 3 children. Two of her daughters are in Lima, studying in college, one of them studying dentistry, and the other daughter is studying systems. She lives with her youngest son and with her husband who helps her out in the business because he is unemployed.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Tuzla es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras del Mercado” D. Huaraz, se dedica a la venta D. carne roja (carne D. res), su negocio esta ubicado en el Mercado central D. Huaraz, del Departamento D. Ancash.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará carne por gancho (media res/al por mayor) para venderla al por menor.

Ella tiene 42 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos, dos D. sus hijas están en Lima estudiando en la universidad, una D. ellas odontología y la otra estudia sistemas. Ella vive con su hijo menor y con su esposo, quien le ayuda en este negocio debido a que no tiene trabajo.

loans.use: Buying beef wholesale (Compra de carne de res al por mayor.)

loans.name: Sonia Nancy

texts.es:
Mrs. Sonia is member of the communal bank, "Mujeres Trabajadoras del Campo Ferial" (Hardworking Women of the Camp Fair). She works selling fruits in a stand located in the Yungay market, Ancash department.

With this loan for S/. 800.00, which will be paid in 4 months, she will buy 2 boxes of apples, 2 boxes of mandarin oranges, 1 hundred bananas, and 2 boxes of oranges.

She is 34 years old, living in common-law marriage, and has 5 children. Her husband works in transportation as a driver, and they both support each other to educate their children and keep their household moving forward.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Sonia es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Trabajadoras del Campo Ferial”, se dedica a la venta de frutas, está ubicado en el mercado de Yungay del Departamento de Ancash.

Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará 2 cajas de manzana, 2 cajas de mandarina, 1 ciento de plátanos y 2 cajas de naranja.

Ella tiene 34 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos, su esposo es chofer (transportista) y ambos se apoyan mutuamente para educar a sus hijos y sacar adelante su hogar.

loans.use: Buying fruits wholesale (Compra de frutas al por mayor.)

loans.name: Inon

texts.id:
Inon could see a good business prospect in Bali. The construction workers need to consume more drink. She saw many construction workers in her neighborhood in Bali. Since 2 years ago, she started selling soft drink and juice drinks. The selling place that she chose is quite strategic because many construction workers work near the area. The fruits (for the juice drinks) are bought in Badung market and Anyar Sari market. The bottled and canned drinks are ordered from a drink supplier. Her profit is Rp 50,000 (about $5.3) per day. Besides putting it into the saving, she also use the profit to add more merchandise and to cover her daily expenses which are the house/shop rent fee and living expenses of Rp 20,000 (about $2) per day.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Inon melihat prospek yang bagus di Bali. Pekerja proyek memerlukan lebih banyak cairan. Sedangkan pekerja proyek di Bali sudah menjadi pemandangan yang akrab. Sejak 2 tahun yang lalu dia menekuni Usaha Jual Minuman dan Aneka Juice. Tempat yang dia pilih cukup strategis, karena banyak pekerja proyek yang bekerja di sekitar tempat usahanyanya. Buah – buah untuk bahan membuat juice ia beli di Pasar Badung dan di Pasar Anyar Sari. Sedangkan minuman botol dan kaleng diantar oleh suplier minuman. Dari keuntungan Rp 50.000,00/hari yang diperoleh selain untuk ditabung juga dipakai untuk menambah barang dagangan dan biaya sehari – hari. Biaya kontrak ruko sebagai tempat tinggal sekaligus tempat usaha dan biaya hidup per hari sebesar Rp 20.000,00 termasuk dalam pengeluaran rutinnya.

loans.use: To add more merchandise

loans.name: Silvia Juana

texts.es:
Mrs. Silvia belongs to the communal bank Señor Cautivo II (captive Lord). She works selling spices. Her business is located in the market of the Huaraz province, Ancash department.

With this loan for S/. 600.00 (US$ 225, approx.), which will be paid in 6 parts, she will buy a half sack of red and yellow hot pepper, half a sack of panca pepper, half a box of vinegar, and half a box of soy sauce.

Mrs. Silvia is 33 years old, she is married and has two children. Her husband helps her in this business and her income is used to cover household expenses and her child's education.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Silvia pertenece al Banco Comunal Señor Cautivo II, se dedica a la venta de especierías, su negocio está ubicado en el mercado de la provincia de Huaraz, Departamento de Ancash.

Con este préstamo de S/. 600.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará medio saco de ají amarillo y colorado, medio saco de ají panca, media caja de vinagre y media caja de sillao.

Ella tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos, su esposo le apoya en este negocio y sus ingreso es para solventar los gastos del hogar y la educación de sus hijo.

loans.use: Buying peppers, vinegar, etc. (Compra de ajíes, vinagre, etc.)

loans.name: Kacoumpa1 Group

texts.fr:
We are a group of women who live in the village of Loudia and were granted a loan that we have finished repaying. We want to carry on with this business as we realize that the products that we sell have great appeal to the local population, who can easily find what they need without having to travel many miles to get supplies. Thanks to the experience we have gained, we are on the right path to continuing our business activity.

 Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.


Nous sommes un groupe de femmes qui habite le village de Loudia et avons eu à bénéficier d'un prêt bque 

nous avons fini de rembourser/ C'est toujours dans le même régistre d'activité que nous voulons continuer 

d'exercer, car nous nous sommes rendues compte que les produits que nous commercialisons intéressent 

beaucoup les populations locales, qui trouvent facilement ce dont elles ont besoin sans être obligées de f

aire des kilomètres pour se ravitailler/ Ainsi donc; grâce à l'expérience que nous avons acquises; nous 

sommes sur la bonne voie pour continuer nos activités.

loans.use: To buy essentials goods and general foods

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Mrs. Ruth is member of the communal bank, Mujeres Al Desarrollo de Pariahuanca (Women for the Development of Pariahuanca). She works selling grains wholesale, such as wheat, different varieties of corn, wheat bran, and corn bran. Her business is located at the fair in the Huaraz province, Ancash department. She sells on Mondays and Thursdays.

With this loan for S/.1,800.00, which will be paid in 6 parts, she will buy 4 sacks of Cuzco corn and 4 sacks of wheat to make the corn and wheat bran; she will also buy 5 sacks of corn to make dried popcorn.

Mrs. Ruth is 22 years old, living in common-law marriage, and has a child. Her husband works in transportation, offering a service of mass transport for the professors in the area. He helps his wife making the brans and transporting the products to the fair.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Ruth es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Al Desarrollo de Pariahuanca”, se dedica a la venta de granos, trigo, maíz de diferentes variedades y pelado de trigo y de maíz al por mayor, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la feria de la provincia de Huaraz, Departamento de Ancash, vende los días lunes y jueves.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,800.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará 4 sacos de maíz cuzqueño y 4 sacos de trigo para hacer pelado de maíz y trigo, también comprará 5 sacos de maíz para cancha.

Ella tiene 22 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene un hijo, su esposo es transportista y hace servicio de colectivos para los profesores de la zona, apoya a su esposa haciendo el pelado de los granos y el traslado de sus productos a la feria.

loans.use: Buying grains wholesale (Compra de granos al por mayor.)

loans.name: Dwijo

texts.id:
Dwijo is running this business with 2 grinding machines. Everyday he receives order to grind 'pecel' (Indonesian mixture of nuts and spices), satay, and grated coconut spice. One coconut costs Rp. 1,000 (about $0.1). In a day, he can earn Rp 30,000 - Rp 50,000 (about $3 - $5). He needs Rp 3,000,000 (about $318) to repair the broken grinding machine. His wife is selling satay at night. Dwijo and his wife are helping each other to earn money. They work for the sake of their 3 children.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Dengan 2 buah mesin giling yang dimiliki, Dwijo menekuni usahanya. Setiap hari dia mendapatkan pesanan untuk menggiling bumbu pecel, sate dan parut kelapa. Satu butir kelapa seharga Rp 1.000,00. Dalam satu hari dia bisa mendapatkan keuntungan Rp 30.000,00 – Rp 50.000,00. Dia membutuhkan dana senilai Rp 3.000.000,00 untuk memperbaiki mesin gilingnya yang rusak. Isterinya berjualan sate di malam hari. Mereka saling membantu dalam bekerja. Hal in mereka lakukan demi anak – anak. Anak mereka 3 orang.

loans.use: To repair the broken grinding machine

loans.name: Alejandrina Marilu

texts.es:
Mrs. Alejandra is a member of the communal bank Mujeres Emprendedoras del Mercado (Entrepreneuring Women of the Market). She works selling tamales (a typical dish of the region). Her business is located in front of the central market of Huaraz, Ancash department.

With this loan for S/. 300.00 (US$ 125 approx.), which will be paid in 4 months, she will buy 1 sack of corn flour, 1 box of eggs, and 1 barrel of olives.

Mrs. Alejandra is 40 years old; she is separated from her husband and has two children, one of whom is in college and her daughter helps her out in the business. Her income allows her to offer her children education.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Alejandrina es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras del Mercado” de Huaraz, por las mañanas se dedica a la venta tamales (comida típica de la zona), su negocio está ubicado al frente del Mercado central de Huaraz, del Departamento de Ancash.

Con este préstamo de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará 1 saco de harina de maíz, una caja de huevo y 1 barril de aceituna.

Ella tiene 40 años de edad, está separada de su esposo y tiene 2 hijos, uno de ellos estudia en la universidad y su hija la apoya en el negocio. Sus ingresos le permite educar a sus hijos.

loans.use: Buying ingredients (Compra de insumos.)

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Ana is a member of the bank, “Banco Comunal Señor del Cautivo II”. She sells lingerie and started her business 6 years ago in the city of Huaraz with her husband.

With this loan of 1,300 soles, which will be repaid in 6 months, she’ll be able to get her business ready for the Christmas holidays. She’ll buy 12 dozen floral decorations for Christmas and 15 dozen Christmas presents.

Her wish is to grow her business. Two months ago she opened a telephone business that her husband administers.

Ana is a married, 47 year old with no children. The income she makes allows her to cover the costs of living, like for example, the cost of renting her house and her sales kiosks.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Ana pertenece al Banco Comunal Señor del Cautivo II, se dedica a la venta de lencería, hace 6 años inicio su negocio en la ciudad de Huaraz conjuntamente con su esposo.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,300.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, podrá surtir su negocio para las fiestas navideñas, comprará 12 docenas de adornos florales para esta Navidad y 15 docenas de regalos navideños.

Su deseo es crecer cada vez mas, hace dos meses ha aperturado un locutorio para que su esposo lo administre.

La señora Ana tiene 47 años de edad y está casada, no tiene hijos; sus ingresos le permite satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar, como por ejemplo el alquiler de su casa y alquiler de sus puestos de venta.

loans.use: To buy floral decorations. To buy Christmas presents.

loans.name: Lalu

texts.id:
Lalu uses a basic cart to sell Es Kelapa Muda (a popular sweet drink made from the clear juice and meat of a young coconut). When the weather is warm he can sell approximately 20 to 30 coconuts at a price of 2,000 to 2,500 Rupiah each. Lalu increases his price when he is in his strategic selling location next to a school. He brings in approximately 30,000 Rupiah per day. However, during the rainy season, when it is not as hot, his sales dry up. To overcome this problem, he sells small snacks instead. Lalu, and his wife who works with him, would like to borrow 1,000,000 Rupiah to purchase more snacks to sell during cool weather. They must make at least 15,000 Rupiah per day to meet their living expenses including raising their only child.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Courtenay Teska Race, Kiva Volunteer.

Lalu menggunakan rombong yang sederhana untuk berjualan es kelapa muda. Rata – rata dia bisa menjual 20 – 30 butir kelapa muda dalam cuaca panas dengan harga per butirnya Rp 2.000,00 – Rp 2.500,00, ditambah lagi lokasinya strategis, yaitu dekat dengan sekolah. Keuntungan rata- rata per hari Rp 30.000,00. Namun, di saat musim hujan dagangannya menjadi sepi. Untuk mengatasi hal ini dia menjual makanan ringan. Dia memerlukan pinjaman sebesar Rp 1.000.000,00. Lalu berjualan bersama dengan isterinya. Mereka harus memenuhi biaya hidup Rp 15.000,00 dan menghidupi anak semata wayang mereka.

loans.use: to help grow his business and to purchase more snacks to sell

loans.name: Azucena Eusebia

texts.es:
Mrs. Azucena belongs to the communal bank Señor del Cautivo II (lord of the captive). She works selling spices wholesale and retail. Her stand is located in the market of the Huaraz province, Ancash department. In addition to having her sales stand, she distributes these products to large stores in the city of Huaraz.

With this loan of S/. 1,300.00 (US$ 450 approx.), which will be paid in 6 months, she will buy 10 sacks of red dried peppers, 10 sacks of yellow dried peppers, 3 sacks of green pepper, 1 sack of pepper and cumin, 1 box of soy sauce, and 1 box of vinegar.

Mrs. Azucena is a single mother of two children, and she is 39 years old. Her daughter helps her out in the business. Her income has allowed them to build a small house and to educate her children.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Azucena, pertenece al Banco Comunal Señor del Cautivo II, se dedica a la venta de especiería al por mayor y menor, su puesto de venta esta ubicado en el Mercado de la Provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash. Además de tener su puesto de venta, ella reparte estos productos en las tiendas grandes de la ciudad de Huaraz

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,300.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará 10 sacos de ají seco colorado, 10 sacos de ají seco amarillo, 3 sacos de ají verde, 1 saco de pimienta y comino, 1 caja de sillao y 1 caja de vinagre.

Ella es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos, tiene 39 años de edad. En este negocio le apoya su hija, sus ingresos le ha permitido construir una pequeña casa y además educar a sus hijos.

loans.use: Buying dried peppers, soy sauce, etc. (spices). (Compra de ajíes, sillao, etc. (especierías))

loans.name: Luz Jacqueline

texts.es:
Mrs. Luz Jacqueline belongs to the communal bank La Amistad (friendship). She lives in the Jr. El Dorado #232, Moyabamba district and province, San Martin department. She rents a stand in the central market of Moyabamba in which she sells breakfasts such as juanes (a rice-based dish similar to a tamale wrapped in bijao or banana leaves), tacacho con cecina (barbecued bananas mashed into balls, with dry meat), chorizo, and drinks like coffee, oatmeal, and different flavors of tea. Her sales have increased because of the careful attention she offers her customers, and this motivates her to improve every day. She decided to start her business because she likes cooking and being financially independent, as well as helping out with the expenses required to support her family.

With this loan of S/. 2,000.00 (US$ 675 approx), which will be paid in 4 months, she will buy sacks of sugar and rice, gallons of oil, and other ingredients required daily in her business. With part of it she will help her husband buy a motorcycle to generate more income.

Mrs. Luz Jacqueline is 33 years old, lives with her husband and two children, a boy and a girl, and is very happy in spite of the enormous effort required to attend both her household and business activities. She has the support of her husband and children with the housework, and she takes advantage of the afternoons to do housework herself. Her goal is to have her own food stand.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Luz Jacqueline pertenece del Banco comunal La Amistad, vive en el Jr. El Dorado No 232, del Distrito y Provincia provincia de Moyabamba, departamento de San Martín. Tiene alquilado un puesto en el mercado central de Moyabamba en donde vende desayunos como juanes, tacacho con cecina, chorizo, bebidas para tomar como café, avena y te de diferentes sabores, por la buena atención que brinda a sus clientes sus ventas aumentaron, lo cual la motiva a seguir mejorando cada día. Decidió iniciar su negocio porque le gusta cocinar, ser independiente económicamente y apoyar en los gastos que requiere para sacar adelante a su familia. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará arroz, azúcar en sacos, aceite en galones y los demás ingredientes que necesita a diario en su negocio. Con una parte apoyara a su esposo en la compra de un motocar (moto) para generar mas ingresos. La señora Luz Jacqueline tiene 33 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos, un varón y una mujer, esta contenta, a pesar del enorme esfuerzo que tiene que hacer para poder atender las actividades de la casa y del negocio, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo e hijos con las actividades de la casa, ella aprovecha la tarde para realizar las actividades domesticas. Su meta es contar con un puesto propio.

loans.use: Buying supplies and ingredients; buying a motorcart. (Compra  de insumos e ingredientes.  Compra de un motocar.)

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es:
Mrs. Blanca Rosa belongs to the communal bank, La Amistad (friendship). She lives in the Jr. Damian Najar C-1 of the Moyabamba district and province, San Martin department. She rents a stand in the central market of Moyabamba in which she sells food, especially beef leg soup and some regional dishes. Thanks to her hard work and to the careful attention she gives to her customers, her sales have increased, which motivates her to strive to improve every day. She decided to start her business because she likes cooking, it is something she enjoys doing. In addition, she also likes having her own income to increase her self-esteem, grow as a person and as a woman, and help out with the expenses necessary to support her children who are still studying.

With this loan for S/. 1,000.00 (US$350 approx.) that will be paid in 4 months, Mrs. Blanca will buy sacks of rice and sugar, gallons of oil, dried legumes, and other ingredients she needs daily in her business, in addition to buying plates, glasses, and flatware to give a better service to her customers who visit her every day.

Mrs. Blanca is 37 years old, lives with her husband and four children, all boys, and is happy in spite of the effort necessary to attend to both her household and business activities. She relies on the support of her husband and children who help with the housework, and she does housework in the afternoons. Her goal is to have her own locale for the business because this will give her more stability.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Blanca Rosa pertenece del Banco comunal La Amistad, vive en el Jr. Damián Najar C-1 del distrito y provincia de Moyabamba, departamento de San Martín, ella tiene alquilado un puesto en el mercado central de Moyabamba en donde vende comida, especialmente sopa de pata de res y algunas comidas de la región. Gracias a su empeño y buena atención que les brinda a sus clientes sus ventas aumentaron, lo que le motiva a seguir mejorando cada día. Decidió iniciar su negocio porque le gusta cocinar, es algo que disfruta hacer, además le gusta generar sus propios ingresos para alimentar su autoestima, crecer como persona y mujer y apoyar en los gastos que requiere para sacar adelante a sus hijos que aun están estudiando.

Con este préstamo S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará arroz, azúcar en sacos, aceite en galones, menestras de diferentes variedades y los demás ingredientes que necesita a diario en su negocio, además comprará mas platos, vasos y cubiertos para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes que le visitan a diario.

La señora Blanca tiene 37 años, vive con sus esposo y sus 4 hijos, todos varones, está contenta a pesar del esfuerzo que tiene que hacer para poder atender las actividades de la casa y del negocio, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo e hijos quienes le apoyan en las actividades de la casa, ella aprovecha la tarde para realizar las actividades domesticas. Su meta es contar con un puesto propio para su negocio, esto le dará más seguridad.

loans.use: Buying ingredients and tableware (Compra de insumos y vajilla.)

loans.name: Suraji

texts.id:
Suraji, originally from Gresik, travels around on his motorcycle selling household products. He already has 750,000 Rupiah in capitol, which he has been able to use to make approximately 80,000 Rupiah per day. Now he would like to borrow an additional 3,000,000 Rupiah in anticipation of the increased prices of household goods. With the additional capitol he also plans to increase his stock of goods beyond what he has done in the past. Suraji's wife makes feather dusters which she sells along with their other merchandise. She brings in 20,000 Rupiah per day from her sales of feather dusters alone. Both Suraji and his wife work to improve their future, especially for the sake of the most important person in their life, their child who is currently in 4th grade.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Courtenay Teska Race, Kiva Volunteer.

Pendatang dari Gresik ini mempunyai usaha menjual alat – alat rumah tangga. Dia berkeliling untuk berjualan dengan mengendarai sepeda motor. Dari modal Rp 750.000,00/hari dia mendapatkan keuntungan Rp 80.000,00. Saat ini dia membutuhkan pinjaman Rp 3.000.000,00 mengantisipasi kenaikan harga barang. Jadi dia menyediakan stok barang dalam jumlah yang besar terlebih dahulu. Isterinya membuat kemucing. Kemucing ini dijual bersama barang dagangan yang lain. Dia mendapat keuntungan Rp 20.00,00/hari dari hasil penjualan kemucing saja. Mereka berdua bekerja untuk masa depan mereka, terlebih demi buah hati mereka yang saat ini masih duduk di bangku kelas 4 Sekolah Dasar (SD).

loans.use: increase stock of household products for sale

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Mrs. Esther belongs to the communal bank “Mujeres Virtuosas” (“Virtuous Women”) and lives in the Calleria district. She is 41 years old, is separated, and has 4 children. Two of her children now live independently, and two still depend greatly on her. Although her children help her out in their free time, she was still not able to make ends meet. With the first loan of 300 soles from Manuela Ramos, Esther decided to invest in the purchase and sale of vegetables at retail.

Currently, Esther has a location in market #2 where she sells her products. She rises at dawn to go purchase her products and arrive at her post early to take care of her customers. In the afternoons, she rests and takes care of her family.

With the loan of 1,500 soles, to be repaid over a six month period, she will buy goods such as potatoes, onions, tomatoes, lemons, peppers, carrots, garlic, etc. She is considering opening a store in her house.

Esther feels very good that her business grows, and her income as well. She is glad to be able to contribute toward supporting those most dear to her, and thanks Manuela Ramos for all the support she has provided.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Esther, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Virtuosas, vive en el Jr. Francia Mz 9 Lt1 del Asentamiento Humano Martha Chavez II del distrito Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 41 años de edad, es separada, tiene 4 hijos, dos de ellos ya son independientes y dos aún depende mucho de ella, además sus hijos en los ratos libres ayudan mucho a su mamá, pero aún así el ingreso que tiene no alcanza, por ese motivo es que Esther, con el primer préstamo de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00, decide invertir en la compra y venta de verduras al por menor. Actualmente Esther, tiene su puesto de venta en el mercado Nº 2 donde vende sus productos. Se levanta de madrugada para ir a comprar sus productos y estar temprano en su puesto para atender a sus clientas. En las tardes descansa y atiende a su familia. Con el préstamo de S/. 1.500, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará un saco de papa, un saco de cebolla, una caja de tomate, una caja de limón, zapallo, pepino, zanahoria, ajos, etc. Esta pensando poner una bodega en su casa. Esther, se siente muy bien que su negocio crece, su economía también. Se siente muy contenta porque puede ayudar a sus seres más queridos, y da las gracias a Manuela Ramos por todo el apoyo brindado hasta ahora.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise (potato, onion, tomato, lemon, pumpkin, etc.)

loans.name: Maria Marcia

texts.es:
Mrs. María belongs to the communal bank “Mujeres Virtuosas” (“Virtuous Women”) and lives in the Calleria district. She is 37 years old, is married, and has 4 children one of whom works in the capital city of Lima. The other three children still depend greatly on her. Her husband is a merchant, however his earnings do not meet their living expenses. So, with her first loan of 300 soles from Manuela Ramos, María decided to invest in the purchase and sale of shoes, sandals and baby clothes.

Currently María has her location in the Market #2, where she sells her products. She rises early in the morning to fix breakfast for her children and husband, she takes the children to school, fixes lunch, and attends to her business in the afternoons. At night, she rests and shares happy times with her family.

With the loan of 2,000 soles, to be repaid in six months, she will buy several dozen each of assorted items such as shoes, diapers, baby clothes, tops and pants, towels, dresses, etc. María feels good that to date she has grown her business with each loan, and likes collaborating with Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora María, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Virtuosas, vive en el Jr. Independencia 759 del distrito Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 37 años de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos, uno de ellos trabaja en la cuidad de Lima, y tres aún dependen mucho de ella, su esposo es comerciante, pero el ingreso que tiene no alcanza, es así que María, con el primer préstamo de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00, decide invertir en la compra y venta de zapatos, sandalias, y ropitas de bebes. Actualmente María, tiene su puesto de venta en el mercado Nº 2 donde vende sus productos. Se levanta temprano para preparan el desayuno de sus hijos y esposo, luego lleva a la escuela a sus hijos, prepara el almuerzo y en las tardes atiende su negocio. En las noches descansa y comparte momentos de alegría con sus hijos y esposo. Con el préstamo de S/. 2.000, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará diez docenas de zapatos, diez docenas de pañales, diez docenas de ropitas de bebe, polos, pantalones, colchas, ropones, ajuares, toallas, vestidos, canguros y bolsos. María, se siente muy bien hasta el momento, está incrementando su negocio con cada préstamo, se siente muy a gusto trabajando con Manuela Ramos porque le da todas las facilidades del caso y se siente una mujer realizada en todos los sentidos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise (shoes, diapers, baby clothes, tops and pants, etc.)

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es:
Mrs. Genoveva is a member of the communal bank “La Primavera”, and lives in the province of Moyabamba. She began her business on her own selling shoes and imported slippers (footwear), starting first by filling catalog orders. Today she is partnered with a friend. The business is well-located, and also now includes the sale of Rena Ware cookware as well as a variety of brand name beauty supply products. She decided to start this endeavor because of her business abilities, including a charming and helpful personality, which facilitate her sales efforts. She also counts on the support of her husband, as she must work out of the home to run her business. It is important to her to generate her own income.

With this loan of 500 soles, to be repaid over a four-month term, she will buy footwear of different styles and sizes to better meet her customers’ demands. This is important as the end-of-year season begins (school promotions and holidays), as she would like to be well-stocked to make her customers happy and fill orders that she has.

She is 47 years old and has four children who help her maintain a well-run business. Her goal is to expand her business to include the sale of clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Genoveva es socia del Banco Comunal La Primavera, vive en el Jr. Manuel del Águila No 131, distrito y provincia de Moyabamba, departamento de San Martín. Se inició sola en el negocio de venta de zapatos y zapatillas importadas (calzado), a principios atendía pedidos por catálogos, ahora esta asociada con una amiga. Su negocio se encuentra ubicado en el Jr. Callao C – 5, también se dedica a la venta de ollas de marca Rena Ware, y productos de belleza de las diferentes marcas como Unique y Esika. Decidió iniciar esta actividad porque tiene habilidades para el negocio, tiene carisma y buen trato que le ayudan mucho en sus ventas, además cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, porque tiene que dejar su casa para dedicarse a su negocio, para ella es importante generar sus propios ingresos. Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará mas zapatos de diferentes modelos y tallas porque ya se acerca la campaña de fin de año: promociones escolares y Navidad, por eso quiere surtir su mercadería para satisfacer los gustos de sus clientes y atender algunos pedidos que ya tiene. Tiene 47 años y 4 hijos, quienes ahora la apoyan, dándole facilidades para que pueda manejar bien las actividades de la casa y del negocio (comparten actividades); su meta es ampliar el negocio con la venta de ropa.

loans.use: Purchase footwear at wholesale.

loans.name: Sayit

texts.id:
Sayit T. pays his six employees 25,000 rupiah per day to help him make fried cassava chips. He is currently making as much as 400,000 Rupiah per day and uses 2,000,000 Rupiah to buy cassavas. Because it is difficult to obtain cassava, he plans to also offer fried taro chips to his customers. To purchase the taro chips, he needs to borrow 1,500,000 Rupiah. Sayit T. has a wife and one child. Their living expenses are 25,000 Rupiah per day.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Courtenay Teska Race, Kiva Volunteer.

Modal senilai Rp 2.000.000,00 digunakan Sayit untuk membeli singkong mentah. Dengan 6 orang tenaga kerja yang dibayar Rp 25.000,00/hari dia membuat kripik singkong. Keuntungan per hari yang dia peroleh sebesar Rp 400.000,00. Dia memiliki rencana menambah barang dagangan, yaitu kripik talas, karena susahnya untuk mendapat bahan baku singkong. Sayit memerlukan dana Rp 1.500.000,00 untuk membeli kripik talas. Tanggungannya saat ini adalah seorang isteri dan seorang anak dengan biaya hidup per hari Rp 25.000,00.

loans.use: to increase the variety of goods for sale

loans.name: Asep

texts.id:
A natural business person often sees business opportunity. That's what happened to Asep. His ongoing business is selling candies. With a working capital of 50,000 IDR/pkg (1 USD ~ 9,000 IDR) he gains a profit of 25,000 IDR - 50,000 IDR/pkg. Based on the number of his current customers, around 100 people, he is tempted to make new years horn. This is a once in a year opportunity. One horn that costs him 1,000 IDR can be sold for 2,000-2,500 IDR. Asep needs a loan of 4,000,000 for working capital to make the horns that are going to be sold directly as well as through his mini-mart customers.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Seorang pedagang pasti selalu melihat peluang usaha. Hal itu juga dilihat oleh Asep. Usahanya selama ini adalah Jual Permen Berhadiah. Bermodalkan Rp 50.000,00/pak dia mendapatkan keuntungan Rp 25.000,00 – Rp 50.000,00/paknya. Berangkat dari jumlah pelanggan yang ia miliki – sekitar 100 orang - dia terdorong untuk membuat terompet tahun baru. Kesempatan yang datang setahun sekali. Satu terompet dengan harga dasar Rp 1.000,00 – Rp 1.500,00, dan dijual senilai Rp 2.000,00 – Rp 2.500,00 per biji. Dan Asep memerlukan pinjaman Rp 4.000.000,00 untuk modal membuat terompet yang akan dijual langsung maupun ditaruh di warung – warung langganannya.

loans.use: to make new years horn

loans.name: María Juana

texts.es:
Since her husband abandoned her she has dedicated herself to the sale of clothing, given that she was left solely responsible for generating income to pay for household expenses. Also, she wants her children to have a better future by ensuring they get an education. It’s been 23 years since María Juana started with just a little jewelry and, little by little, she began to incorporate clothes and shoes into her inventory to have a greater variety of items to sell.

Currently, María Juana is a woman of advanced age who continues to fight to earn a living to support herself. It’s for this reason that she continues working at selling her products to earn enough to pay for her home. María Juana is asking for a loan of $600USD which she proposes to repay over a four-month period. With this money, María will be able to buy more seasonal clothing that she can offer her customers over the winter. With your help, María will be able to save some money to have for when she is no longer able to work.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde que su esposo la dejó, se a dedicado a la venta de ropa puesto que ella es la que tiene que ver por el dinero que entra en su casa para poder pagar todo lo que se necesita. Y también para poder ofrecerle a sus hijos un mejor futuro al tenerlos estudiando. Hace 23 años Ma. Juana comenzó con un poco de joyería y poco a poco fue incluyendo ropa y zapatos para tener más variedad en las cosas que vende.

Actualmente María Juana es una mujer con avanzada edad. Que sigue luchando por sacar dinero para poder pagar los gastos de ella. Es por eso que continúa trabajando y vendiendo productos para poder sacar para pagar su casa. Es por esto que María Juana está solicitando un crédito de US $600 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 4 meses y con este dinero María podrá comprar ropa de temporada para poder tener mercancía para ofrecerle a sus clientes en esta temporada de invierno. Con tu ayuda María podrá ahorrar un poco de dinero para tener para cuando ya no pueda trabajar.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Ali

texts.id:
Ali has one employee helping him making 6-10 buckets of grass jelly everyday. He pays the employee 25,000 IDR per day (1USD ~ 9,000 IDR). Grass Jelly is an important mix for 'es campur' (a popular desert). To produce one bucket of grass jelly requires a working capital of 10,000 IDR. Each bucket is sold for 20,000 IDR. Hence he grosses 10,000 IDR per bucket. Ali sells the grass jelly to his customer at the market. Currently he wants to expand his business by finding a new place to sell. He needs 3,000,000 IDR. He is running the business with his wife as well.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Ali memiliki satu orang orang tenaga yang membantunya membuat 6 - 10 ember cincau/hari dengan ongkos kerja Rp 25.000,00/hari. Cincau adalah salah satu campuran dari es campur. Satu ember cincau memerlukan modal Rp 10.000,00. Per ember akan dijual Rp 20.000,00. Jadi keuntungannya Rp 10.000,00/ember. Ali menjualnya kepada langganannya di Pasar. Saat ini dia ingin mengembangkan usahanya dengan mencari tempat berjualan di pasar yang baru. Untuk itu dia memerlukan modal. Pinjaman senilai Rp 3.000.000,00 akan dia manfaatkan. Dia menjalankan usaha ini dibantu dengan isteri.

loans.use: to increase grass jelly production capacity

loans.name: Kossitsè Michel

texts.fr:
Mr. Kossitsè Michel D. was born on April 10, 1955. He is married and the father of three children who are all in primary school. At a young age and because of lack of financial resources, he began to grow palms which has allowed him to support his family, but with difficulty. He took out a first loan of US$ 500 to get this business off the ground and managed to reimburse the loan in a timely fashion.

Ambitious and intent on getting out from under the burden of his difficult financial situation, Kossitsè is now requesting a second loan, of US$ 1000 this time, to enlarge his palm tree field and purchase fertilizer. This should allow him to satisfy the needs of his customers and improve socio-economic conditions for his family and himself.

Tanslated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur D. Kossitsè Michel est né le 10 avril 1955, marié et père de trois (3) enfants tous au cours primaire. Très tôt et par manque de moyens, il s’est vite lancé dans les cultures de palmerais, seul moyen de supporter difficilement sa famille. C’est ainsi qu’il avait bénéficié d’un premier crédit de $500 pour le démarrage de cette activité qui fut remboursé sans incidence. Ambitieux et soucieux de sortir sous le joug de la misère, il présent à nouveau cette demande de $1000 pour agrandir son champ de palmerais et acheter des fertilisants. Ce projet financé lui permettra de satisfaire sa clientèle et d’améliorer ses conditions de vie socio-économiques.

loans.use:
enlarge his field and purchase fertilizer

agrandissement de son champ et achat des fertilisants

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
Born in Tchékpoè-Dédékpoè in February 1964, Mr. Kokou A. now lives in Afagnan with his wife and their four children. They are also responsible for two other dependents. A teacher by profession, he is also a market gardener and hires one helper. Recognized by the people of the neighborhood as a serious man, Mr. A. would like to expand his market garden into a viable secondary souce of income. In order to do that, he needs a loan of US$ 1000 to buy fertilizer so as to expand his garden. The income from it will then help him to cope with the needs of his large family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Né à Tchékpoè-Dédékpoè en Février 1964, Monsieur A. Kokou vit aujourd’hui à Afagnan avec sa femme et ses quatre (4) enfants. Outre ses derniers, il compte à sa charge deux (2) autres personnes. Enseignant de profession, il pratique aussi le jardinage pour lequel, il a engagé une personne. Reconnu par les voisins de quartier comme un homme très dévoué, monsieur A. Kokou compte aujourd’hui élargir son jardin pour en faire une activité secondaire. Pour cela, il nécessite un crédit de $1000 pour acheter les fertilisants et étendre son jardin. Les revenus lui serviront à mieux subvenir aux nombreuses charges de sa famille.

loans.use:
Purchase of fertilizer to expand his garden

Achat de fertilisants pour extension de jardin

loans.name: Afi Marcelline

texts.fr:
Born in 1972, Mrs. Afi Marcelline A. is married and the mother of seven children. Her ne'er-do-well husband leaves her to earn enough to cover all the household expenses and she is hardly able to manage. Mrs. A. began growing corn which she stores and sells to the women in her area when little food is available. Honest and sincere, Mrs. A. is requesting a loan of US$ 1000 which will allow her to expand her arable land and purchase fertilizer. She has a good deal of experience in the field of agriculture. This project will help her to eke out enough money to pay school fees for all her children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née en 1972, Madame A. Afi Marcelline est mariée et mère de sept (7) enfants. Son mari malafoutier laisse toutes les charges du ménage sur elle qui n’arrive pas à s’en sortir. Madame A. s’est lancée dans l’agriculture de maïs qu’elle stocke et revend aux bonnes femmes de sa localité au moment de soudure. Honnête et dévouée, elle sollicite un financement de $1000 qui lui servira d’agrandir sa surface cultivable et acheter des fertilisants. Elle a beaucoup d’expérience dans le domaine de l’agriculture. Ce projet l’aidera davantage à dégager une marge financière et scolariser tous ses enfants.

loans.use:
enlarge her field and purchase fertilizer

agrandissement de son champ et achat de fertilisants

loans.name: Ketut

texts.id:
C. spends 4-5 bags of flour (1 bag = 25kg) to bake bread every day. One bag of flour costs him 135,000 IDR (1 USD ~ 9,000 IDR). He could gross 500,000 IDR per day with a working capital of 1,000,000 IDR. He has seven employees which he pays 20,000 IDR per day. He is also helped by his wife. The loan is going to be used to buy a transportation equipment. The vehicle is going to be used to distribute his goods. By doing so he could expand his distribution, hence increasing his production and enhancing his profit. Raising his third grade kid is one of his main priorities for the time being

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

C. menghabiskan 4 - 5 sak tepung (1 sak = 25 kg) untuk membuat kue per harinya. Satu sak tepung harganya Rp 135.000,00. Modal sebesar Rp 1.000.000,00/hari bisa memberikan keuntungan kotor Rp 500.000,00. Dia memiliki 7 anak buah yang dibayar Rp 20.000,00/hari. Dia juga dibantu oleh isterinya. Pinjaman modal yang diperoleh akan digunakan untuk membeli alat transportasi. Kendaraan yang dibeli akan digunakan untuk memasarkan hasil usahanya. Hal ini bertujuan memperluas distribusi sehingga semakin banyak produksi yang akhirnya akan menambah keuntungan yang diterima. Salah satu yang menjadi pertimbangannya adalah anaknya yang sekarang masih kelas 3 Sekolah Dasar (SD).

loans.use: to purchase transportation equipment

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr:
Born in Kpéssou in 1975, Mr. Kodjo H. is a young married father of two (2) children. Known throughout his village for his goodwill, he has in his care a total of ten (10) people. Driving a motorcycle taxi is his daily business. Currently, his motorcycle is in a very poor state. As a result, he hopes to buy a new one in order to conduct his business without problems. He is asking for a loan of $800 to realize this dream. His income will serve to better meet the needs of his family so as to encourage its growth.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Né à Kpéssou en 1975, Monsieur H. Kodjo est un jeune homme marié et père de deux (2) enfants. Reconnu dans son village pour sa bonne volonté de faire, il compte à sa charge un total de dix (10) personnes. Le taxi moto est son activité quotidienne. Aujourd’hui, sa moto est dans un état très défaillant. Pour cela, il souhaite acheter une nouvelle afin de vaquer paisiblement à son travail. Il sollicite un crédit de $800 pour réaliser son rêve. Les recettes du travail lui serviront à mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille afin de parvenir à son épanouissement.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Mrs. Elena lives in the province of Trujillo in La Libertad. She studied up to second grade, and she is very motivated in her endeavors. At 52 years of age she has a small business to which she dedicates all her efforts as she wants to help her four children, all of whom depend on her, to get ahead. With the first loan of 300 soles that she received from the communal bank “Mujeres Valerosas” (“Brave Women”), with the support of Manuela Ramos, she purchased milk, sugar, cookies, etc. With these goods she was able to establish a small store. She started first by selling bread and, little by little, she began buying other goods such as fruit, sweets and sodas. With the loan of 500 soles, which she proposes to repay in four months, she will buy display cases to better organize and showcase her products. Mrs. Elena dreams of having a great, well-stocked store.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Elena vive en el Distrito de La Esperanza de la Provincia de Trujillo del Departamento de La Libertad. Estudió hasta el segundo grado de primaria, ella es una mujer muy empeñosa en su trabajo, a sus 52 años de edad tiene un pequeño negocio al que le dedica todo su esfuerzo porque tiene que sacar adelante a sus 4 hijos que aun dependen de ella. Con el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 recibido en el Banco Comunal “Mujeres Valerosas” promovido por Manuela Ramos, compró leche, azúcar, galletas, etc. con lo que instaló una pequeña bodega. Empezó su negocio primero con la venta de pan, poco a poco fue comprando otras cosas como fruta, golosinas y posteriormente gaseosas. Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará vitrinas (exhibidoras) para ordenar y exhibir mejor sus productos. La señora Elena sueña con tener una gran tienda muy surtida.

loans.use: Purchase display cases for store/bodega.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Born in 1969, Mrs. Akossiwa Y. is married and the mother of 7 children. Her husband is a retired school teacher, who cannot provide on his own for all the needs of the family. And so, the bulk of the family budget is earned by Mrs. Y.. With her small banana field, it is still difficult for her to cover all the household expenses and not all of her children are able to go to school. Hard working and honest, she has already benefited from a previous loan of $450, which she repayed. Currently, she is applying for a loan of $1,000 to expand her field and to purchase fertilizers. With this, she will be able to improve her family's living conditions and will be able to send her other children to school.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Née en 1969, Madame Y. Akossiwa est mariée avec sept (7) enfants en charge. Son mari instituteur retraité, n’arrive pas à contribuer aux besoins de la famille, c’est ainsi que la charge familiale est supportée par Madame Y. Akossiwa. Avec son petit champ d’ananas, elle arrive difficilement à joindre les deux bouts et ses enfants ne sont pas tous scolarisés. Travailleuse et honnête, elle a une fois bénéficié de crédit de $450 qu’elle a bien remboursés. Présentement, elle sollicite $1000 pour agrandir son champ et acheter des fertilisants. Ce faisant elle améliorera les conditions de vie de sa famille et pourra scolariser les autres enfants.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Mana

texts.fr:
Mrs. Mana A. was born May 16, 1968, and is today married and the mother of 12 children, who have been under her sole care for 10 years, after the death of her husband. She has been a single mother with no aide from anyone else in caring for her large family, which is thinly supported by the revenue from her sales of palm seed oil. Dynamic and honest, she has proven herself responsible in handling loans. She is now applying for a new credit of $1,000 to purchase palm seeds in bulk, as they are necessary for her palm seed oil production, which she stocks and resells in between harvesting seasons when other stocks run low. Financing this project is her only hope to rise a little above her current state of poverty.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Madame A. Mana est née le 16 mai 1968, mariée et mère de douze (12) enfants qui sont laissés à sa charge, après le décès de son mari depuis 10 ans. Ce qui fait que la charge du foyer repose définitivement sur madame A. qui s’en sort péniblement par les revenus de sa vente d’huile de palme. Dynamique et honnête, elle a fait ses preuves en matière de crédit. Elle sollicite un nouveau crédit de $1000 pour s’acheter les noix de palme en grande quantité et les nécessaires pour la production de l’huile qu’elle stocke et revend en période de soudure. Financé ce projet, est son seul espoir de sortir un peu de la paupérisation dont elle est sujet.

loans.use: The purchase of palm seeds for her production of palm seed oil.

loans.name: Ben

texts.fr:
At 27, Mr. A. is a young man, who is married and the father of 2 children and who also takes care of 3 other people. He is the owner of a general grocery store that also stocks generic products. He is well-liked by his customers because of his warm welcome and his understanding nature through which Mr. A. was successful in gaining the trust of the people in his neighborhood. Today, because of growing demands, he would like to apply for a loan of $1,000 in order to stock his store with various and diverse items. The revenue will allow him to repay the loan and to better serve the needs of the many people he is responsable for, above all their nutritional, scholarly and health care needs.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Agé de 27 ans, Monsieur A. Ben est un jeune homme marié et père de deux (2) enfants et à sa charge trois (3) autres personnes. Il est détenteur d’une boutique d’alimentation générale et de produits génériques. Très aimé par sa clientèle pour son accueil et sa compréhension, Ben A. a réussi à gagner la confiance de la population de sa localité. Aujourd’hui, vu le niveau des demandes, il veut passer par ce canal pour solliciter un financement de $1000 afin de s’approvisionner des produits divers qu’il vend. Les revenus lui serviront de rembourser le crédit et de mieux subvenir aux nombreux besoins des personnes à sa charge surtout les besoins alimentaires, scolaires et sanitaires.

loans.use: Stocking of various items.

loans.name: Sukardiono

texts.id:
H. sells fried snacks every day. His snacks are sold in packages. He can sell 125-200 packages per day. Each package is sold for 2,500 IDR (1USD ~9000 IDR). He is being helped by his wife. The business gives him a profit of 50,000 IDR per day. In addition to selling fried snacks, H. sees a business opportunity in buying and selling motorcycles. Since his current business would not be enough to get him to get into the new business, he is looking for loan of 5,000,000 IDR. He estimates that he would earn additional profit of ~100,000 IDR per week.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi MaH., Kiva Volunteer.

Setiap hari H. berjualan gorengan. Jenis gorengan yang dia jual sudah dibungkus. Dia mampu menjual 125 – 200 bungkus per harinya. Per bungkus gorengan seharga Rp 2.500,00. Dia dibantu oleh isterinya. Usaha ini memberikan keuntungan baginya sebesar Rp 50.000,00/hari. Di samping berjualan gorengan, H. melihat peluang di Usaha Jual Beli Sepeda Motor. Karena hasil dari Jual Gorengan tidak mencukupi untuk bisnis barunya, maka dia mencari pinjaman modal Rp 5.00.000,00. Dia memperkirakan akan mendapat keuntungan kira – kira Rp 100.000,00/minggu.

loans.use: capital for buying and selling motorcycles

loans.name: Kossi Olivier

texts.fr:
At 40 years old, Mr. A. is married and the father of 5 children of all ages, but who have not had the opportunity to attend school because of the poverty that bears down upon the family's day to day situation. We know that Mr. A. was a motorcycle-taxi driver before he began to work definitively in the field of agriculture, growing bananas, which has been his only window of opportunity to rise from poverty. He benefited from a first loan and was able to repay this without difficulty. Today, he is applying for a new loan of $1,000 to expand his field and to purchase fertilizers. This will enable him to increase his production and to offer an education to his children during the next school year.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Agé de 40 ans, Monsieur A. Kossi Olivier est marié et père de cinq (5) enfants tous âgés mais n’ont pas la chance d’être scolarisé à cause de la pauvreté qui sévit dans cette famille. Notons que Monsieur A. fut conducteur de taxi moto avant de se lancer définitivement dans la culture d’ananas dans sa localité, seule porte de sortir de sa misère. Il a bénéficié d’un premier crédit qui a été remboursé sans difficulté. A présent, il sollicite un nouveau crédit de $1000 pour agrandir son champ et acheter des fertilisants. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter sa capacité de production et scolariser ses enfants à la rentrée prochaine.

loans.use: agrandissement de son champ et achat des fertilisants

loans.name: Taurina

texts.es:
Taurina is 70 years old. Despite her age, she’s very engaged in the work that she does. She sells alfalfa in the Victoria market, in the Esperanza District in the province of Trujillo, department of Libertad. She also raises ducks, which she sells at certain times.

Taurina has 8 independent children. She doesn’t know how to read or write because she never went to school.

She began her business by selling alfalfa at home, in small quantities. But, thanks to the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles ($100US approx.) that she got from her bank, “Banco Comunal Mujeres Valerosas” and with the support of a friend, she was able to find a place to sell insiD. the local market.

With the recent loan she received from Manuela Ramos of 500 soles ($167US approx.), which will be repaid in 4 months, she’ll buy 125 pounds of alfalfa and food for her animals.

Taurina is eager to finish her house with all the final touches and to make it more comfortable.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Taurina tiene 70 años D. edad, a pesar D. su avanzada edad es muy empeñosa con el trabajo que realiza, se dedica a la venta D. alfalfa (yerba) en condición D. ambulante en el mercado Victoria ubicado en el distrito D. La Esperanza provincia D. Trujillo departamento D. La Libertad. También se dedica a la crianza D. patos, los cuales venD. en ciertas temporadas.

La señora Taurina tiene 8 hijos pero todos independientes. No sabe leer ni escribir porque nunca asistió a la escuela.

Inició su negocio vendiendo alfalfa en su casa, en cantidades pequeñas, pero gracias al primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/.300.00 (aproximadamente $100) que recibió en su Banco Comunal “Mujeres Valerosas” y al apoyo D. una amiga, consiguió un lugar donD. vender dentro del Mercado D. la zona.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/.500.00 (aproximadamente $167), el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará 5 arrobas D. alfalfa y alimento para sus animales.

La señora Taurina anhela terminar su casa con todos sus acabados y tener más comodidad.

loans.use: To buy alfalfa (food for domestic animals)

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr:
Married and the father of five children, Mr. Kodjo K. is presently living in Kpéssou where he was born in 1958. He was obliged to leave school at a young age and begin an apprenticeship. He is now a master carpenter, whose skill is greatly appreciated by his customers.

Mr. K. currently has quite a number of orders that he would like to fill. For that reason, he is requesting a loan of US$ 600 to purchase wood so that he can produce the furniture his customers have ordered. The income from the sale of this furniture will allow him to better support his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Marié et père de cinq (5) enfants, Monsieur K. Kodjo vit actuellement à Kpéssou où il est né en 1958. Très tôt, il abandonne ses études et entre en apprentissage. Aujourd’hui devenu maître menuisier, il est bien apprécié par les consommateurs de ses produits artisanaux, par leur finesse.

Monsieur K. Kodjo a reçu aujourd’hui beaucoup de commandes qu’il compte satisfaire. Pour cela, il sollicite ce crédit de $600 pour s’acheter du bois afin de produire ses meubles et satisfaire les demandes de sa clientèle. Les revenus issus de la vente lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use:
Purchase of planks for carpentry business

Achat de planches

loans.name: Tanti Elisabeth

texts.fr:
Tanti Elisabeth A. was born on August 18, 1959 in Lomé and lives in the area of Adobou-Komé, in Lomé. Born with a handicap, she is responsible for four children and is presently a widow. Her business is making and selling dolls to tourists in the big open-air market of Lomé. She sells various other items as well. Since she does not have capital to invest in her little business, she is requesting a loan of US$ 500 so that she can increase her output of dolls and satisfy the needs of her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame A. Tanti Elisabeth est née le 18 Août 1959 à Lomé et domiciliée au quartier Adobou-Komé. Née handicapée, elle a à sa charge quatre enfants et restée veuve. Ses activités sont axées sur la confection et la vente des poupées aux touristes au grand marché de Lomé, en plus elle associe à cette tâche la vente des produits divers. Manque de fonds, elle sollicite à travers ce projet un crédit de $500 en vue d’augmenter sa production en poupées afin de satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use:
purchasing cloth and thread to use to make dolls

Achat de tissu et fil pour la fabrication des poupées

loans.name: Arwin

texts.id:
Arwin adalah seorang pemuda yang memiliki keahlian di bidang mesin. Dia membuka usaha bengkel. Saat ini bengkelnya dikontrak oleh sebuah biro perjalanan. Jadi setiap bulan ada pendapatan tetap. Dalam satu bulan dia bisa mendapatkan uang Rp 3.600.000,00 dengan keuntungan Rp 1.200.000,00 setelah dipotong modal. Peralatan yang sekarang dia miliki hanya bisa untuk mengerjakan minibus. Arwin berencana menggunakan pinjaman Rp 7.500.000,00 yang dia peroleh untuk membeli alat – alat bengkel yang besar dan lengkap untuk mengerjakan bus. Hal ini akan menambah keuntungan yang dia peroleh.

Translated from Bahasa by bernard, Kiva volunteer.

Arwin is good with machinery, therefore he opened a workshop to fix buses. At this moment his workshop is being contracted by one of the bureau of transportation. Therefore he gets a fix income of Rp 3.600.000,00 and a profit of Rp 1.200.000,00. The equipments he has right now can only repair mini buses. Arwin intents to to use the Rp 7.500.000,00 loan to buy bigger workshop equipment so that he can also work on bigger buses. Thus increasing his profit.

loans.use: membeli alat – alat bengkel yang besar dan lengkap untuk mengerjakan bus | Buying more tools for Bus workshop.

loans.name: Adjo Odette

texts.fr:
Mrs. Adjo Odette A. was born in Lomé on April 17, 1963 and lives in the district of Adobou-Komé in Lomé. Born with a handicap, she is single but is responsible for the livelihood of two other people. She sells ice water and "Pure Water" and her business is thriving. Because she has no capital of her own to invest in her little business, she is requesting a loan of US$ 300 which will help her to get a refrigerator and sufficient stock of bottled water for her business. She is a devoted businesswoman and manages her accounts well, which should allow her to improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame A. Adjo Odette est née à Lomé le 17 Avril 1963 et réside au quartier Adobou-Komé. Née handicapée, elle est célibataire et a à sa charge 2 personnes. Revendeuse d’eau glacée et de « pure water », un commerce qui lui réussit bien. Par manque de fonds, elle sollicite un prêt de $300. Ce fonds l’aidera à se procurer d'un refrigérateur et achat en quantité suffisante ses articles en vue de faire face aux différents aléas du passé ; Par son dévouement, elle fait preuve d’une bonne gestion de ses activités ce qui lui permettra d’améliorer ses conditions.

loans.use:
purchase of a refrigerator

Achat de refrigérateur

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Born in 1959 in Tsévié, Mrs. Ablavi Béatrice A. is married and the mother of five children, of whom three are still living at home. Her husband is retired and his only source of income is his pension which unfortunately is as though dropped out of an eyedropper, i.e., irregular in arriving.

In view of this situation, Mrs. A. began selling charcoal and grains, a business which brings in needed income. For this reason, she travels around the provinces where she is known as a buyer of sacks of charcoal and grain products (corn, beans, peanuts, millet, etc.) which she then re-sells in Aného where these products are rare. In this season of abundance, she is requesting a loan of US$ 1000 so that she can build up a reliable stock of these goods. This will allow her to increase her turnover and thus become financially independent.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née en 1959 à Tsévié, Madame A. Ablavi Béatrice est mariée et mère de cinq (5) enfants dont trois sont actuellement à sa charge. Son mari, un retraité dont le seul revenu est la pension qui malheureusement tombe à compte goutte.

Devant cette situation, Madame A. s’est lancée dans le commerce du charbon de bois et des céréales qui lui procure l’essentiel de ses revenus. C’est ainsi qu’elle parcourt les préfectures où elle est très connue pour acheter des sacs de charbons et des céréales (maïs, haricot, arachide, mil etc.) pour revendre à Aného où ces produits sont rares. En cette période d’abondance de ces produits, elle sollicite un financement de $1000 pour s’approvisionner et faire un stockage consistant. Ceci lui permettra d’accroître son chiffre d’affaire et d’acquérir une autonomie financière.

loans.use:
purchasing charcoal and grain products for re-sale

Stock en charbon de bois et en céréales pour

loans.name: Arik

texts.id:
Usaha sehari – hari Arik adalah Jual Bakso. Dia menekuni usaha ini bersama dengan isterinya. Setiap hari dia berkeliling dengan rombong baksonya. Keuntungannya dari usaha ini Rp 30.000,00/hari. Untuk biaya hidup (Rp 20.000,00/hari) saja keuntungan yang diperoleh cukup mengkuatirkan. Hal ini disadari oleh Arik. Pada setiap akhir tahun pasti akan identik dengan terompet. Dia melihat peluang ini. Modal usaha Rp 1.000.000,00 yang dia peroleh akan dia pakai untuk usaha Jual Terompet.

Translated from Bahasa by bernard, Kiva volunteer.

Arik's day time business is selling Bakso with his wife. However his daily profit from selling Bakso is Rp 30.000,00 is just enough to cover his daily expenses of 20.000,00. Arik saw an opportunity that they will be a demand for trumpets at year end. Seeing this, he will use the Rp 1.000.000,00 to buy materials to make trumpets and sell.

loans.use: membeli bahan - bahan untuk membuat terompet | To Buy materials to make trumpet

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.fr:
Mr. Alphonse B., 28, was born in Lomé; he has a physical handicap and is single. He is a shoemaker by trade, making and repairing shoes. Unfortunately, his financial means are meager and so he is not able to procure a machine to polish the soles he makes nor to have enough leather of various types. Alphonse is requesting a loan of US$ 900 so that he can purchase the polishing machine which is fundamental to his trade and also stock up on leather. This will permit him to satisfy his customers' needs and make a better profit which should lead to improved living conditions.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agé de 28 ans, Monsieur B. Alphonse est né à Lomé, handicapé et célibataire. Il est cordonnier de profession. Son activité est basée sur la fabrication et la réparation des chaussures. Il manque cruellement de moyens pour acquérir une machine à polir les semelles de sa fabrication et avoir suffisamment de cuir de différentes qualités. Monsieur Alphonse sollicite un prêt de $900 afin de se procurer de la machine qui est un moyen très fondamental de son activité et s’approvisionner en cuir. Ceci lui permettra de satisfaire ses clients et de dégager une marge bénéficiaire susceptible de contribuer à l’amélioration de ses conditions de vie.

loans.use:
purchase of a shoe-polishing machine and additional leather for making shoes

Achat de machine à polir

loans.name: K,dominique

texts.fr:
Born on August 8, 1974 in Gapé (Zio Province, Togo), Mr. Dominique K. A. is married and has two children as well as caring for his mother who lives with them. A trained auto mechanic, he is not financially able to open his own repair workshop. After obtaining his driver's licence, he went into providing transport, a business which was bringing in a bit of income. Unfortunately, his vehicle is presently broken down and has had to be abandoned, which caused Mr. A. to try and repair an old motorcycle to use as a motorcycle taxi. This has also not been successful so far since the engine of the motorcycle is in very poor condition. In fact, the A. family is presently without an income source and in dire straits.

In order to remedy this situation, Mr. A. is requesting a loan of US$ 800 to purchase a new motorcycle which should guarantee the future of his little family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Né le 08 Août 1974 à Gapé (P/Zio), Monsieur A. K. Dominique est marié et père de deux (2) enfants et à sa charge sa mère. Mécanicien auto de profession, il n’a pas les moyens pour ouvrir un atelier pour exercer son métier. Il s’est lancé dans le service transport après son permis de conduire, activité qui lui procurait le peu de revenu. Malheureusement le véhicule est actuellement en panne et abandonné ce qui a amené Monsieur A. à récupérer une vielle moto pour en faire taxi moto. Là aussi les choses ne tournent pas bien pour lui à cause de l’état de l’engin. Privé ainsi de tout revenu, la famille A. vit actuellement une situation très dure.

Décidé à changer cette situation, il sollicite un financement de $800 pour acheter une nouvelle moto et garantir l’avenir de sa petite famille.

loans.use:
Purchase of a motorcycle taxi

Achat de taxi moto

loans.name: Zulpri

texts.id:
Bakat seni yang mengalir dalam jiwa seorang Zulpri mengantarkan dia menjadi seorang entertainer. Sekarang dia sering menjadi menjadi pembawa acara dan pemain musik dengan pendapatan bersih Rp 800.000,00/ bulan. Karena melihat suatu peluang bisnis yang bagus, dia mengajukan pinjaman Rp 7.000.000,00 yang akan digunakan untuk membeli 2 buah boneka badut. Setiap kali badut manggung akan dibayar Rp 75.000,00 atau Rp 450.000,00/badut untuk kontrak 1 bulan. Selain itu, dia juga memberi kesempatan kerja bagi anak – anak pemulung untuk menjadi pemain badut. Mereka akan dibayar Rp 25.000/satu kali main.

Translated from Bahasa by bernard, Kiva volunteer.

The hidden talent in Zulpri has allowed him to be an entertainer. Now he plays musical instruments and host events and gets about Rp 800.000,00 a month. Seeing that this is a profitable business, he would like to use the Rp 7.000.000,00 financial assistance to buy 2 clown costumes. After each show the clown will be paid Rp 75.000,00 or Rp 450.000,00 for a 1 month contract. He will also give opportunity to kids who work as second hand goods collectors to try out to become clown actors. They will be paid Rp 25.000 for each show.

loans.use: membeli 2 buah boneka badut | To buy 2 clown costumes.

loans.name: Sefuluai

texts.en: This is the first time Sefuluai has sought assistance from SPBD. Her family owns a small farm and she has asked for the assistance of SPBD with the purchase of some tools for the farm. She hopes to expand their farm and from then on, the farm should be able to support itself from the money it will earn from the produce that will be sold. Sefuluai said she will continue to utilise the support from SPBD in future if needed to ensure that she is able to sustain her farm.

loans.use: To buy supplies and tools for her small farm

loans.name: Fafau

texts.en: This is Fafau's second loan. She would use it to buy supplies for her barbecue business. This barbecue business has helped her meet many of her family's financial commitments. She would use the loan to sustain the business, but she hopes to obtain future loans from SPBD to expand the business by introducing other food products. But her focus now is on firmly establishing the core business in barbecue. She is very grateful for the assistance from SPBD and lenders.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her barbecue business

loans.name: Fiti

texts.en: Fiti has 5 children. She is a hard-working woman who has made a committed effort to the loan program. She is always trying to improve her small business. She would like to manage the weed problem better and increase the productivity and profitability of her plantation. She would use the loan to buy herbicides for her plantation.

loans.use: To buy herbicides for her plantation

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline, 55, has eight children, ranging in  age from 17 to 31. She previously owned and operated a successful home improvement company and is now looking after her plantation business. She has an immaculate credit history and continues to repay current debts in full and on time.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Nive

texts.en: Nive, 54, has seven children and currently runs a bingo business and farms her plantation. Nive belongs to a group of 19 people who received loans, and only 11 people are currently active in the group. She has helped her group pay off the loans of the inactive members. She makes a good profti from her business and has improved her family's quality of life in many ways. Nive is applying for this loan to build fencing around her plantation and purchase prizes for her bingo games.

loans.use: To buy fencing for her plantation and prizes for her bingo business

loans.name: Maaveeseese

texts.en: Farmers by trade, Maaveeseese and her husband have always depended on their plantation to provide their family’s daily food. With assistance from SPBD, they now hope to have a surplus that they can sell at the market or even from their home at Satapuala. This extra profit would help them maintain the plantation for a long while. If they are successful and pay off this first loan from SPBD, they are hopeful they can use this assistance again in future and expand the business. She is grateful for the help from SPBD and lenders.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Kolopa

texts.en: Kolopa is on her second loan. She is doing well with her business, and she is asking for this loan to buy supplies she needs at this stage. Otherwise, she is able to sustain the business with the profits she makes from the sale of ice cakes. She hopes to expand to other products soon, but for now she plans to stick to the production and sale of ice cakes (popsicles in a bag) until she makes enough profit to expand the business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her ice cake business

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria plans to use her second loan to buy more inventory for her shop. Her family has come to depend on her small business to finance many family commitments, and she needs to maintain shop sales so that the shop makes a profit.

loans.use: To restock her shop

loans.name: Lili

texts.en: This is not Lili’s first loan from SPBD,  as is evident from the loan amount that she is now entitled to. She continues to fund her bakery business from these funds from SPBD and has been able to make a living from this business venture.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her bakery

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Lawn mowing is a growing business these days. Paulina is not a stranger to the SPBD program, and she hopes to use these funds to maintain her lawn mowing equipment. She makes good money from the jobs she gets and is enjoying the fruit of her labor. Thanks to you and SPBD for the help.

loans.use: To buy parts for her lawnmower

loans.name: Faalogoifo

texts.en: The family plantation has always been one of the main sources of income for Faalogoifo and her family. She continues to be part of the SPBD program because she needs the financial backup to sustain her plantation. She depends on her plantation to finance her children’s schooling, and this is why she continues to seek assistance from SPBD.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Felina

texts.en: Felina Vaitoelau has been with the SPBD programme for some time now. Her retail shop is a main source of income for her family and she needs to keep her business going. She is grateful for the assistance from SPBD and she will utilise these funds to buy more inventory items for her shop.

loans.use: To restock her shop

loans.name: Loloma Vaimaa

texts.en: Loloma is new to the SPBD programme. She wants to utilise this first loan to improve the small farm that she currently has. Her family depends on the farm income for all their expenses and she has joined SPBD programme with the hope that her farm can be sustained and will continue to bring in money for the whole family.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her small farm

loans.name: Malia

texts.en: Another new face to the SPBD programme, Malia will utilise this loan to support her small farm. She wants to expand the crops that she has and she sees SPBD's support as the opportunity for her to do that. She is really looking forward to getting more out of her farm now that this assistance is made available for her.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her small farm

loans.name: Maria
