With the loan of 1,200 soles to be repaid over a term of six months, she will buy more merchandise at wholesale for a variety of uses, as well as a small display case in which to showcase her products.

Mrs. Lanly is 32 years old. She lives with her husband and two children. She works hard every day, exemplifying for friends and family how to achieve one’s goals through hard work and self-sacrifice.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Lanly pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Valientes, vive en la región San Martín, provincia Huallaga , distrito Saposoa y se dedica a la venta de agroquímicos. Gracias al apoyo de su esposo que es veterinario y también al esfuerzo de la señora incrementó su negocio y tiene muchos clientes ya que cuando empezó no eran conocidos, pero ahora sí y venden durante todo el día. Con el préstamo de S/.1,200.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará mas productos agroquímicos al por mayor en cajas y galones para diversos uso y una pequeña vitrina para exhibir sus productos. La señora Lanly tiene 32 años, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos. Trabaja diariamente demostrando ejemplo de abnegación y esfuerzo a sus hijos y amigos y cumplir así con las metas que tiene.

loans.use: Purchase of agrochemical products (fertilizers, herbicides, etc.) and a small display case.

loans.name: María Ramona

texts.en:
María Ramona is in her early forties, and she and her husband have three daughters aged 15, 18 and 22. The eldest is in university, while the others attend secondary school. María Ramona runs a small business selling ice cream. She has a diverse clientele made up of students from the local public school to neighbors who visit her house for her delicious ice cream.

María Ramona is considering enlarging her business. She has requested a loan to buy new ice cream flavors so that she can attract more clients. With her new loan, she hopes to increase her income and provide a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: Purchase more ice cream flavors to diversify her business.

loans.name: Ambrosina

texts.en:
Ambrosina is in her early thirties, and she and her husband have six children, four of whom are boys, all who attend school. Her husband is a farmer.

For quite some time, Ambrosina had planned to start selling men and women´s clothing but didn´t have access to any start-up capital. Fortunately, six months ago, she obtained a loan with which she managed to purchase some clothing from outside her neighborhood. As a good entrepreneur, she has managed to make her business successful and she repaid her loan on time.

Ambrosina hopes that with the profits she makes from her used clothes sales business, she can buy a washing machine for her family. She is now requesting a new loan to buy clothing in bulk in order to keep meeting her customers´ demands.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing in bulk for her business.

loans.name: Marta

texts.en:
Marta prepares and sells fried vegetables to earn a living. She and her husband,who does not currently have a job, have three children. Marta runs her very small business from her house, and she is working hard to attract as many customers as possible.

She is requesting a Kiva loan to purchase vegetables to continue her business. Marta envisions that her business will grow a lot in future. She hopes to increase her sales and income so that she can improve her needy family´s living conditions.

loans.use: Purchase vegetables to keep on running a small business.

loans.name: Uk

texts.en:
Mrs. Uk Y., 55, is a mother of seven children and works with her husband as a broker purchasing yams from growers and selling them for a good profit.

They can earn collectively about $6 per day of profit. One of her children runs a stand at home selling a variety of grocery products to the people in her area. Five of her children are enrolled in school.

Mrs. Uk Y. hopes to use this loan to reinvest in her business and to expand her inventory by purchasing more yams to meet her clients' needs.

loans.use: To reinvest in her business and buy more yams to meet her clients' needs.

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Uk Yoeun has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you allow entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to finance their small businesses and support their families.

We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Teresa De La Cruz

texts.en:
Teresa and her partner have three children. She is a very young entrepreneur who has been selling women´s clothing for one year now. She obtains garments from Santo Domingo, the Dominican Republic's capital, as well as from the Fleet Market at very low prices.

Teresa hopes to increase her income significantly. With her Kiva loan, she plans to buy clothing in bulk. That way, she won´t have to make frequent trips outside her community to get the clothing. Teresa hopes her business becomes successful so that she can continue providing education for her children. Teresa says her family is very needy, and that she is working hard to change their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase used clothing in bulk for her business.

loans.name: Phou

texts.en:
Mrs. Phou N., 42, works with her husband, 45, as brokers buying rubber from the growers and then reselling it, making collectively on average $8 a day in revenue.

This couple has four children. Two children assist in selling rubber with their parents and the other two are enrolled in school.

This couple hopes to use this loan to expand their inventory by purchasing more rubber to meet their growing customer demands.

loans.use: To purchase more rubber to meet her growing customer demands

loans.name: Dy

texts.en:
Mrs. Dy K. C., 35, works making wine and raising pigs, earning around $10 per day of income. Her husband is a farmer who grows crops and collects palm juice to produce palm sugar. He makes about $4.80 a day in revenue.

Mrs. Dy K. C. has three children. Two are students and the third is too young to attend school.

Recently, she has applied for a loan to expand her inventory by purchasing more rice and adding more piglets in order to increase her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more rice to produce wine and also buy more piglets for her livestock.

loans.name: Um

texts.en:
Mrs. Um S., 35, is married with two school-aged children and lives with her husband in a part of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia.

She works as a broker purchasing yams from the growers and reselling them, and typically makes on average $5 per day of profit. Her husband is a taxi driver and can make around $5 per day.

Mrs. Um S. has humbly requested a loan to expand her business by purchasing more yams to meet her customers' demands.

loans.use: To purchase more yams from the growers.

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Um Srim has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you allow entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to finance their small businesses and support their families.

We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Huy

texts.en:
Mrs. Huy A., 45, works with her husband raising pigs and earns collectively about $2 per day in revenue.

She has six children; three are currently employed A. a garment factory and three are enrolled in school.

This couple hopes to use the loan to purchase more piglets and feed in order to improve their lives in the next four to five months.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets and feed for her livestock

loans.name: Nich

texts.en:
Mrs. Nich S., 39, is a mother of three children and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia.

She runs a stand at the market selling rice and various kinds of Khmer foods and makes around $3 per day of profit. Her husband is self-employed as a carpenter and generally makes about $4 per day.

Mrs. Nich S. hopes to use this loan to reinvest in her business and the remaining money to buy wood and carpentry tools for her husband's business.

loans.use: To reinvest in her business and purchase more wood and carpentry tools for her husband's business.

loans.name: Lun

texts.en:
Mrs. Lun S., 25, is married with two children and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia.

She works on her piece of land growing a variety of vegetables and makes around $2.70 a day in revenue. Her husband works selling ice to the people in his area and can typically make around $3.80 a day.

Mrs. Lun S. hopes to use this loan to purchase more seeds to expand her crops and the remaining money to open a new business selling sugar cane juice. Money also will go toward buying a freezer and a motorcycle for her husband's business.

loans.use: To open a new business selling sugar cane juice and buy a freezer and a motorcycle for her husband's business.

payments.comment: Congratulation! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for interest helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Lun Sophy and sustain their business. Your loan has made them different. We do hope that you will continue support the poor entrepreneurs in Cambodia through CREDIT MFI in the future. Best Regard, Vichet Ouch, Kiva Coordinator at CREDIT MFI, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Kay

texts.en:
Mrs. Kay P., 37, is a market vendor running a butcher stand selling pork, beef and chicken. She makes on average around $4 per day in revenue. Her husband is a broker who purchases oxen and raises and sells them.

Mrs. Kay P. has two children, and they are students. Currently, she has requested a loan to repair her butcher stand and buy more cows and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To repair her butcher stand and add more cows and reinvest in her business

loans.name: Zacarías

texts.en:
Zacarías is a relatively young businesswoman, and she and her partner have a very big family: ten children, seven of them girls. Just two of the children work while the others attend school.

Zacarías has been selling men´s clothing for two years. She runs her business in the morning, and in the evening she works in a lottery bank. Biweekly, she leaves her neighborhood to collect clothing from Santo Domingo, the capital. She also occasionally buys garments from a frontier city in Haiti.

With her loan, she plans to purchase used clothing in bulk to resell in her community. Given the loan, Zacarías will be in a better condition to improve her very needy family´s living conditions.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of used clothing in bulk to resell in her town

loans.name: Mary Brito

texts.en:
Mary is thirty-two years old, and she and her husband have four children. Mary runs a beauty salon in her house. She operates the business five days a week. She does not yet have a well-established clientele but is working hard to get new clients.

She has requested a $175 loan to buy a new blower and a chair hair dryer for the salon. Mary says if business is very profitable, she will buy a small generator to help deal with the frequent power cuts in her neighborhood. That way, she will be in a better condition to compete with other beauty salons in the neighborhood. Additional income will help her improve her family´s living conditions.

loans.use: Purchase of materials for a small beauty salon

loans.name: Taumaia

texts.en: Taumaia is a 45 year-old mother, married with 5 children. Her husband is a farmer who has dedicated his time to work everyday. Throughout the years, they have had a hard time cleaning and clearing the area for the plantation. With her first loan, she managed to buy pesticides and it made the work easier and quicker. She is very thankful for such a great opportunity to develop her plantation and to improve her family's lives.

loans.use: To buy equipment for her plantation

loans.name: Fepuleai

texts.en: Fepuleai is a 72 year-old widow with 4 children. She is a very hardworking mother, and nobody can believe her age. She is very fit and very healthy. She has been running her shop for almost five years. She is very thankful for the help of SPBD for such a great opportunity to improve her shop and to help renovate her house. This is Fepuleai's seventh loan with SPBD and she has been extending her shop every few months. She is planning to have a small market in front of her house where she can sell her taro and other crops and vegetables.

loans.use: To restock her shop

loans.name: Solema

texts.en: Solema is a married mother with 7 children. She has a hard time in raising so many children, especially because her husband is unemployed. They have lived on their plantation for many years and it is the only source of income for them. Through the years, they have struggled, but when she joined SPBD she managed to improve her family's life and develop their plantation.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Jumaboi

texts.en: Jumaboi K. lives in Mastchokh and he is married with seven children. Jumaboi K. has been a client of MicroInvest since 2006 and his loan sums are permanently increased which shows his business's stability and development. He has a wide-side business including the meat and milk production and its work out. He dreams of purchasing a horn pedigree bull and a cow for further meat and milk and sour milk goods production (its supply to the bazaars and the family is secure by the meat and milk-sour products). He plans to include in the assortment the following milk and sour products: pasteurized milk, sour milk, sour cream, curd and etc. Now Mr. K. requires a loan in 2000 STJ for a pedigree bull and a milk cow that will allow him to significantly increase the family's income and will permit him to plan further business and a wider assortment of goods.

loans.use: Jumaboi would like to purchase a pedigree bull and a milk cow.

loans.name: Abdukahor

texts.en: Abdukahor S. lives in Mastchoh and he is married and has five children. Abdukahor S. has been a client of MicroInvest since 2007 and he recommends himself as a serious and strongly-motivated client. His loan sums are permanently increased which shows his business's stability and his income increase. He has the wide-side business including livestock raising and selling, milk production and work out. He dreams of purchasing a horn pedigree bull and a milk cow for further meat and milk and sour milk goods production (its supply to the bazaars and the family is secure by the milk products). He plans to include an assortment of the following milk and sour products as pasteurized milk, sour milk, sour cream, curd and etc. Now Mr.Sulaimanov requires a loan in 1000 STJ for the horn pedigree bull and the pedigree milk cow purchase that will allow him to significantly increase the family income and will also permit him to plan further business and to widen his assortment.

loans.use: Abdukahor would like to purchase a horn pedigree bull and a pedigree milk cow.

loans.name: Losivale

texts.en: Losivale is only 32 years old but she has the will and heart to start a business which she has never done before. She is married with 2 children and she already knows how hard life is for her and her family. She heard of SPBD through women of her village and she was very excited to have this great opportunity to get a loan to start her business. She is willing to struggle no matter how hard, so her children will have a better life and better education in the future.

loans.use: To start her pork bun business

loans.name: Abun

texts.en: Abun is a 37-year-old woman who has a small shop and sells rice, snacks, vegetables etc., and she usually earns $17 per week. Her husband, U., has no regular income. Abun requests a loan to buy some goods to fill the shop. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her shop

loans.name: Sharif

texts.en: Sharif S. lives in Mastchokh; he is married and has 1 child. Sharif S. has been a client of MicroInvest since 2007 and the loan sums are permanently increased, which shows business stability and development. His business includes meat and milk production and milk products. He dreams of purchasing a horn pedigree bull and cow for further meat and milk-sour goods production. He plans to add to his inventory of milk and sour products pasteurized milk, sour milk, sour cream, curd, etc. Now Mr. S. requires a loan of 4000 STJ for a pedigree bull and milk cow purchase,  which will allow him to increase significantly the family income, and permit him to plan for further business and inventory expansion.

loans.use: Pedigree bull and milk cow purchase

loans.name: Malae Tiumalu

texts.en: Malae is 53 years old and married with 8 children. Every week, she works on the plantation and sells her taro pancakes. She is a very hardworking mother, which she believes is the key to long life. Through years of hard work, she managed to start with her pancake business and to be able to sell every day from her home. She is earning good money and is developing some of the things in her home. She is very thankful for SPBD's support which allows her to develop her business and support her family.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her pancake business and plantation

loans.name: Urima

texts.en: Urima is a married mother of 24 years of age with 2 children. Urima's family lived with a vegetable garden as their only source of income. When she got married, she decided to move on her own with her husband. Her husband is also unemployed and works on their plantation. This is Urima's second loan with SPBD. With her first loan, she bought equipment to use in their garden. With her second loan she will also buy pesticides, fertilizers, and other tools to make the work easier and quicker. Urima is very thankful for such a great opportunity to improve her family's life.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Endah

texts.en: Endah is a 51-year-old woman who has a small shop and sells rice, snacks, vegetables etc., and she usually earns US$17 per week. Her husband, A., has no fixed income. Endah requests a loan to buy some goods to fill the shop. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To fill her shop

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi is a mother of 49 years of age, married with 4 children. Naomi came from a family of 12 that was very poor. Through the years, she has been struggling so hard to find a better life and good future for her family. She decided to do something of her own. Naomi's family lived on taro plantation as their only source of income. Having a large family she opted to make taro pancakes which she thought was easy to do. With her loans she has managed to improve her family's life as well as her business. She is earning good profits so she can repay her loan as well as look after her children.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Lotufaamanatu

texts.en: Lotufaamanatu has 9 children. She has lived in Lotofaga for almost ten years with her husband and her inlaws. Plantation work is their only source of income, and having so many children she has a hard time in feeding them and sending them to school. Her husband is unemployed which makes it worse for Lotu to cope with the everyday life. Through years of struggling and though her loans with SPBD she has managed to improve her family living and develop her business into a better one.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Aotearoa

texts.en: Aotearoa is a mother of 37 years of age and has 5 children. She and her husband have worked on their plantation for years as their main source of income. She heard of SPBD through some women of the village, and she joined because this is the only door which has opened to help them to get financial support. This is Aotearoa's fifth loan with SPBD. With her loans, she has been able to help her family and develop her business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Harti

texts.en: Harti is a 31-year-old woman and has been a member of MBK for 2 years. She has a chicken & duck business. She buys chicks and  ducks then raises them before selling them. She usually earns US$20 every two months. She really needs a loan to buy 20 more ducks. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more ducks

loans.name: Malickmansur

texts.en: Malickmansur S. lives in Mastchoh. Malickmansur S. has been a client of MicroInvest only since 2007, but he regards himself as a serious and strongly motivated client. Loan sums are permanently increased, which shows business stability and income increase. His business includes raising and selling livestock, milk production, and milk products. He dreams of purchasing a horn pedigree bull and milk cow for further meat and milk-sour production. He plans to add to the inventory of milk and sour products pasteurized milk, sour milk, sour cream, curd, etc. Now Mr.S. requires a loan of 1000 STJ for the horn pedigree bull and the pedigree milk cow purchase, which will allow him to increase significantly the family income and plan for further business expansion.

loans.use: Horn pedigree bull and pedigree milk cow purchase

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 28427

loans.name: Faavae

texts.en: Faavae is a married mother of 43 years of age with 4 children. Faavae and her family are very poor and live in a very small open Samoan fale (traditional housing unit). Her husband works for our local coconut factory, but his salary is not sufficient to support the whole family. Faavae chose to do something else to earn extra money. She heard of SPBD through her friends and she decided to join. With her first loan, she started her business and with her second loan she was able to improve her business and earn good money. Faavae is planning to run a canteen once she has enough money.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her pork bun business

loans.name: Yulyani

texts.en: Yulyani is a 28-year-old woman who has five children aged 14, 12, 10, 4 and 2 years old. The first three are boys and the last two are girls. She collects and sells waste materials such as plastic cups, bottles cups, etc. She usually earns US$15 income per week. Her husband, J., is a driver who earns US$3 per day. She is a member of MBK and requesting a loan to expand her business. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Fialelei

texts.en: Fialelei is one of the oldest members of the Levi Saleimoa Centre. She is 65 years of age and a widow with 11 children. When her husband passed away 10 years ago, 5 of her children were still in school. It was hard for her -- especially having so many children, and not enough income to support them in terms of school expenses and everyday food. Fialelei is a very hardworking mother and she has struggled so hard to find better futures for her children. Two of her sons are looking after the plantation to help support Fialelei in terms of money, and some of her children are now working in some good government departments. Fialelei is very thankful for such a great opportunity that has made her able to develop her family as well as their business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Vineta Fetuanai

texts.en: Vineta is a mother of 52 years of age with 9 children. Her husband also works on their plantation -- their only source of income. Through the years, they have worked hard cleaning and clearing the area and through her loans Vineta has been able to buy most of the equipment needed in her plantation. Vineta has taken 5 loans and through her loans she has managed to improve many things in her family.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Sulton

texts.en: Sulton S. lives in Mastchokh; he is married and has 4 children. He has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2006. He regards himself as a serious and experienced client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures. He is engaged in commercial services and trade. His business is shashlik (roasted meat) and sambusa (the national flour product, with meat which is roasted in a special way). Sulton S. works in the bazaar. He has a wide assortment of national meat courses and has permanent clients. He works with clients of different income levels, and he is experienced in the business. Working in the bazaar, he is up against tough competitors, which is why he wants to widen his existing assortment. Now he requires a loan of 3600 STJ for business support and additional inventory.

loans.use: To broaden the existing assortment.

loans.name: Pesio

texts.en: Pesio is a married mother 33 years of age with 2 children who are attending primary schools. Pesio and her husband live on their own and they are so poor that sometimes they can't afford to buy their everyday food. Her husband started looking for a job, and became a taxi driver. He makes $80 WST ($32 USD) per week but unfortunately it's not enough to support his wife and 2 children. Pesio decided to do something to earn money. She heard of SPBD through some women of the village and she joined Nofoalii Centre. She is very thankful that with her loans she was able to improve her family living and start up her barbeque business. After her second loan she managed to budget their daily income so they have money to pay their bills and for some other family expenses.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her barbecue business

loans.name: Aitoai

texts.en: Aitoai is a mother of 39 years of age. She has 2 children and her husband is unemployed. Through the years they have lived on their plantation and it was their only source of income. They plan to improve the standard of their farm. Aitoai heard of SPBD through her family relatives so she decided to join. With her loan they have managed to improve many things in her home, as well as their business. She is very thankful for such a great opportunity to improve her family's lives.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Suparni

texts.en: Suparni is 25 years old, married with one child aged 1. She has a small shop which sells snacks, rice, cooking oil, gasoline and a few household items. She usually earns US$10 per day with a small profit. Suparni needs a loan to buy more goods and fill her shop. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her shop

loans.name: Talosaga

texts.en: Talosaga came from a family of 8. She is 42 years of age, married with 4 children. Her husband has been a fisherman all his life and this was their only source of income. He used to fish one day a week, but the money they get from selling the 5 or 6 fish he managed to catch could not support them. Talosaga and her husband have always wanted to buy a canoe, but they didn’t have the money to do so. Talosaga heard SPBD was providing small loans to underprivileged women so she was very happy to join. With this loan, they want to use it to buy items they have longed for.

loans.use: To buy a fishing net, fishing spear, fishing rods, and other supplies

loans.name: Surita

texts.en: Surita is a married mother of 44 years of age. Her family has lived on their taro plantation for years. She heard of SPBD through some village women and she was very happy to join. Through her loans she has managed to improve many things in her home. Surita is planning to have her own small market in her village so she can sell many other crops and improve her vegetable garden.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her plantation and market the crops

loans.name: Onih

texts.en:
Onih is 52-year-old woman, married with three children. She has a small shop which sells snacks, food and drinks, and also household products. She can earn US$10 per day. Her husband, B., is managing duck livestock, and can earn US$45 per three months.

She requests a loan to add capital for both hers and her husband's businesses. Onih hopes that she can increase her income to provide her children's tuition. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Nisolat

texts.en: Nisolat S. lives in Mastchokh; she is married and has 5 children. She has been a client of MicroInvest since 2004. Loan sums are permanently increased, which shows her business stability and income increase. She describes herself as a serious and experienced client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures. She is engaged in the commercial services and trade. She works the food products selling (cheese, condensate milk, flour products, sweets and etc). Nisolat S. works in bazaar. She has the wide-side assortment and the permanent clients. She is experienced in the business. Working in bazaar she meets the hard competitors that is why she wants to wide the existing assortment by the new products purchase. Now she requires a loan in 2000 STJ for business support and the existing assortment expansion.

loans.use: Food products.

loans.name: Mona Seumalu

texts.en: Mona has been doing her canteen business for almost six months. She is 33 years of age, married with 3 children. She was doing sewing as part of her routine life, but she doesn't get enough money from it. What she earned from her canteen is not really enough, so she decided to sell varieties of food at her canteen. She joined SPBD so she would be able to improve her businesses. She is very happy and very thankful for this great opportunity to improve her family living.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her sewing business and her canteen business

loans.name: Ruta

texts.en: Ruta is a new member for Nono'a Centre. She is 24 years old, married with 2 children. Her husband has been a farmer all his life. Through their plantation, they have managed to earn their income.  Through the advice of her friends, Ruta decided to join SPBD so she could get some financial help to improve their income. Ruta thought of making ice cakes (popsicles in a bag) because she is close to the village school and she noticed many people like eating them. With her first loan, she is eager to make good money to develop her family living.

loans.use: To start her ice cakes (popsicle) business

loans.name: Soleha

texts.en: Soleha is 34-year-old woman, married with four children aged 14, 12, 5 and 3. She has a small shop which sells snacks and a few household goods. She usually earns US$10 per day with a small profit. Soleha requests a loan to buy more goods for her shop. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her shop

loans.name: Rajab

texts.en: Rajab S. lives in Mastchoh; he is married and has 3 children. Rajab S. has been a client of MicroInvest since 2007. He describes himself as a serious and strongly motivated client. Loan sums are permanently increased, which shows business stability and income increase. He has the variety of business, including raising and selling livestock , and milk production. He dreams of  purchasing a horn pedigree bull and milk cow for a meat and milk-sour goods production. His plans include an assortment of sour products as pasteurized milk, sour milk, sour cream, curd and etc. Now Mr.S. requires the loan in 2000 STJ for a horn pedigree bull and a pedigree milk cow purchase, that allows him to increase significantly the family income, and permits him to plan a diversity of his business.

loans.use: The horn pedigree bull and pedigree milk cow purchases.

loans.name: Faete

texts.en: Faete is married with 7 children. Her husband has been a taxi driver for ages and although he works seven days a week, due to so many family commitments his taxi income is not sufficient to support their family. Faete has tried to improve her business by renovating the shop to make it look neat and new so people will want to buy from her. Through her loans she has improved and developed many things in her home.

loans.use: To buy grocery inventory for her shop

loans.name: Raheem

texts.en: Mr. Raheem is a 39-year-old married man with two childtren. He is a farmer. He lives with his family in Saatli, situated in the central part of Azerbaijan. He started his business in 1995, when he purchased one cow with money he had saved up. The work is hard but interesting and takes a lot of effort. Raheem purchases calves, breeds them, cuts and sells to butchers at the local market. At the same time, his income is not enough to cover all of Raheem’s family expenses. To increase his profit margin, Raheem has to invest some money to increase the size of his herd. A loan of $500 will allow him to buy two calves.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Vaioalii

texts.en: Vaioalii is a 55 year-old mother with 4 children. Through the years, she has struggled very hard to get her family where they are now. Through her loans with SPBD, she has managed to improve many things for her family and developed her family living.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her pig farm plantation and her canteen business

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en: Epifania is a married mother and grandmother of 76 years of age. She is the oldest member of Lona Fagaloa Centre. Her children are supporting her business, however Epi is one of those mothers who has always believed in doing things on her own. With her loans she has improved her business and she has also improved many things in her home, including renovating her home and building a flushing toilet for her family. This loan will allow her to improve her grocery business by buying more inventory.

loans.use: Epifania would like to buy grocery inventory for her shop.

loans.name: Iuliana

texts.en: Iuliana is a married mother of 38 years of age. She has four children whom are all in primary school. Through the years they have struggled so hard to maintain their business. Not many people buy from her shop because she doesn’t sell some of the things needed. She thought of improving and renovating the shop but money was the biggest problem. She heard of SPBD through some women of the village, and she was very happy to join. With this third loan she will improve many things and she has been very happy to see the big change in her income per week with her previous loans.

loans.use: Iuliana would like to buy grocery inventory for her shop.

loans.name: Mele Sione

texts.en: Mele is a young mother of 25 years of age, and she has three children. Her husband is a farmer who is always supportive of her family. Mele has been thinking of doing something to earn some money herself. Because she lives close to the road and because she lives near the airport, she has decided to start a barbeque business since there’s a lot of traffic passing every day. With her first loan she wants to make sure that her business will run well, and that it earns good money so she will be able to help in repaying her loan.

loans.use: Mele would like to start her barbecue business.

loans.name: Vaiee Tiaseuga

texts.en: Vaiee is a married mother of five and she is 43 years of age. She has struggled so hard to find a better future for her children and family. Through her loans with SPBD she has managed to improve and develop her business and improve her family's lifestyle. She is one happy mother in Alaoa Centre and she is very thankful for such a great opportunity that she is able to improve her family's lifestyle. This next loan will help her continue to make her dreams come true.

loans.use: Vaiee would like to buy supplies for her canteen business.

loans.name: Arif

texts.ru:
Arif lives in the town of Saalti, in the Repbulic of Azerbaijan in Transcaucasia. He is 39 and married with two children. Arif is the sole breadwinner for his family and his only income comes from the cultivation and sale of large livestock at the local market. Every year, he buys young heifers from the farms in adjacent villages. He raises them with the help of his wife (see photo) in 8-9 months and then sells the adult cows and bulls to local butchers. Today Arif is thinking about expanding his business, since the income from his present herd isn't enough to provide for his family. He plans to purchase an additional 5 calves per year. To do this, he needs to invest an additional $500 in his business. In order to receive this amount, Arif has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner organization, Normicro.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Г-н Arif живет в городе Саатлы Республики Азербайджан, расположенном в Закавказье. Ему 39 лет, он женат, имеет 2-х детей. Arif является единственным кормильцем семьи и имеет единственный доход от выращивания и продажи крупного рогатого скота на местном базаре. Ежегодно он покупает молодых телок с приусадебных хозяйств близлежащих деревень, выращивает их с помощью супруги (см. фото) в течении 8-9 месяцев в своём хозяйстве и затем продаёт уже повзрослевших коров и быков местным мясникам. Сегодня Arif думает о расширении своего бизнеса, т.к. дохода с нынешнего стада не хватает для обеспечения необходимых потребностей его семьи. Он планирует расширить ежегодный обьём закупок телят на 5 штук больше. Для этого ему требуется инвестировать в его бизнес около 500 долларов. Чтобы получить эту сумму, Arif обратился в микро кредитную организацию "Нормикро" - партнёру КИВА - для получения кредита.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Gulmukhor

texts.en: Gulmukhor S. lives in Mastchokh. She has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2005, and the loan sums are permanently increased, which shows the business stability and income increase. She describes herself as a  serious and experienced client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedure. She is engaged in the commercial services and trade. She works in the bazaar, where her shop is located, at the men's wear and shoe sales. Gulmukhor S. has the wide assortment that allows her to work with clients of the different income levels and permanent clients, but she wants to import new models demanded among the population today. She requires a loan in 1000 STJ to broaden the existing assortment and to develop her business of men's wear and shoes.

loans.use: To widen the existing assortment and develop the business.

loans.name: Kuasopera

texts.en: Kuasopera is a married mother of seven who is 50 years of age. She is a new member of Levili Tuvao Centre. Her husband works for Samoa's Local Shipping Company, unfortunately his salary is not sufficient to support the whole family. Kuasopera heard of SPBD through the village women in her area so she decided to join. She is a hard working mother and is very active- she has always believed in working hard. She is looking forward to earning enough money so that she will be able to start another business so she will earn more money to assist in supporting her family.

loans.use: Kuasopera would like to start up her chips business.

loans.name: Elshan

texts.ru:
Elshan G. was lives in a rural area near the town of Saalti, Azerbaijan, where he was born. He is 44, married, and has two children. Twelve years ago he rented a space and began his business repairing automobiles. Since Elshan deals with constantly developing technology, from time to time he needs to get new tools and equipment and purchase the spare parts needed for his work. With this in mind, Elshan is applying for a loan of 900 dollars from Kiva's partner, Normicro.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Г-н Elshan родился и живёт в деревне около г. Саатлы Азербайджанской Республики. Ему 44, женат, имеет 2-х детей. 12 лет тому назад он арендовал помещение и начал ремонтировать автомобили. Т.к. Elshan имеет дело с постоянно развивающейся техникой, он вынужден время от времени обновлять свои инструменты, оборудование и прикупать необходимые для работы запасные части. С этой целью он обратился с заявлением о предоставлении ему кредита под бизнес с суммой в 900 долларов в микрокредитную организацию "Нормикро" - партнеру КИВА.

loans.use: To buy new equipment and spare parts

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Rosa is 39 years of age but this is her 6th loan with SPBD. She has six children who are all schooling in the village secondary school. She is a very hard working mother and through her hard work, she has managed to bring her family to where they are now. Through her loans with SPBD she has managed to renovate her home and build a new bathroom for her family. Rosa is very thankful for the support  SPBD has given her that has improved her family's lifestyle and looks forward to improving it further with her newest loan.

loans.use: Rosa would like to restock her shop.

loans.name: Sanitoa

texts.en: Sanitoa is a widowed mother of five who is 53 years old. Her husband was a carpenter for over 10 years. When her husband passed away two years ago she had hard times in supporting her children, especially in sending them to school. Sanitoa's mother was a tailor herself, and through her mother she learned how to cut and sew clothes. She heard of SPBD through her family relatives, and she is very happy and excited for such a rare opportunity where she can receive a loan of money to assist in buying the things she needs for her business.

loans.use: Sanitoa would like to buy supplies and materials for her sewing business.

loans.name: Alamoni Mateai

texts.en: Alamoni is a married mother of four and she is 33 years of age. Her husband is a farmer and they live with her parents. Alamoni's family has a big plantation and her husband, father and three brothers look after the plantation. For many years they have not been able to afford a back sprayer which most local farmers need to assist in killing the grass. Alamoni is very thankful that with her first loan she will be able to buy supplies for her plantation and for her ice cakes (popsicles in a bag) business.

loans.use: Alamoni would like to buy supplies for her ice cake (popsicles) business and for her plantation.

loans.name: Talafou

texts.en: Talafou is 40 years old and is married with three children. Her husband is a farmer and a very hard working man. Talafou and her family are very poor. They hardly eat meat in a week. Through years of struggling and sacrificing, her family has managed to earn good money from their plantation. They have slowly improved their family house and managed to build a flushing toilet. Talafou decided to grow a vegetable garden so they can earn extra money. With her first loan she will buy the necessary equipment to build her garden.

loans.use: Talafou would like to buy supplies for her plantation.

loans.name: Terisa

texts.en: Terisa is only 21 years old and has one child. Her husband works for the petrol station in town. Terisa has always loved designing and when she heard of SPBD she was happy to join so she could buy paints and fabrics for printing elei (a traditional Samoan fabric). She makes good prints and she also uses unique designs. Terisa is very happy and thankful for this chance where she can receive loan money to start up something of her own.

loans.use: Terisa would like to buy supplies for her elei printing business.

loans.name: Faalai

texts.en: Faalai came from a family of twelve children. Faalai is number eight and she is married with two children. She has been running a popcorn business since before she joined SPBD. Faalai has had hard times in running her business. Faalai is one happy mother in Levili Tuvao Centre and she is planning to start another business so she can earn better income.

loans.use: Faalai would like to buy supplies and ingredients for her popcorn business.

loans.name: Oneone Lotovale

texts.en: Oneone is married with five children. Oneone's husband is a farmer and they live with her parents and two sisters. Oneone never went to school in her life and they have had hard times in raising their children. Oneone and her husband are very hard working and through the years of struggling they have managed to renovate their house and send their children to school. Oneone is a new member and she is very happy to have joined SPBD where she will be able to borrow money to assist with what is needed in her family.

loans.use: Oneone would like to buy supplies for her plantation.

loans.name: Matalena

texts.en: Matalena is 29 years old and married with four children. Cocoa and vegetables have been the only source of income for her family. Matalena heard of SPBD through the women in her village so she decided to join so she could develop her business into a better one. Through years of trying and sacrificing they have managed to get where they are now. Her new loan will help motivate her to become more and to earn more for a better future.

loans.use: Matalena would like to buy supplies for her Samoan cocoa business and plantation.

loans.name: Matalena

texts.en: Matalena is 29 married with 4 children. Cocoa and vegetable were the only source of income for the family. Matalena heard of SPBD through the women in her village so she decided to join so she could develop her business into a better one. Through years of trying and sacrificing they have managed to become where they are now. Through her loan it helps motivate her to  become more develop and to earn for a better future.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her Samoan cocoa business and plantation

loans.name: Matalima

texts.en: Matalima is a married mother of 22 years of age with four children. Her husband is unemployed and they live with her husband's parents. Living on cocoa as their main source of income has not been easy. In Samoa people don't drink Samoan cocoa everyday, so it is not really in demand. Sometimes Matalima only sells 20 cocoas in two days which is very little income earned in a week. She has decided to try selling pancakes also and this is the reason why she joined SPBD. With her first loan she will buy what is needed and build a proper place where she can sell her cocoa and other crops as well as pancakes.

loans.use: Matalima would like to buy supplies for her Samoan cocoa business and to start her pancake business.

loans.name: Lima

texts.en: Lima is a 53 year-old widow and a very hard working mother of three. Her husband was always very supportive and he always put his family first. Lima and her family lived on fishing as their main source of income. Unfortunately her husband died six months ago so her younger brother is now helping her. She really had a hard time especially when her husband died. She heard of SPBD so she was very happy to get such a great opportunity so she can develop her family business and change it into a better one.

loans.use: Lima would like to buy new fishing gear for her family's business.

loans.name: Sieni Lialiai

texts.en: Sieni is a married mother of 26 years of age. She has two children, aged 2 and 18 months. Sieni and her family had lived on a plantation all their lives, but unfortunately when the taro plight destroyed all the plantations on the island, her husband had no other choice but to look for a job in town. Sieni had always believed that the plantation earned more money than what her husband does. She tried so hard to go back to the plantation and when she heard of SPBD she decided to join so she could get a loan to assist with developing their plantation again. Sieni is very confident that through her first loan she will make a change in the plantation and it will enable her to bring her husband back to work on the plantation.

loans.use: Sieni would like to buy supplies for her plantation.

loans.name: Avazbicko

texts.en: Avazbicko S. lives in Mastchokh; she is divorced and has 4 children. She has been a client of MicroInvest since 2004. She describes herself as a serious and strongly motivated client. Loan sums have been permanently increased, which shows business stability and income increase. Avazbicko S. is a very experienced business person, who has a wide variety of business, including women's wear and shoes. She is partially engaged in another business: livestock. She trades in the bazaar, and thanks to her business capacities, she has clients who want to buy only her goods. Now Mrs. S. requires a loan for 4100 STJ, to increase her existing turnover and to purchase new merchancise, popular and in demand among the population today.

loans.use: To renew the existing assortment.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is a married mother of 36 years of age and she has four children. Through the years they have lived on fishing as their main source of income. Her husband is a very supportive man who has always loved fishing and he is always thinking of a way to develop it into a different standard. In the past they have used fishing nets, but with her first loan she will be buying a canoe for fishing. Maria is one happy mother who appreciates the chance given to her with which she will be able to develop her business as well as provide for her family.

loans.use: Maria would like to buy fishing gear for her family's fishing business.

loans.name: Koim

texts.en:
Mrs. Koim P., 49, works with her husband on their plot of land growing rice crops and breeding ducks, earning collectively around $6 a day in revenue from selling duck eggs to a wholesaler at a market.

This couple has five children. Two are employed at a garment factory; one is a student and the remaining two are now unemployed.

Mrs. Koim P. hopes to use this loan to purchase more ducks and feed for her livestock and the use the remaining money to buy a motorcycle so that her husband can generate more income for her family by operating a motor-taxi business.

loans.use: To purchase more ducks and feed for her livestock

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: Christina is 38 and married with two children. They used to live on their own, but when her mother got sick she moved back to live with her parents. Living with her extended family was hard for Christina and her husband. Her husband works for one electrical company in town, but unfortunately his salary is not sufficient to support the whole family. Christina decided to do something on her own, especially since sewing was her family talent. She heard of SPBD through her family relatives and she was very happy to join for this is the only chance she has to get a loan and get some financial support. In the future she is planning to build a proper place where she can do her sewing business and cook and prepare food for her barbeque stall.

loans.use: Christina would like to buy a sewing machine and fabrics for her sewing business and also some equipment for her barbeque business.

loans.name: Lusia

texts.en: Lusia is a married mother of 39 years of age. She has four children whom all in primary school. The plantation has been their only source of income over the years, and they have always wanted to buy a back sprayer, but money has been her problem. Lusia heard of SPBD through the village women, and she thought this was the only opportunity where she could get financial help. With her first loan she bought more equipment used on her plantation. This is now Lusia's 4th loan request and with her loans she has managed to improve her family's lives and develop her business.

loans.use: Lusia would like to buy supplies for her plantation.

loans.name: Miriama

texts.en: Miriama is one of the oldest members for Samusu P Centre. She is 75 years of age and she is married with ten children and fourteen grandchildren. Miriama has always been a hard-working mother and she has always wanted to make sure everything is running well in her family. Her children are looking after the plantation but with the support of their mother they have managed to get where they are now. Miriama never relies on her children for support. When she heard of SPBD she was very delighted because she had always wanted to build a proper place where she could sell her crops. Miriama is very thankful that she will be able to develop her business and improve her family's lifestyle.

loans.use: Miriama would like to buy supplies for her plantation.

loans.name: Ualolo

texts.en: Ualolo is a 51 year old married mother of 7 children. Her husband is unemployed. This is Ualolo's 7th loan with SPBD and through her loans she had managed to develop many things for her family, especially her business. Ualolo is one happy mother in Moataa Centre and she is very thankful for such a great opportunity given that she had able to improve her family living.  She would like a loan to buy more supplies for her plantation.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Faavae

texts.en: Faavae is a 45 year old mother of 7 children. They have lived on their plantation for years and it is their only source of income. Throughout the years Faavae and her husband have longed to improve their plantation but capital was the main problem. With her loans Faavae managed to buy the equipment and earn more profit each week. She is one happy mother in Siumu Centre and she is planning to build her own market in the village where people in the village could sell their crops.  She would like another loan to buy supplies for her plantation.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Bakhriddin

texts.en: Bakhriddin E. lives in Mastchokh. He has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2004, and the loan sums are permanently increased, which reveals his business stability and income increase. He describes himself as a serious and experienced client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedure. He is engaged in the commercial services and trade. He works in the bazaar; his shop is located in the men's and children's shoes section. Bakhriddin E. has a variety of inventory that allows him to work with clients of different income levels and permanent clients, but he wants to import the new models demanded among the population today. He requires a loan of 4100 STJ to widen the existing assortment, and to develop the men's and children's shoes inventory.

loans.use: To expand the existing assortment

loans.name: Fiasiumu

texts.en: Fiasiumu is a 50 year old mother of 7 children. She has lived in Siumu for almost twenty years and has been running her shop for more than five years. This is how she supports her family. Her shop is located in a good spot, as it is the only shop in their area. She would like to expand and renovate her shop but doesn't have enough money. She heard of SPBD and this was where she able fulfill her plans. She is very happy and thankful for such a great opportunity that she had able to improve not only her business but her family living.  She would like another loan to restock her inventory.

loans.use: To restock her shop

loans.name: Tolualii

texts.en: Tolualii is a 37 year old mother of two children. They have lived on a vegetable garden all their lives and this was their only source of income. Through her loans with SPBD, they have managed to buy a lot of equipment needed in their garden. Every week they sell their vegetables in the market and earn almost $300 WST ($120 USD) per week. She earning good money and through her future loans she is planning to have sell and get orders from hotels, restaurants, apart from the market.  She requests a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, fertilizer, vegetable seeds, and other supplies for her vegetable garden.

loans.use: To buy a wheelbarrow, fertilizer, vegetable seeds, and other supplies for her vegetable garden

loans.name: Farrukh

texts.en:
Mr. Farrukh is 44 years old and married with two children.  He and his family live in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in Caucasus region.
Farrukh and his whife (she is shown on the picture) run a family business together. Farrukh sells milk in the Saatli town, while his wife takes care of their cows. The income from such a small herd is too low to support the family which is why Farrukh applied to Norwegian Microcredit Saatli branch for a $500 loan to buy more calves to increase his monthly income.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Elmar

texts.en:
Mr. Elmar is 29 years old and married with one child.  He and his family live in the suburb of  Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.
Elmar has a shop and has been repairing cars since 1990. He has a number of clients and in order to retain these clients he wants to renovate his shop to make it more attractive and modern. He has applied for a loan of $500 for this purpose.

loans.use: For the renovation

loans.name: Saidmakhmad

texts.en: Saidmakhmad K. lives in Mastchokh. He is an active client of MicroInvest since 2004, and the loan sums are permanently increased. This shows business stability and income increase. He describes himself as a serious and experienced client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedure. He is engaged in the commercial services and trade. He works in the bazaar, where his shop sells perfume. Saidmakhmad K. has a broad assortment (men's and women's spirits, cosmetics, lotions and creams, etc.) that allows him to work with clients of a different income level. Mr. K. requires a loan of 2500 STJ, to widen the existing assortment and to develop the business he is engaged in.

loans.use: To widen the existing assortment and to develop the business

loans.name: Sung

texts.en:
Mrs. Sung V. L. is married with five children and lives with her husband in a part of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia.

She runs a stand in front of a primary school selling biscuits and candies to a number of little students passing by and generally makes about $1.50 to $2 per day of profit. Her husband is self-employed as a construction foreman making around $8 a day in revenue. Four of her children are enrolled in school and one is too young to attend school.

Mrs. V. L. hopes to use this loan to purchase construction tools for her husband's business. ( Her husband is pictured because Mrs. Sung V. L. is unavailable)

loans.use: To purchase construction tools to assist in her husband's business.

loans.name: Chuong

texts.en:
Mrs. Chuong P., 27, works with her husband buying cigarettes from a company and reselling them to wholesalers, earning collectively about $3.20 per day. She has one little child, and her father is living with her.

Mrs. Chuong P. hopes to use this loan to expand her inventory by purchasing more cigarette packs to meet her clients' demands and improve her life.

loans.use: To purchase more cigarettes to meet her clients' needs.

loans.name: Nuri

texts.en: Nuri is one of the active clients of Microinvest. Her first loan from our organization was in 2003, which was spent on an expansion of her assortment. She has been in trade for over 10 years, and of course she has a great number of constant clients. Her goods are less expensive than those in commercial shops and she purchases the goods herself. She brings her goods from the Istaravshan wholesale market, district of Khujand, Tadjikistan. Her daughter is her business partner, and she stays in business since her mother has left on a trip. Nuri has one problem: her roof is leaky  in her home, and she wants to increase the volume of her goods and get maximum profit so she can spend part of her income on reconstruction of her roof for family.

loans.use: Increasing the volume of goods.

loans.name: Inobat

texts.en: Inobat K. lives in Mastchokh; she is married and has 4 children. She is an active client of MicroInvest since 2005. She recommends herself as a serious and experienced client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures. She is engaged in the commercial services and trade. She has a business in street trading (home products for every day). Inobat K. works in the bazaar. She has a broad assortment, but working in the bazaar, she meets hard competitors. That is why she wants to broaden her existing assortment. Now, Mrs.K. requires a loan for 2800 STJ, for business support and expansion of inventory, which allows her to increase the family income and to continue her children's education.

loans.use: For business support and widening the assortment of goods.

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 28484

loans.name: Thoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Thoeun P., 29, is married with two school-aged children and works on her piece of land raising pigs. She earns about $2 per day in revenue.

Her husband works for a private company as a truck driver making up to $10 a day in revenue. Mrs. Thoeun P. hopes to use this loan to increase her livestock by adding more pigs to increase her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs to expand her livestock.

loans.name: Sanoat

texts.en: Sanoat N. lives in Mastchokh; she is married and has 4 children. She is the client of MicroInvest since 2004. She describes herself as a serious and strongly motivated client. Loans have always increased business; that shows business stability and income increase. Sanoat N. is very experienced in business in women's, children's and men's wear and shoe sales. She trades in the bazaar, and thanks to her business capacities, she has the clients who want to buy only her goods. She has a direct supplier, which allows her to work with clients of different income levels. Now, Mrs. N. requires a loan of 4100 STJ to increase the existing turnover, and to update the existing assortment with new model imports, which are popular and all the demand among the population today.

loans.use: To increase and renew the existing merchandise.

loans.name: Khup

texts.en:
Mrs. Khup C., 45, is a mother of five children and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia.

She and her husband work producing mortars and pestles, earning collectively around $6 a day in revenue. Also, three of their children work producing pestles and mortars, which is the main business of this village.

Mrs. Khup C. hopes to use this loan to purchase more stone and some tools to assist in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stone and some tools to assist in her business.

loans.name: Taksulu

texts.en: Taksulu N. lives in Mastchokh; she is married and has 5 children. She has been a client of MicroInvest since 2005. She recommends herself as a serious and highly motivated client. Loan sums are permanently increased to those who show business stability and an income increase. She is very experienced in business and has a wide business in women's, children's and men's wear and shoe selling. She trades in the bazaar and, thanks to her business capacity, she has clients who want to buy only her goods. She is a straight supplier, which allows her to work with clients of different income levels. Now Mrs. N. requests a loan of 3,500 TJS (US$1,025) to increase turnover and renew the existing assortment by importing new styles that are popular and in demand among the population today.

loans.use: to increase turnover and to renew the existing assortment

loans.name: Makhmadrozik

texts.en: Makhmadrozik B. lives in Mastchokh; he is married and has 3 children. He has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2004, and loan sums are permanently increased to those who show business stability and  an income increase. He recommends himself as a serious executive client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedure. He is engaged in commercial services and trade. He works in the bazaar where his meat-selling shop is located. Makhmadrozik B. has an assortment of goods and is a straight supplier, which allows him to work with clients of different income levels. He also has permanent clients. But he wants to widen the size of his shop to allows him to increase the turnover and assortment. He requests a loan for 2,500 TJS (US$725) to widen the existing shop and assortment and to develop the business.

loans.use: to increase the turnover and assortment

loans.name: Damat

texts.en: Damat (his son is pictured) has his own farming business which he has been running for 7 years.  This 40- year-old man is married, has 2 children and lives in the Salyan region, in the village of Khaladj. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy fertilizer and pesticides for improving his farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Eang

texts.en:
Mrs. Eang C. L., 42, is a widow and lives only with her son in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia.

She works selling vegetables at an open-air market, making around $5 per day of profit.

Her son is married and works as a carpenter making cabinets, tables, chairs and closets and sells them to wholesalers, earning around $100 per month in revenue.

Mrs. Eang C. L. hopes to use this loan to purchase more wood so her son can expand his business and increase the family's income. ( Mrs. Eang C. L. is pictured with her two grandchildren)

loans.use: To purchase more wood so her son can increase the family's income.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sim N., 42, is married and lives with her husband and six children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia.

She works on her farmland raising plenty of ducks and makes around $5 a day from selling her ducks to wholesalers. Her husband is a fisherman and typically makes about $3 per day.

Mrs. Sim N. has six children. Two are employed at a garment factory; another two attend school and the remaining two are married.

Mrs. Sim N. hopes to use this loan to expand her livestock by adding more ducks to increase her income.

loans.use: To expand her livestock by adding more ducks.

loans.name: Chea’S Group

texts.en:
Mr. O. C. was selected to be a group leader by members for a loan from Maxima. In the group there are two families including him.

Mr. O. C., 51, and his wife, Chaum Seng, (shown in photo with his wife on the right) have been married since 1979. They have seven children, three sons and four daughters. Two of their children are studying in the local school. Another two children are married and living in separate houses, and are farming with their parents. C. and his family are living on an island of the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. The have been farming since 1979. C. is requesting his fourth loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $150. He will use this loan for his tomato farming.

Mrs. C. Sinon (shown in photo with her husband on the left), 26, and her husband have been married since 2001. They have two sons; both of them are still young and stay at home. Sinon has been a silk weaver since 1997. It’s a skill she learned from her neighbor. Her husband does farming. He grows tomatoes in his farm not so far from his village. Sinon is requesting her first loan from Maxima in the amount of $150. She will use this loan for her husband's tomato farming.

loans.use: For growing tomatoes

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en: Mr. P. Samnang is single and living with his mother (shown in photo) on an island of the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. He is an only child. His father died many years ago. Samnang started doing farming in 1997. He grows tomatoes, corn, and papayas on his farm near the village. His mother also does farming with him. He did not finish primary school. He is requesting his first loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $200. He will use this loan for expanding his farming business.

loans.use: For growing tomatoes, corn, and papayas

loans.name: Phoury

texts.en:
Mrs. T. Phoury, 40, and her husband, Mr. Teav Tean, 43, have been married since 1990. They have no children. Phoury and her family are living on an island of the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. Phoury has been a silk weaver since she was 16 years old. It's a skill she learned from her mother. Her husband learned to weave silk from her in 1993 and stared weaving silk in the same year. Now, he is a good silk weaver.

Phoury is requesting her fifth loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $200. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and to pay for the preparation of her husband’s loom.

loans.use: Buy silk materials and prepare loom

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Mrs. Long K. S., 29, is a mother of two children and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia.

She works weaving silk clothes and generally makes around $2 each day. Her husband is both a construction worker and a motor-taxi driver, making on average around $2.50 per day.

Mrs. Long K. S. hopes to use this loan to purchase weaving threads and other tools for her business.

loans.use: To purchase weaving threads and other tools to assist in her business.

loans.name: Kan

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Kan, 69, and her husband, Mr. Mao Loeng, 74, have been married since 1957. They have two children, one son and one daughter. Her daughter has been married and living with her and weaving silk at home. Her son is studying. Kan and her family are living on an island of the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. Kan has been a silk weaver since 1953. It's a skill she learned from her mother. Her husband learned to weave silk from her and started weaving silk in the same year, but now he is retired.

Kan is requesting her sixth loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $300. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and to pay for the preparation of her new loom.

loans.use: Buy silk materials and prepare loom

loans.name: Sophoin

texts.en:
Mrs. T. Sophoin, 33, and her husband have been married for 3 years and have one son. Her husband works in another province and does not come home so often. She lives with her parents and her brother who is a driver for a pure drinking water company. Sophoin and her family have been in the business of doing farming for many years. She is raising pigs, growing melons, and planting bananas.

Sophoin is requesting her fourth loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $500. She will use this loan to buy feed for raising pigs and some amount for her farming of melons and bananas.

loans.use: Buy feed for raising pigs and doing farming.

loans.name: Roeun

texts.en:
Mrs. N. Roeun, 36, and her husband, Mr. Tek Khen, 37, have been married since 1991. They have five children, three sons and two daughters. All of their children are studying in local schools. Roeun’s home is about twenty five kilometers from Phnom Penh. Roeun has been a silk weaver since 1991. It's a skill she learned from her neighbor. Her husband is selling mosquito nets, cotton scarfs, and cloth on his motorbike from village to village. They both work hard to support all of their children to study to as high a level as possible.

Roeun is requesting her first loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $1,000. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials and sewing thread, and to pay for the preparation of her loom. Some of the amount will also be used for expanding her husband’s business of selling mosquito net, cotton scarfs, and cloth.

loans.use: Buy silk materials; prepare loom for weaving; and purchase mosquito nets, cotton scarfs, and cloth for reselling.

loans.name: Atsoufui

texts.fr:
Miss Astoupi has been a hair salon owner for the past two years. She is 25 years old and learned this trade in the city education centre. With the help of her parents, she started her own hair salon in a roadside shack. She is asking for a loan so that she can improve her hair salon and attract more clients. She is a serious and very motivated woman.

Mlle Astoupi est propriétaire de coiffure depuis deux ans.Elle agée de 25 ans et a appris son métier dans l'un des centre de formation de la ville. Avec l'aide de ses parents elle a commencé sa coiffure dans une barraque au bord de la route . Elle veut que l'emprunt améliorer le cadre du sallon afin d'attirer plus de clientèle. C'est une fille sérieuse et pleine d'initiative

loans.use: Improvement of Hair Salon

loans.name: Nhek

texts.en:
Mrs. K. Nhek, 44, is a widow with one son, Mr. Soung Phois (age 25, shown photo with his mother). Nhek and her son live in a small house about thirty kilometers from Phnom Penh. She is in the business of selling sweets in front of her house. She sells many kinds of Cambodian sweets and sells from 6:00 a.m. to 10:00 a.m. Her son is growing rice and helping her make sweets for selling. She hopes to save some money from her profit for her son to raise pigs and produce rice wine for selling.

Nhek is requesting her first loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $200. She will use this loan for expanding her business of selling sweets.

loans.use: For expanding her sweets selling and for growing rice

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Mrs. A. Sophal, 43, and her husband have been married since 1983. They have eight children, six sons and two daughters. Two of their children are working, three are studying in a local school, and the other three are still young and stay at home. Sophal and her family live along National Road number five about thirty kilometers from Phnom Penh. She and her husband are in the business of growing rice and running a grocery store. She started growing rice when she married and started her grocery store in 2006.

Sophal is requesting her third loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $100. She will use this loan to purchase grocery items for reselling in her store.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for reselling.

loans.name: Maman

texts.fr:
Maman N. is 35 years old, married and a mother of 2 children. She has been selling yams at the Adéta market for more than 5 years. She buys the yams from the surrounding villages and resells them at the Adéta market. This activity allows her to be independent and to contribute to her family's needs. Recently, there has been an increased demand for yams and she needs financial assistance to satisfy this need. This is the reason she is requesting the loan.

Maman N. est agée de 35 ans , mariée et mère de 2 enfants.Elle est revendeuse d'ignames au marchéé d'Adéta depuis plus de 5 ans. Elle va dans les villages environnants pour acheter les ignames et les revend au marché d'Adéta. Cette activité lui permet d'être indépendante et de contribuer aux charges de la famille.Depuis queleque temps la demande devient importante et a besoin d'une aide financière pour satisfaire la demande .C'est dans ce cadre qu'elle sollicite l'emprunt

loans.use: Purchase of yams in surrounding villages for resale at the local market in Adéta

loans.name: Shahin

texts.en: R. Shahin is 40 years old and married with 2 children. He is from Azerbaijan- Armenian conflict territory in the Kelbejer region, situated in the west part of Azerbaijan.  Shahin began his business 12 years ago. He is the only earner in his family and is busy with repairs to his home. He wants to increase his client list and needs to buy necessary tools and equipment for his business. He wishes to take out a $300 loan to expand his repair area and to purchase more equipment. He believes that this expansion will allow him to improve the living conditions of his family and he plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

loans.use: to purchase more equipment

loans.name: Aygun

texts.en: Aygun is an Internally Displaced Person from Jabrail region located in the south-east part of Azerbaijan. She and her family was relocated to Baku as a result of Armenian-Azerbaijan military conflict over Garabakh. She now lives in unfinished first aid building in Binagadi settlement in the suburbs of Baku with her husband and three children. She trades fruit and vegetables nearby. She has been in this business since 1999 when she applied to Normicro Baku branch and took out a total of five loans all of which she has paid back successfully. She buys goods from wholesalers that bring goods from other regions. Now she needs 1200$ to invest in her business and increase her working capital thus increasing the volume of sales.

loans.use: To invest is business and increase volume of sales

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Akou A. is 37 years old and the mother of 5 children. For the last 7 years, she has been the owner of a general store in the market of Assahoun. She has an ever-increasing clientele. She stocks up at the market in Lomé to supply her store. She derives an income from this activity and pays for her children’s school fees because her husband is ill. Today, she wants to enlarge her store this is why she is asking for a loan.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Mme Akou A. est agée de 37 ans mère de 5 enfants et propriétaire d'une boutique d'alimentation générale installée au marché d'Assahoun depuis 7 ans.Elle a une clientèle sans cesse croissante Elle s'approvisionne au marché de Lomé pour alimenter sa boutique. Elle tire ses sources dans cette activité et finance l'éducation de ses enfants car son mari est malade. Elle veut aujourdhui agrandir la boutique ce qui explique sa demande d'emprunt.

loans.use: Purchase in Lomé of 15 bags of rice, 20 jugs of oil -50 liters each, 20 boxes of canned goods for resale in Assahoun.

loans.name: Ziyadkhan

texts.en: Ziyadkhan was born in 1977. He is married and has 2 children. This man lives with his family in the Salyan region in Khaladj village. He has been breeding sheep and goats for 3 years. Now  he needs a loan of $1200 to buy baling presses (for hay) for improving his business.

loans.use: to buy baling presses

loans.name: Pon

texts.en:
Mr. C. Pon, 46, and his wife, Nhem Phanny, have been married since 1983. They have five children, ages 8 to 25. Now, only the youngest daughter still lives at home and attends the local primary school. The rest are grown and married. Pon opened his business for repairing motos and bicycles two years ago. He later added a new service for moto spray-washing to increase profits. Phanny works tending her jasmine plants and also buys flowers from her neighbors to resell at the larger district market. She helped her family grow jasmine even as a girl, and has had her additional business of reselling for two years now. Prior to this, they were both vegetable farmers and rented their farm land from a neighbor. When he sold the land, Pon and Phanny were forced to find new work to support their family.

Pon is requesting his first loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $1,000. He will use this loan to purchase a water pump to more easily fill his tanks used for spray-washing from the river 200 meters behind their home. A portion of the loan will also be used to purchase parts for bicycle and moto repair. Additionally, Phanny will use this loan to purchase a 1-season contract for jasmine flowers. This contract will entitle her to care for her neighbors' jasmine plants and pick an unlimited amount of flowers to sell, giving the family a stable income for many months to come.

(Photo: Pon in front of water tanks)

loans.use: Purchase water pump and jasmine flowers

loans.name: Fidayaddin

texts.en: Fidayaddin is an Internally Displaced Person from the Fizuli region located in the south-east part of Azerbaijan. He and his family was relocated to the university dormitory in Baku city as a result of Armenian-Azerbaijan military conflict over Garabakh. He rents a booth and works as a barber. He has been in this business for more than 10 years. He wants to repair his barber shop and build a water line. This could consierably increase the level of service he is able to offer to his customers. He has had one previous loan from Normicro Baku branch. Now he is applying for a second loan of 600AZN to invest in his business.

loans.use: To repair his shop

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 28509

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en:
