Mrs. S. Sreymom, 29, and her husband, Mao Sophal, have been married for 2 years. They have one 13-month-old daughter. Until recently, they lived with Sreymom's older brother and his family where they learned how to grow flowers. Now, they have a small, thatched home of their own and a neighbor has given them permission to farm his fallow land. Sophal also works as a construction mason, a skill he learned when only a teenager.

Sreymom is requesting her first loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $500. She will use this loan to purchase flower transplants from neighbors to add to the few from her brother. In total, they plan to grow four different varieties of flowers. A portion of the loan will also be used to purchase fertilizer. From the time of planting, it will be 2-3 months before Sreymom can begin picking the flowers. Some, she will bring to Phnom Penh to sell direct; others will be sold to a local buyer that visits the area. As the rotation of flowers will grow year-round; this will provide them with a steady income and financial independence.

loans.use: Buy flower transplants and fertilizer

payments.comment:
Dear lender,

Mrs. Sreymom Seng has enough money to paid off her loan early before contract.

Thank you.

loans.name: Sebastiao Amos

texts.pt:
Sebastião Amos C., is a 43 year old from Homoine District, Inhambane Province. He grew up under the care of his mother, his father having died when he was still young. He attended school upto the 4th Grade, after which he had to stop given there were no availbale facilities in his area to continue his schooling further. He did his compulsory military service between 1983 and 1986 after which he married and started a business buying coal in Matutuine to sell in the city of Maputo, with the help of his cousin, who had a boat. During this time in the Matutuine District, he explored other busines opportunities. He constructed a small shop selling local produce, saved some funds and managed to buy a vehicle, which allowed him to increase his sales. He later started the construction of another shop selling a wider range of products, having resorted to a loan to finish this project. With this busines he looks after 8 people. Both Sebastião and his wife work in the shop, and are ocassionally helped by his children, when they are on school holidays. With the USD 1,200.00 loan, he intends to stock-up on his inventory in order to satisfy demand. He would also like to consolidate his actual business by creating a new restaurant and bar, since he is now only open until 19:00.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

Localização: Bela –Vista, Matutuine Cliente : Sebastião Amos C. Montante : 40.000,00MT (1,200.00US$). Aplicação: Compra de Mercadoria . Inicio: 30/11/2007 Fim: 30/04/2009 Sebastiao amos C., de 43 anos de idade, natural de homoine, Distrito de Homoine, Provincia de Inhambane, cresceu junto com a sua mãe, o seu pai faleceu muito sendo, tendo se escolarizado até 4ª Classe, onde deixou de continuar com os estudos devido a falta de condições para continuar com os estudos na cidade, dado que na sua zona o nivel que existia era ate 4ª Classe.

Em 1983 entrou no Serviço Militar obrigatório e foi desmobilizado em 1986 e se casou maritalmente logo depois a sua desmobilização, no mesmo ano começou o negocio de compra de carvão e revenda na cidade de Maputo com apoio do seu primo que tinha barco com o qual vinha até Matutuine e este negocio durou 4 anos.

Durante as andanças no distrito de Matutuine foi vendo outras possibilidades de negocio, tendo construindo um pequeno estabelecimento comercial de material local, fez algumas popanças e conseguiu comprar uma viatura com a qual permitiu aumentar as suas vendas, posteriormente iniciou construcao de um estabelecimento comercial de material convencional, tendo recorrido ao emprestimo para sua conclusao.

Com o negocio sustenta 8 pessoas, na loja trabalha ele e a esposa, algumas vezes os filhos, quando estes estiverem de ferias escolares.

Com este emprestimo de 1,200.00 US$, o cliente pretende reforçar stocks de modo a satisfazer a demanda.

Perspectivas, consolidar o actual projecto, criando outro serviço no ramo do comercio construindo um restaurante e Bar, ja que agora só atende a clientela até 19:00h,

loans.use: To increase stock for his business

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr:
Mrs. Marie A. is married and the mother of 4 children. She is 38 years old. She buys yams in the surrounding villages and sells them at the market in Kpalimé. She has been practicing this activity for the last 10 years. Her husband does not have a regular income, Marie, with the income from her business, takes care of the school fees for her 4 children. She has very diverse customers and they are increasing in numbers. The current loan will help to increase her stock and meet the demand.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Mme Marie A. est mariée et mère de 4 enfants .Elle agée de 38 ans.Elle achète des ignames dans les villages environnants et les revend au marché de kpalimé. Elle exercerce cette activité depuis plus de 10 ans. Son mari n'ayant pas de revenus réguliers, c'est Marie qui s'occupe de la scolarisation de ses 4 enfants avec le revenu tiré de l'activité .Elle a des clients très variés et sont en pleines progression. Le présent emprut va l'aider à augmenter son stock et faire face à la demande.

loans.use: Purchase of yams in surrounding villages for resale in Kpalimé

loans.name: Savun's Group

texts.en:
These two families live in a small village along the Mekong River about twenty kilometers north of Phnom Penh. They are requesting this, their first group loan from Maxima, to buy two small diesel-powered water pumps for irrigation.

Mrs. C. Savun (age 48 – right in photo) and her husband (age 44) have been married since 1978. They have ten children, five of whom still live at home. Of those, three still study in school. As a child, she attended school for only three years and, like many Khmers (Cambodians), she focused her life on working to survive. Savun has been weaving grass mats since she was a young girl. She and her family also grow some of the grasses and straw they use for weaving.

Mrs. S. Sakhorn (age 55) and her husband (age 60) have been married since 1970. They had eleven children but two died. Six still live at home with their parents and only the youngest boy remains in school. Like Savun, Sakhorn has been weaving since she was young. Neither Sakhorn nor her husband ever attended school.

Both weavers also buy some weaving materials such as reeds from villages across the nearby Mekong River. They sell everything they produce to people in their and nearby villages. A mat, typically used as a sleeping pad, will last for two to four years and costs about (US) $9.00.

loans.use: To buy diesel irrigation pumps for growing grass and straw

loans.name: Giyas

texts.en: Goyasis 34 years old. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Jabrail region situated in the east part of Azerbaijan- Azerbaijan- Armenian conflict zone. Right now he lives with his wife and two children in an unfinished clinic building in the Binagadi settlement in suburbs of Baku. He started his trading foodstuffs in 2000. He rents a shop. At the beginning of the business he applied to Normicro Baku branch for his first loan and now he is looking for a second loan to increase his purchasing power and income. He has applied for a loan of 1300 AZN. 1000 AZN will be funded by Kiva and the remaining 300 AZN by Normicro.

loans.use: To invest in business and increase sales

loans.name: Arifin

texts.en:
Mr. K. Arifin (age 31) and his family live in a small village near the Mekong River about twenty kilometers north of Phnom Penh. Arifin and his wife (age 27) have been married for nine years. They have a five-year-old girl. Arifin attended school only through the third grade. His wife attended through the tenth.

Arifin and his wife are requesting this, their third loan from Maxima, to buy a fishing boat. Arifin has been fishing on the nearby Mekong River since he was young. He usually fishes with his father but, during the main fishing season, which runs from January through March, they hire up to six workers. In addition to taking care of the home and family, his wife sells the fish in a market at a village on the opposite shore of the Mekong. They also sell to roaming Vietnamese buyers who take the catch back downstream to their own country. If Arifin and his wife can save enough money, they want to build a new house. (See part of their current house behind them in photo.)

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy car for transportation

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en: Ilham B.  is 29 year old. He is a refugee from the Azerbaijan- Armenian conflict territory of the Jabrail region, situated in the east part of Azerbaijan. Right now he lives with his family in Baku. He started his business trading foodstuffs in 1996. He rents a shop and has had two previous loans from Normicro Khachmaz branch and proved himself as one of their best clients. He has had four previous loans from Normicro Baku branch. Now he is applying again for a loan of 1200 AZN to invest in business. 1000 AZN will be funded by Kiva and 200 AZN by Normicro.

loans.use: To invest in business and increase volume

loans.name: Sophoin

texts.en: Mr. B. Sophoin (age 29) lives in a small village near the Mekong River about twenty kilometers north of Phnom Penh. Sophoin and his sister live with their mother. Sophoin attended school only through the sixth grade. Sophoin and his sister are requesting this, their third loan from Maxima, to buy a third horse and a cart. The two siblings have been operating their dirt hauling business for two years. Currently they have two horses and carts but would like to buy two more. A horse costs about (US) $700 and a cart from $200-$300. Their house is backed by the Mekong River and it’s from there they get soil which is used as fill on construction sites. Each year during the monsoon, the river swells and deposits tons of silt along its banks. As the water recedes, entrepreneurs like Sophoin load the soil into carts and transport it into neighboring villages. Depending on how far they have to drive the cart, Sophoin charges between $3.50 and $4.00 per cartload.

loans.use: To purchase a horse and cart

loans.name: Hakim

texts.en: Hakim was born in 1970. He is married and has one child. This man lives in the Salyan region in Khaladj village. Now this man needs a loan of $1200 to buy baling presses (for hay). Hakim has 8 years of experience in this business.

loans.use: to buy baling presses

loans.name: Thaghet

texts.en: Mr. Thaghet is 48, and married with two children. He lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in Caucasus region. Thaghet is a taxi driver and is looking for credit so that he can make repairs to his vehicle which is his main source of income.

loans.use: To repair his taxi

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en: Mrs. P. Vanna, 41, and her husband have been married since1992. They have four sons. All of their sons are studying in a local school. Vanna and her family live along National Road number Two about twenty kilometers north of Phnom Penh. She and her husband are in the business of fishing and doing farming. Vanna is selling fish in the village. She started selling in 2001. Her husband grows peanuts and does fishing for her selling. Vanna has borrowed money from Maxima many times. Now she is requesting loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $1,000. She will use this loan to purchase a cow and peanut seeds for her farming business.

loans.use: Purchasing a cow and growing peanuts

loans.name: Abilio

texts.pt:
Abílio C. is married and father of two daughters. He is 41 years old and a native to Inhambane. He lived with his parents until he was 8 years old when he moved to live with his paternal grandparents and finish elementary school. In 1983 he received a scholarship to Cuba where he made the middle level in general economics, and in 1991 he moved back to Mozambique. In 1994 he was hired by Mozambique Electric, a public company, as an administrative and financier where he works today.

Since he has a large family, a wife, 2 children, and his parents all depend on him, and he had to start a business producing cut chickens to increase his income. Currently he relies on a poultry farm with capacity of 1,500 chickens that he built appropriately. He employs 4 people including himself, his wife, and two other ladies that are in charge of the sales. With this loan he intends to continue the poultry business and increase the number of actual chickens to 1,000 from the current 500. After he pays back this loan he plans to borrow another one to continue the construction work on his family residence.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva volunteer

Abílio C., casado maritalmente e pai de duas filhas, 41 anos de idade, Natural de Inhambane, até aos oito anos vivia com os país e mais tarde passou a viver com avos paternos, onde conclui o ensino primario. Em 1983 obteve bolsa de estudos para Cuba, onde fez o nível médio em economia geral e em 1991 regressa a Moçambique. Em 1994 foi contratado pela electicidade de Mozambique – empresa publica, como administrativo e financeiro, onde trabalha até hoje.

Uma vez que tem uma familia numerosa, esposa, dois filhos e seus pais, todos dependem dele, teve que iniciar o negocio de producao de frangos de corte para aumento de rendimento. Actualmente conta com um aviario com capacidade de 1,500 frangos, construido com meios proprios e emprega 4 pessoas, incluindo ele proprio, esposa e outras duas senhoras que se encarregam das vendas. Com este emprestimo pretende dar continuidade com a actividade avicola e aumentar a quantidade dos actuias 500 para 1,000 pintos de engorde. Perspectivas, depois de concluir o emprestimo pretende outro para dar continuidade com as obras de construcao da residencia familiar.

loans.use: Buy Construction Materials

loans.name: Metanet

texts.en: Metanet is an Internally Displaced Person from Fizuli region located in the south-east part of Azerbaijan. She and her family were relocated to Baku as a result of Armenian-Azerbaijan military conflict over Garabakh. She now lives in an university dormitory with her husband (also pictured) and three children. She trades fruit and vegetables near the dormitory, a business that she and her husband started in 1994 when he moved to Baku with a loan of $300 from Normicro Baku bank. Today, they buy goods from wholesalers that bring goods from regions and sell to retailers in the big markets. Now they need a loan of 1200 AZN to increase working capital. 1000 AZN will be funded by Kiva, and the remaining 200 AZN will be funded by Normicro. She has had a total of 6 loans, all of which she has paid back on time.

loans.use: To expand range of goods

loans.name: Phearin

texts.en:
Mr. R. Phearin, 40, and his wife have been married since 1987. They have eight children, three sons and five daughters. Five of their children are studying in a local school, the oldest is helping his parents sell grass, and the other two young girls stay at home. Phearin and his family live along National Road number Two about twenty kilometers north of Phnom Penh. He and his wife are in the business of selling grass for cows. He carriages the grass by his moto remoque to sell in the village with his wife and his son. He started selling in 2002.

Phearin is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time in the amount of $600. He will use this loan to change his moto remoque carriage.

loans.use: Changing a moto remoque carriage

loans.name: Ikram

texts.en: Ikram has run his farming business for 10 years. He was born in 1957. This man is married and has 3 children. The A. family lives in the Salyan region in Khaladj village. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy vine stakes and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy vine stakes and fertilizer

loans.name: Daniel Machecane

texts.pt:
Daniel Machecane N. is 36 years old and native to Santa Maria in the district of Matutuine in the province of Maputo. He grew up with his parents and attended school until the 4th grade when he had to stop because of the war in 1982. When he was 15 year old (1986) he began fishing with his father for six years and was able to arrange conditions for marriage in the church in 1992. In the same year as is custom he went to South Africa where he worked for a fishing company for 8 years. He was able to save enough money that he came to Mozambique, bought a sail boat, and began fishing again.

He asked for a loan through Hluvuku for 6.000,00MT to buy fishing nets. With this work he is able to support a family of 8 people, his 5 children, his wife, and her parents. With good management he was able to purchase 3 boats with motors and employ 4 workers plus others depending on the needs of the day. When there are lots of waves (wind) he needs more workers to pull out the nets, and the number varies between 8 and 10 people.

Through his experience as a sailor he was hired to be a boat driver by a tourist company that works in the area. The job opened his eyes to offering transport services to take people and goods from Mozambique to South Africa and back, but he realized he did not have sufficient funds to pursue it unless he returned one more time to Hluvuku to ask for a loan of $1,200US to buy the vehicle in South Africa. He will be able to hire 2 people, a driver and a helper. Most likely he will consolidate his projects (fishing and transport) and be a reference in the community where poverty continues to affect more than 80% of the population.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva volunteer

Daniel Machecane N., de 36 anos de idade, natural de santa maria, posto administrativo de Machangulo, Distrito de Matutuine, Provincia do Maputo, cresceu junto com os próprios pais, tendo se escolarizado até 4ª Classe, onde deixou de continuar com os estudos devido a guerra, isto em 1982.

Aos 15 anos (1986) começou actividade pesqueira junto do seu pai durante seis anos tendo conseguido criar condições para o casamento pela igreja em 1992, e no mesmo ano como costume da zona foi a Africa do sul, onde trabalhou numa empresa de pesca durante oito anos, dai poupou do seu salário um valor que veio a Moçambique comprar um barco a vela e recomeçou a pesca em Moçambique.

Tendo recorrido a Hluvuku pedir emprestimo no valor de 6.000,00mt para compra de redes de pesca. Com esta actividade sustenta uma familia de 8 pessoas sendo seus 5 filhos, sua esposa e os seus pais. Pela boa gestao que tem levado acabo, conseguiu comprar 3 barcos com respectivos motores, com os quais emprega 4 trabalhadores, mais outros vários sansionais segundo a necessidade do dia, uma vez que quando ha muitas ondas (vento) é necessário muita mão de obra, para puxar as redes e o numero varia entre oito a dez pessoas.

Pela sua experiência como marinheiro foi contratado por uma empresa turistica que trabalha na zona como Piloto de barco e Motorista, o emprego abriu visão na area de prestar serviços de transporte de pessoas e bens de Moçambique à África do sul e Vice versa e para tal viu se sem fundos suficiente para efeito, onde nada menos que ter recorrido mais uma vez a Hluvuku pedir o emprestimo no valor de 80.000,00MT para compra da viatura na Vizinha África do sul. Com esta actividade vai empregar duas pessoas, um motorista e ajudante. Perspectivas, consolidar os actuais projectos (pescas e tranportes) para ser uma referencia naquela comunidade, onde a pobreza continua afectando mais de 80% da populaçao.

loans.use: Purchase vehicle for transportation

loans.name: Adjo Lébéné

texts.fr:
At 29 years of age, Miss Adjo Lébéné D. is handicapped and comes from a very poor family. She abandoned her studies early due to a lack of support and began selling charcoal. She buys bags of charcoal on credit and resells them at retail prices. For this project, she is asking for a loan of $400. This will allow her to buy sufficient quantities in cash from now on in order to avoid frequent stock shortages. Very intelligent and dedicated, she will increase her market share and make her business more profitable.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 29 ans, Mademoiselle D. Adjo Lébéné est handicapée et issue d’une famille très pauvre. Elle a vite abandonné ses études par manque de support et s’est lancée dans la vente de charbon de bois. Elle achète à crédit le sac de charbon et les revend en détail. Par ce projet, elle sollicite un crédit de $400. Ce qui lui permettra d’acheter désormais en espèces et en quantité suffisante afin d’éviter de fréquente rupture de stock. Très habile et dévoué, elle va accroître sa part de marché et rentabiliser plus ses activités.

loans.use: To buy and sell bags of charcoal

loans.name: Akpédjé

texts.fr:
Miss Akpédjé Q. was born handicapped on 21 November 1971 in Lomé, et lives in Abobo-Komé. Having lost her father, she lives with her mother in a rented place and has no support. With her small means, Akpédjé began in the business of selling fritters. She buys wheat flour and other ingredients on credit and repays her creditor post-sale. To end this situation, she is asking for a loan of $1000 to create a sufficient stock of flour and ingredients needed to prepare her fritters. This will allow her to increase her revenue and better meet the needs of her mother, since she is the sole daughter.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Mademoiselle Q. Akpédjé est née handicapée le 21 Novembre 1971 à Lomé et résidant à Abobo-Komé. Orpheline de père, elle vit avec sa mère en location et n’a aucun support. Par son petit moyen de bord, Akpédjé s’est lancée dans le commerce de beignet. Elle achète à crédit la farine de blé et les ingrédients et après la vente elle règle son fournisseur. Pour mettre fin à cette situation, elle sollicite un appui financier de $1000 pour faire un stock suffisant de farine et les intrants pour la préparation de son beignet. Ceci lui permettra d’accroître ses revenus et mieux subvenir à ses besoins et de sa maman puisqu’elle est la seule fille.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour and ingredients for the preparation of fritters

loans.name: Marie Ayawa

texts.fr:
Born in Lomé on 15 September 1947, Mrs. Marie Ayawa K. is a widow and has five (5) children in her care. Brought down by paralysis (hemiparesis) of the right side of her body, she is a dedicated woman and sells food products (gari, sugar, peanuts, ice water, oil, etc.) on the side of the road in her area with her small means. For this project, Mrs. Marie is asking for a loan of $600 in order to increase her capacity and to expand to selling other preserved goods and food pastes. This will give her financial support and a second chance to improve her living conditions and especially her services for a better return.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Née à Lomé le 15 septembre 1947, Madame K. Marie Ayawa est veuve et a cinq (5) enfants à sa charge. Terrassée par la paralysie (hémiplégie) de la partie droite de son corps, elle est une femme dévouée et vend au bord de la route dans son quartier les produits alimentaires (gari, sucre, arachide, eau glacée, huile etc.) par son petit moyens. Par ce projet, Madame Marie sollicite un prêt de $600 afin d’augmenter sa capacité et associé la vente d’autre produits de conservation et pâtes alimentaires. Ce qui lui donnera un soutien financier et un second souffle pour l’amélioration des conditions de vie et surtout ses prestations pour un bon rendement.

loans.use: To buy and sell food products

loans.name: Louis Adotè

texts.fr:
At 43 years of age, Mr. Louis Adotè E. is married and has three (3) children. Having been struck blind, he is supported by his wife in his art business (dying fabrics). It is difficult to meet the needs of the family due to limited means. Mr. Louis is asking for a loan of $600 to buy fabric and dyes in order to increase his productivity in the market and to deal with the household difficulties through the increased profit margin in order to improve his living conditions.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Agé de 43 ans, Monsieur E. Louis Adotè est marié et père de trois (3) enfants. Frappé par la cécité (non voyant), il est soutenu par sa femme dans son activité d’art (Teinture de tissus). Difficile de subvenir aux besoins de la famille par leur maigre moyen. Monsieur Louis sollicite un prêt de $600 pour acheter des tissus et teintures afin d’accroître sa productivité sur le marché et de faire face aux difficultés familiales par la marge bénéficiaire dégagée afin d’améliorer ses conditions de vie.

loans.use: To buy fabric and dyes

loans.name: Fuad

texts.en: Fuad is a married man who does not have a child. He was born in 1980. This man lives in the Salyan region in the Yenikand village. He has been in the farming business for 4 years. Now he needs a loan of $475 to buy fertilizer to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Adjo Odette

texts.fr:
At 18 years of age, Miss Adjo Odette D. lives with her parents. Very early on, she abandoned her studies due to a lack of support and began as a apprentice making dyed fabric, which she sells in the grand market, especially to tourists. For this project, she is asking for a loan of $400 to buy fabric and dyes in order to increase her production. This will allow her to increase her revenue and better meet her needs.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 18 ans, Mademoiselle D. Adjo Odette vie avec ses parents. Très tôt, elle a abandonné ses études par manque de support et s’est lancée dans l’apprentissage de teinte de tissus qu’elle vend au grand marché surtout aux touristes. Par ce projet, elle sollicite un financement de $400 pour l’achat des tissus et teintures afin d’accroître sa production. Cela lui permettra d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire et mieux subvenir à ses besoins.

loans.use: To buy fabric and dyes

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr:
Miss Abra Amévi is 22 years old and has been practicing this activity for almost 2 years. She buys palm nuts in the villages of Amoussoukopé, extracts palm nut oil and sells back this oil to shopkeepers from Lomé. This activity is practiced by several young women and women from these surroundings. This activity provides her with an income that allows her to be independent. This current loan will help her to buy a lot of nuts and to produce a lot of oil to meet the demand of her customers.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Mlle Abra Amévi est agée de 22 ans et exercerce cette activité bientôt 2 ans. Elle achète les noix de palm dans les villages d'Amoussoukopé , extrait de l'huile de palm et revent cette huile aux commerçantes venants de Lomé. Cette activité est exercée par plusieurs jeunes filles et femmes du milieu. L'activité procure des revenus qui lui permettent d'être indépendante.Le présent emprunt va aider Mlle Abra Amévi d'acheter beaucoup de noix et de produire beaucoup d'huile pour satisfaire la demande des clientes.

loans.use: Purchase of palm nuts in surrounding villages to extract cooking oil and sale of this oil at the market.

loans.name: Efui Essénam

texts.fr:
Born in 1979, Mr. Essénam Efui T. is unmarried and lives in Kégué. An informational technology specialist, he was unable to obtain his diploma due to a lack of means, and began working in the second-hand clothing business. Not having a place to sell his wares, Mr. Efui is asking for a loan of $1000 in order to obtain a space in the market which he can arrange, and to buy stacks of second hand clothing. This will allow him to increase his capacity and improve his living conditions, eventually leading to his certificate in informational technology.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1979, Monsieur T. Efui Essénam est célibataire et réside à Kégué. Maintenancier en informatique, et par faute de moyens, il n’a pas pu avoir son diplôme et s’est lancé dans le commerce de friperies. N’ayant pas de place pour vendre ses articles, Monsieur Efui sollicite un prêt de $1000 afin d’acquérir une place dans le marché qu’il pourra bien aménager et acheter des balles de friperie. Cela lui permettra d’accroître sa capacité et améliorer ses conditions de vie et plus tard avoir son attestation en maintenance informatique.

loans.use: To rent a retail space and to buy second-hand clothing

loans.name: Amélé

texts.fr:
At 24 years of age, Miss Amélé A. is unmarried. Coming from a poor family, she started selling medicines (generic products), charcoal, and brooms. Not having sufficient means, she is asking for a loan of $300 in order to increase her capacity and her living conditions since her parents do not have the means.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 24 ans, Mademoiselle A. Amélé est célibataire. Issue d’une famille pauvre, elle s’est lancée vite dans le commerce de médicaments (produits générique), de charbon de bois et de balaie. N’ayant pas suffisamment de moyens, elle demande un prêt de $300 afin d’accroître sa capacité et ses conditions de vie puisque s’est parents n’ont pas de moyens.

loans.use: To buy and sell medicine and charcoal

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr:
Mr. Koffi K. was born in 1982 in Attoèta. He is single and takes care of three other people. He would like to develop his business of selling planks, which will allow him to satisfy his customers. For this project, Mr. K. is requesting a loan of $800 so he can buy the planks and transport them to Lomé, where they will be sold. The success of this project will build up customer loyalty and give him a stable income so he can satisfy his family’s needs.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur K. Koffi est né en 1982 à Attoèta, célibataire, il a à sa charge trois personnes. Son activité est basée sur le commerce de planche. Ce qui lui permettra de vite satisfaire ses clients. Par ce projet, Monsieur Koffi sollicite un financement de $800 afin de payer et transporter des planches sur Lomé et qui seront destinées à la vente. La réalisation de ce projet le rendra encore fidèle à ses clients et lui permettra de disposer d’un revenu sûr pour la satisfaction des besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of planks

loans.name: Benito

texts.es:
Mr. Benito is 35 years old; he is married and has 2 minor children. For the last ten years Mr. Benito has been in the business of recycling tires. He has a steady client base to which he sells his product. He also sells used tires to the main tire dealers of the city.

His hard work and the help of his wife, who also works with him in the business, have allowed them to buy a house, support their family and cover the costs of schooling for their children.

With the proceeds of the loan that he is requesting he wants to acquire a larger inventory of tires and paint and other materials needed to refurbish them.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Benito tiene 35 años, está casado y tiene 2 hijos todos menores de edad. Benito se dedica al reciclaje de cubiertas hace ya más de 10 años, posee clientela fija a quiénes les provee de éstos productos y además vende cubiertas usadas a las principales gomerías de la ciudad.

Con su trabajo y la ayuda de su esposa (quién también trabaja con él) lograron comprar una casa, mantener a la familia y cubrir los gastos de la escuela de sus hijos.

Con el crédito que solicita, desea adquirir mayor cantidad de cubiertas, pintura y otros materiales que utiliza para arreglar las cubiertas y ponerlas en buen estado.

loans.use: Purchase of new and used tires and materials.

loans.name: Pierrette

texts.fr:
Mrs. Pierrette Y., 39, is a married mother of six (6) children. Her main business activity consists of selling foodstuffs (corn, beans, sorghum, millet), and she is assisted by her husband, an unemployed schoolteacher. Pierrette is requesting a loan of $1000 to build up a consistent inventory so she can satisfy her customers and earn a profit, which will allow her to meet her family’s needs.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 39 ans, Madame Y. Pierrette est mariée et mère de six (6) enfants. Son activité principale est le commerce des produits vivriers (maïs, haricot, sorgho, mil). Aidée par son mari qui est un instituteur en chômage, Madame Pierrette sollicite un financement de $1000 pour faire un stock consistant en vue de satisfaire sa clientèle et en dégager une marge bénéficiaire qui lui servira de subvenir aux besoins de la famille.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of grains

loans.name: Amavi Délali

texts.fr:
Mrs. Amavi Délali S. was born September 18, 1963. She is single and takes care of two (2) other people. When she found herself unemployed from her job as a schoolteacher, she got into the business of selling foodstuffs (gari, sugar, peanuts, etc.) in her neighborhood. As she lacks the necessary funds, she is requesting a loan of $1000 to buy her products in large quantities so as not to run out of them, which would cause her to lose customers. The success of this project will allow her to increase her financial capacity and to earn a sufficient profit so she can refinance other business activities and improve her living conditions.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 18 septembre 1963, Madame S. Amavi Délali est célibataire et à sa charge deux (2) personnes. Etant en chômage (Institutrice), elle s’est lancée dans le commerce de denrées alimentaires (gari, sucre, arachide etc.) dans son quartier. Manquant de fonds nécessaire, elle sollicite un apport financier de $1000 pour acheter en grande quantité ses marchandises afin d’éviter toute rupture de stock qui lui fait perdre sa clientèle. La réalisation de ce projet lui permettra d’augmenter sa capacité financière et dégager une marge bénéficiaire suffisante pour refinancer d’autres activités et aussi améliorer ses conditions de vie.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of foodstuffs

loans.name: Dovi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Dovi T. is a handicapped woman who was born December 21, 1953 in Accra, Ghana. She is a married mother of five (5) children. Her husband is unemployed, and she is responsible for meeting all of the family’s needs. As she is very ambitious and willing to do everything it takes for her children to succeed in life, Mrs. T. is requesting a loan of $600 to install a mini-cafeteria in her neighborhood, something the local population desires. The success of this project will allow her to improve her living conditions.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame T. Dovi est handicapée et est née à Accra (Ghana) le 21 décembre 1953. Mariée et mère de cinq (5) enfants son mari est toujours sans emploi et toutes les charges du ménage se reposent sur elle. Très ambitieuse et voulant à tout prix la réussite de ses enfants, Madame T. sollicite un prêt de $600 pour installer un mini cafétéria dans son quartier qui est un souhait de la population de ce milieu. La réalisation de ce projet lui permettra d’améliorer son niveau de vie.

loans.use: Installation of a cafeteria

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr:
Like many women in her town, Mrs. Kossiwa Yao’s principal activity is the transformation of palm nuts into cooking oil. She is 28 years old, married and the mother of 5 children. She has been practicing this activity for the last 10 years. She contributes to the family’s expenses with the income from her business. She receives orders from surrounding villages. In turn, she goes to the surrounding villages and buys palm nuts. She brings them back to Amoussoukopé and using old fashioned methods, she extracts the oil to fulfill her clients’ needs. She masters her activity.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Mme Kossiwa Yao comme plusieurs femmes de la localité a pour activité principale la transformation des noix de palm en huile de cuisine. Elle agée de 28 ans , mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle exercrce cette activité depuis 10 ans. Elle participe aux charges de la famille par le revenu de son activité. Elle reçoit des commandes des villes environnantes. A son tour elle va dans les villages environnants achète des noix de palm, les ramène à Amoussoukopé et par la méthode artisanale elle extrait de l'huile pour la satisfaction de ses clientes . Elle a la maîtrise de son activité

loans.use: Purchase of 40 baskets of palm nuts in surrounding villages to extract 30 liters of palm nut oil and sale of the oil.

loans.name: Sununa

texts.en:
Sununa is married with 8 children and also cares for 10 orphans. For the past 13 years, Sununa has been the owner of the Sebbi Metal Workshop. With her Kiva loan, she plans to purchase another welding machine and buy more metal for her shop. Metal workshops are quite common along the roadways. As with most services, suppliers and manufacturers here, you will tend to find several of the same type of businesses one right next to the other.

Although fabricators, using welding machines can make most anything out of metal, the bread and butter of the business tends to be metal doors, gates, railings and windows. Their shops are blackened with the "soot” of their trade and the blinding sparks can be seen some distances along the roadways.

loans.use: Sunwna plans to use her loan to purchase another welding machine and buy more metal for her shop.

loans.name: Linci

texts.es:
Linci is a seamstress with three years of experience who learnt how to sew from her mother. She is single and has no children.

She had several offers to travel to Spain and work as a maid, but following the advice of her parents she decided to stay and open her own tailoring business.

She will use the loan to buy an “Overlock” sewing machine which will help her to work faster and improve her work.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva Volunteer.

Linci es una costurera que se dedica al oficio hace más de 3 años, ella es soltera y sin hijos; el arte de la confección de las ropas lo adquirió de su madre.

Comenta Linci, que tuvo muchas ofertas para viajar a España a trabajar de empleada doméstica, pero siguió los consejos de sus padres prefirió quedar en el país he invertir en su propio negocio y abrir su propio taller de costura.

El préstamo que solicita desea invertirlo en la compra de una máquina de coser tipo overlock que la ayudará a agilizar y mejorar su trabajo.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 26 and married with two children. For the past four years, he has owned a welding shop. Welding is a good trade as there is always a need for quality welders. Most shops operate as small businesses alongside the roadways and can easily hire 2-3 additional workers. This is the type of business where once you are established, you will always stay busy. Many businesses that open require no trained skill, i.e. produce stands, and exist only temporarily as long as the operator shows up. With welding, you have a viable business that can even be handed down to your children or sold for a profit.

Charles is a very talented welder who enjoys his trade. With time, he can build a strong clientele. With his loan he plans to buy more metal and oil for his welding machine. His loan is relatively small, but he is new to his lending group. He will need to show that he is capable of repayment before he can acquire a larger loan. In lending groups, the group is responsible for the repayment of any member who defaults; consequently, they have the final say as to who will be a member and how large a loan each member should receive.

loans.use: To buy more metal and oil for his workshop.

loans.name: Ibrahiri

texts.en:
Ibrahiri is 51, married with 5 children, and cares for two orphans. He sells charcoal. This is an excellent business as everyone in the villages uses charcoal for cooking. Charcoal is cheap. It is not like the briquettes you buy in the store. It is made by felling trees, which are then chopped into pieces. A hole is dug in the earth and a smoldering fire is set. Banana leaves are placed over the hot coals, and the chopped pieces of timber are placed on the banana leaves. On top of the timber are placed more banana leaves. The entire pit is then buried lightly with loose dirt, enough that the coals can still breath. In three days the pit is opened, and the timbers have been charred all the way through, thus making charcoal.

A person selling charcoal will always be needed. If he can build a strong clientele, he can operate his business for a long time. He will buy charcoal in 100kg bags and sell by 2 cups. Villagers usually only have enough money to buy enough for each day, about 2 cups. So, each day they will revisit Ibrahiri and purchase a day's supply. With his loan, Ibrahiri will continue to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Akou A. is 35 years old, married, and the mother of 6 children. Her husband has a very unpredictable income. She has been in the business of extracting oil for 12 years. She buys palm nuts in the surrounding villages, extracts the oil, and sells that oil at the local market. She uses old fashioned methods to extract the oil. This loan would allow her to buy enough palm nuts to increase her production in order to meet the demand of her customers.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Mme Akou A. est agée de 35 ans ,mariée et mère de 6 ans. Son mari a des revenus très irréguliers. Elle exercerce l'activité d'extration d'huile depuis de 12 ans. Elle achete des noix de palm dans les villages environnants, extrait de l'huile de palm et revend cette huile sur le marché local . Elle utilise les méthodes artisanales pour extraire l'huille. Le présent emprunt va la servir à acheter assez de noix de palm pour augmenter la production afin de satisfaire la demande de la clientèle.

loans.use: Purchase of 60 bowls of palm nuts in surrounding villages, extraction of cooking oil and sale at the market

loans.name: Jameo

texts.en:
Jameo owns the Hanifa Fashion Designer Store. Her store is a clothing boutique and video library. Jameo is 24 years old and single with one child. She has developed a regular clientele of young women and is very friendly and business-oriented. Her line of clothing is of very good quality. She sells jeans, T-shirts, tops, shoes and some jewelery.

She has operated her store for four years and been a member of her lending group for the past three years. Her line of clothing would be considered luxury for most villagers, but because she is located on the outskirts of a large city, Kampala, the women from her village treat themselves to the clothes in her store. Videos are also a luxury, but serve an important need for inexpensive entertainment. With her loan Jameo plans to add more clothing to her shop, pay her electricity and license fees as well as rent on her shop.

loans.use: Jameo plans to use her loan to add more clothes to her store and pay rent, licensing and electricity bills.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth has run her own grocery store for the past 11 years. She sells sugar, maize flour, posho, beans, rice, etc. The villagers can only afford basic essentials, so a store owner would not be well served to offer new items that are not essential. The small discretionary items that are offered are inexpensive sweets, sodas and muffins.

It's fun to visit the villages at night, which present a lively and vibrant street scene.. The shops with their net doorways are lit only by paraffin lanterns, giving a soft glow to the interior. From the street, the faces of people against the soft fire light of the lanterns are quite welcoming. Each shop takes on its own character. Most of the time there is little or no electricity, so the night is dark, the sky is full of stars and the music and the gathering of people around charcoal stoves selling meat shish-ka-bobs is a world unto itself. The people in villages are also quite welcoming of outsiders, which is comforting.

With her loan, Ruth will add dry staples to her store and hopefully boost her sales.

loans.use: Ruth plans to use her loan to buy more dried food staples for her store.

loans.name: Akolitsè Gagnon

texts.fr:
Mr. Akolitsè Gagnon A. was born May 16, 1972 in Lomé. He is a handicapped widow who takes care of three (3) children, and he is a cobbler by trade. Mr. A. is requesting a loan of $1000 to refurbish his workshop, install a telephone booth and sell telephone cards. This will allow him to improve his living conditions and those of his entire family.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur A. Akolitsè Gagnon est né le 16 mai 1972 à Lomé. Il est handicapé et veuf et à sa charge trois (3) enfants. Cordonnier de profession, Monsieur A. sollicite un financement de $1000 pour en l’aménagement de son atelier, installer une cabine téléphonique et faire la vente des cartes de recharge. Ceci lui permettra d’améliorer ses conditions de vie et de toute la famille.

loans.use: Refurbishing his cobbler’s workshop

loans.name: Bawala

texts.en:
Bawala has operated a canteen, or small grocery store, for the past seven years. As I have written dozens of stories about these type of stores, I wanted to take a moment to talk about the wonderful people who operate them. Balwala is one of so many who have enrichened my life with their warm personalities and welcoming ways. I have traveled extensively and the people of Uganda are some of the most welcoming people I have ever had the pleasure of meeting.

Bawala is a delight. She is married with 8 children. Since her business is like so many others, it is her personality that brings her a strong clientele and sets her store apart. Bawala radiates warmth and caring and is a strong leader in her village. With her loan she will add more staple foods to her store.

loans.use: Bawala plans to use her loan to buy more staple foods for her grocery store.

loans.name: Massaoudou

texts.fr:
Mr. Massaoudou O. is a handicapped man who was born in 1979 in Lomé. He is single and takes care of one (1) other person. He is a cobbler by training who excels at his job and is well-liked by his customers. Massaoudou is requesting a loan of $1000 to install a mill so the local population will no longer have to travel long distances to have access to one. This will also allow him to be close to the mill so he can improve his business and render a useful service to the local population. Consequently, his economic and financial potential will improve his family and social conditions.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Handicapé, Monsieur O. Massaoudou est né en 1979 à Lomé. Célibataire, il a à sa charge une (1) personne. Cordonner de profession, il maîtrise bien son métier et est très apprécié par sa clientèle. Monsieur Massaoudou sollicite un financement de $1000 qui lui servira d’installer un moulin en vue d’éviter un déplacement sur une longue distance de la population nécessiteuse. Cela permettra également d’être plus proche de leur nouvelle installation en vue d’accroître ses activités et rendre un service fidèle à la population de sa zone et par conséquent son potentiel économique et financière rejaillirait sur son environnement familial et social.

loans.use: Installation of a mill

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Mr. Adama K. is 35 years old, married and the father of 4 children. He is the owner of a general store situated in the center of town. He has been managing this activity for almost 5 years and has been a client of FECECAV for 2 years. He has already obtained 2 loans, which he repaid in full. This current loan will allow him to increase his store because of the ever increasing demand.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Mr Adama K. est agé de 35 ans marié et père de 4 enfants. Il est propriétaire de la boutique d'alimentation générale implantée au centre ville. Elle gère cette activité depuis bientôt 5 ans et est client de FECECAV depuis 2 ans. Il a déjà eu deux crédits qu'il remboursé sans défaut. Le présent emprunt va lui permettre d'accroître sa boutique à cause de la demande sans cesse croissante de la demande.

loans.use: Bulk purchase of 85 bags of rice, 20 jugs of oil, and 30 bags of sugar in Lomé to be sold in Kpalimé

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:
So how do you make bricks? Ask Safina, she will tell you. You bake them!

Actually, the first thing you do is find a plot of land where there is an adobe (a natural building material mixed from sand, clay, and straw) quality to the soil. Then you make a wooden mold in which you will wet the earth, making mud and slopping it into the molds. When the mold is dry enough to keep its form, you release the bricks from the mold. You let them dry enough to be stacked. Create a 2ft x 2ft hole at the bottom of the stack . This is where you will build your fire. For three days you will tend the fire, not too, just smoldering, until all the bricks have been baked. After baking you will cover with straw so the rains don’t erode away all your hard work. You will be able to sell each brick for about five cents.

Safina has been doing this for about 4 years. She will use her loan to pay for school fees and to pay her workers in her business.

loans.use: Safina plans to use her loan to pay school fees and to pay her workers.

loans.name: Liza

texts.es:
Liza is a married, 26-year-old mother of one son. She owns a clothing store that sells apparel for men, women, and children.

During the festivities of the Virgin of Caacupé, she had a great number of sales. She sells sweaters, shorts, skirts, shirts, etc.

She is requesting this loan to buy more clothing for the season, since sales have increased considerably and she wishes to broaden her selection of apparel.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Liza, es una señora joven de 26 años, está casada y tiene 1 hijo, ella es propietaria de un negocio que se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de ropas para damas, caballeros y niños.

Durante las festividades de la Virgen de Caacupé, comenta Liza, tuvo una gran cantidad de ventas. Entre algunas de sus mercaderías que vende podemos citar: remeras, shorts, faldas, camisas, etc.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar más mercaderías de temporada ya que las ventas han aumentado considerablemente y desea ampliar su stock.

loans.use: Purchase of sweaters, shorts, shirts, jeans, skirts, tops, etc.

loans.name: Claire

texts.fr:
Mrs. Claire E. was born in 1959 and is a married mother of four (4) children. Her main business activity consists of selling charcoal. Her husband’s small pension is not enough to cover all of her family’s needs. Faced with insufficient means, Mrs. E. is requesting a loan of $1000 in order to build up a large enough inventory to satisfy her customers’ demand. This will allow her to increase her business capacity and to satisfy her clients in the long term, so she can earn a profit and meet her family’s social and economic needs.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1959, Madame E. Claire est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants. Son activité principale est le commerce de charbon de bois. La maigre pension de son mari n’arrive pas à couvrir tous les besoins de la famille. Devant ses moyens insuffisants, Madame E. sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour faire un stock consistant afin de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. Ceci lui permettra d’accroître sa capacité et aussi de satisfaire à temps ses clients pour dégager une marge bénéficiaire en vue de faire face aux conditions sociales et économiques.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of charcoal

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah has a traditional craft shop and she is also a tailor, meaning she has a foot-operated sewing machine. She has had both businesses for the past 10 years. She is single, 54 years old, reserved, and cares for 3 orphans. By selling traditional crafts, she not only helps people from the villages market their wares, she helps to carry on the traditions of their cultures.

Sarah is also a skilled designer of clothing. Since having clothing made for you in the villages is cheaper than store-bought clothes, most people use the services of tailors. It is not uncommon to see a person in front of a storefront pedaling away on their sewing machine. It’s nice to have a manual machine because you do not need electricity. With her loan, Sarah will buy more crafts from villagers and more material for her tailoring business.

loans.use: To buy more crafts from villagers and more material for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary owns the Sunrise Medical Service, a dispensary of over-the-counter pharmaceuticals. She has operated the dispensary for 9 years and been a member of her lending group for the past four years. She is 50 years old, widowed, and looks after her own 5 children as well as 3 orphans.

Her dream is to one day open a larger clinic where she can tend to people who are ill and to open a nursing home. She is a very caring, compassionate and hardworking individual. People in this business often do it out of a labor or love. With her loan she plans to purchase more over-the-counter medicines for her clients.

loans.use: Mary plans to use her loan to purchase more over-the-counter medicines for her clients.

loans.name: Ayaba

texts.fr:
Ayaba G. was born in Attitogon on October 10, 1982. She understood at a young age that school was not for her, so she got into business. Selling plastic plates became her main business activity. She buys her products in Lomé and resells them in Attitigon at the local markets. For the end of the year, she is requesting a loan of $1000 so she can buy lots of plates and satisfy the high demand from her customers. With the income she generates, she will be able to repay her loan and meet her own needs as well as those of her sisters.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

G. Ayaba est née à Attitogon le 10 Octobre 1982. Ayant vite compris que les études ne feront pas d’elle une personne, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce. La vente des assiettes en plastique est devenu son activité principale. Elle achète les produits de Lomé et revient les vendre à Attitogon sur les marchés locaux. En cette période de fin d’année, elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour acheter beaucoup d’assiettes afin de satisfaire les nombreuses demandes qui l’attendent. Des revenus, elle pourra rembourser son crédit et parvenir à satisfaire ses besoins et ceux de ses sœurs.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of plastic plates

loans.name: Sodawomé

texts.fr:
Born in 1966, Mrs. Sodawomé A. is married and has 5 people under her care, some of whom are still in school. Her husband, a farmer, helps pay for household expenses, but Mrs A. also helps with the earnings from her small business. This enterprise is her main daily work, which is the preparation and sales of beans. Today, to increase her buying power and her turnover, she is asking for a loan of $300 in order to purchase sacks of beans, oil and "gari" ( fine grained cornmeal-like substance obtained from fermented manioc pulp), in sufficient quantities so as to satisfy demand. From her earnings, she will be better able to support the needs of her children, such as their schooling, health and nutrition.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Née en 1966, Madame A. Sodawomé est mariée et compte à sa charge cinq (5) personnes dont certains encore en scolarité. Son mari, paysan contribue aux charges du ménage mais Madame A. participe elle aussi avec les revenus de son activité. La préparation et la vente du haricot reste son activité quotidienne. Aujourd’hui pour augmenter son pouvoir d’achat et son chiffre d’affaire, elle sollicite un financement de $300 pour acheter des sacs d’haricot, de l’huile et du gari en quantité suffisante afin de satisfaire les demandes. De ses revenus, elle pourra mieux subvenir aux besoins des enfants en matière de scolarité, de santé et d’alimentation.

loans.use: Purchase sacks of beans.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en: This young man was born in 1985. He is single and lives in Khudat town. Rashid has 2 years of experience in this business. He buys the cattle to fatten for sale. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy 2 head of cattles for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy 2 cattles

loans.name: Akou Alougba

texts.fr:
Born in 1977, Mrs. Akou Alougba A. is married and has 4 people under her care. The creation of cakes and doughnuts is her main daily activity. A woman adored by children for her fine quality goods, she has succeeded in seducing everyone through her delicious tasting sweets. Today, because of high demand, she is asking for a loan of $300 in order to purchase sugar, oil and wheat flour, all of the necessary ingredients for her confections. Her earnings will help her to support the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Née en 1977, Madame A. Akou Alougba est mariée et compte à sa charge quatre (4) personnes. La production de gâteaux et de beignets est son activité quotidienne. Femme adorée des enfants pour la qualité de son met, elle a réussi à séduire tout le monde pour le bon goût de son produit. Aujourd’hui, face à l’importance de la demande, elle sollicite $300 pour acheter du sucre, de l’huile, de la farine de blé, tous les intrants pour sa production. Le revenu peut le servir à mieux contribuer aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of wheat flour.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
Lorenza is a 45 year old married woman with three kids. She has had a convenience store in the neighborhood of San Francisco for more than 10 years.

Her business is located in a very busy commercial area, which helps her with her sales. Lorenza says that in the last few years there have been a lot of people moving out of the area in search of better work opportunities in Europe, and that her sales have suffered as a result of that.

Lorenza wishes to buy merchandise for her store and that is why she is requesting this loan. Among the products that she plans to buy are canned goods, sugar, flour, rice, meat and vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva Volunteer.

Lorenza es una señora de 45 años, está casada y tiene 3 hijos; tiene una despensa muy bien surtida, ubicada en el barrio San Francisco desde hace más de 10 años.

Su negocio se encuentra en una zona comercial de bastante movimiento, lo que ayuda al negocio a tener buenas ventas. Lorenza cuenta que en los últimos años se ha sentido notar la alta emigración de la gente a países europeos en busca de mejores oportunidades laborales, ya que las ventas han mermado bastante debido a este suceso.

Lorenza desea surtir su despensa y es por ello que solicita el crédito. Entre los productos a comprar podemos citar: productos enlatados, azúcar, harina, arroz, lácteos, carne, vegetales, etc.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for convenience store such as canned goods, rice, flour, sugar, meat, and vegetables.

loans.name: Amélé

texts.fr:
Married and the mother of 4 children, Mrs. Amélé S. was born in 1982. Today, she lives in Attitogon in her husband's home. Her daily work is selling shoes (sandals). Ready to help pay for the household expenses through her work in her sales, Amélé is applying for a loan of $200 to help expand her business, especially in this Holiday season. This will help her to purchase more sandals and add full foot covering shoes as well. The earnings from this enterprise will allow her to support the needs of her family, above all those of her children and their schooling, which will help them to succeed in life.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants, Madame S. Amélé est née en 1982. Actuellement elle vit à Attitogon au foyer de son mari. La vente des chaussures (sandales) reste son activité quotidienne. Prête à contribuer aux dépenses du ménage à partir des revenus de son commerce, Amélé sollicite un financement de $200 pour augmenter la taille de son activité surtout en cette période de fêtes. Ceci lui permettra d’acheter plus de sandales et y ajouter des chaussures. Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront de bien subvenir aux besoins de sa famille surtout ses enfants en scolarité afin de parvenir à leur épanouissement.

loans.use: Purchase and sales of shoes.

loans.name: Anatona

texts.en:
Anatona owns and operates a matatoo, or taxi van. Often made out of converted Toyota Vans, matatoos are prolific throughout Uganda and are the cheapest mode of transport. Each van can hold 14 passengers plus the driver and his assistant. Picture a passenger van designed to hold eight converted to hold 16 and you’ll get some idea of what it is like to be inside one of these. I use them all the time and they have become part of my cultural experience in Uganda.

The driver’s assistant hollers to pedestrians the driver’s destination. They then flag him down and on you go. People have to constantly get in and out to let people in and out. This is real packing ‘em in, bun to bun, babies and chickens in your lap kind of travel, but you can’t beat the price. (As I mentioned in other stories, I will be leaving Kiva soon and will sorely miss these wonderful experiences and telling you about them. I hope you have enjoyed the stories as much as I have enjoyed telling them. If you have, let Kiva know! They do listen.)

Anatona has been driving his matatoo for 15 years and the van is getting old and in need of a lot of maintenance. He would like to buy a newer model but can not afford it, so he will use his loan to provide much needed maintenance for his van.

loans.use: Anatona plans to use his loan to make some much needed repairs to his taxi.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Born in 1967, Mrs. Ablavi D. is married and has 7 people under her care. Her production of palm seed oil is her principal economic activity. Well known by her customers for the quality and delightful odor of her oil, Mrs D. must now try to meet high demand. To satisfy this demand, she first needs the appropriate funds and resources. She would like to take this opportunity to apply for a loan of $250 in order to purchase the palm seeds necessary for her palm seed oil production. This will allow her to satisfy customer demand as well as attract future loyal customers.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Née en 1967, Madame D. Ablavi est mariée et a à sa charge sept (7) personnes. La production de l’huile de palme est son activité. Connue par ses consommateurs pour la qualité et l’odeur agréable de son huile, Madame D. Ablavi doit faire face aujourd’hui à de nombreuses demandes. Pour les satisfaire, il faut des moyens. Elle veut à cet effet saisir cette opportunité pour solliciter un financement de $250 afin de s’approvisionner en noix de palme pour la production de son huile. Ceci lui permettra de satisfaire sa clientèle et de fidéliser.

loans.use: Stocking palm seeds for the production of palm seed oil.

loans.name: Zikreta

texts.en: Zikreta is a 36-year-old married housewife who lives in a small town near Sarajevo. She is uneducated; because of that, she cannot find a job. Her husband works only in the summer. They have two sons, and her older son does not attend school because they do not have enough money. The younger son attends school. The cow is their only secure source of income during the winter. Zikreta has taken this second loan from Women for Women International because she needs to provide food for the cow. She earns money by selling milk, which provides income to support the family during the whole year. She hopes her income will increase and she will be able to provide primary school education for her younger son.

loans.use: To buy a hay for her cow

loans.name: Yao Jules

texts.fr:
Mr. Yao Jules A. was born in 1970; today he is married and the father of 4 children. He works several small jobs but his sales of fuel is his most important one. Today, faced with ever growing demand, he would like to satisfy his customers' requests and so, is applying for a loan of $250. The earnings he makes will allow him to support the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Monsieur A. Yao Jules est né en 1970, marié et père de quatre (4) enfants. Il exerce de petites activités mais la vente de carburant reste son activité dominante. Aujourd’hui face à une demande toujours croissante, il veut saisir cette occasion pour solliciter ce crédit de $250 afin d’être en mesure de satisfaire sa clientèle. Les bénéfices lui permettront de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase and sales of fuel.

loans.name: Margrete

texts.en:
Margrete is a 56 year old widow who cares for six children, seven grandchildren and 100 chickens. With that many children around, she often goes to the henhouse when she wants some peace and quiet! Each hen lays an egg per day on average. Margrete collects and places the eggs in a 36-egg cardboard tray which she sells for about 3,000 Uganadan shillings (about $1.75).

Her daily collection of eggs brings her about $5.25 per day, which is above the national average in Uganda. However she then has to pay for chicken feed and new chicks from her income. With her Kiva loan, Margrete will buy more chicken feed and week-old chicks.

loans.use: Margrete plans to buy chicken feed and more week-old chicks with her loan.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr:
At 43, Mrs. Akouvi A. is married and a mother. She has a total of 12 people under her care. She is able to support and care for this large amount of people thanks to her small business of selling plate ware, which is very profitable. Well known in her neighborhood for her reasonable prices, she receives many requests for her products. Wishing to continue to satisfy demand, she is applying for a loan of $350 to stock her plate ware selection. The revenue she earns will allow her to better support and meet the needs of her large family.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Agée de 43 ans, Madame A. Akouvi est mariée et mère d’enfants, elle compte à sa charge un total de douze (12) personnes. Elle parvient à le faire grâce à son activité, le commerce des assiettes qui lui est très rentable. Bien connu dans sa localité pour son prix abordable, elle reçoit beaucoup de demandes. Dans le souci de les satisfaire, elle sollicite $350 pour s’approvisionner en quantité d’assiettes. Les revenus lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase and sales of plate ware.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet has operated a hair salon for the past 5 years. She is also the secretary of the Matale Lending Group where she has been a member for the past 2 years. She is 25, single, and has one child. She is requesting a Kiva loan so that she can buy another hairdryer, more braids, weaves and chemicals for her salon.

Traveling around Uganda, you can see that hairstyles change with the regions and the tribes. In and around the urban cities of Kampala and Entebbe, women prefer braids and weaves. In the more rural areas, women often wear scarves or keep their hair short without adding braids. Braids and weaves are not usually real hair and take considerable time to apply, so the poorer residents of rural areas do not go in for braids and weaves as they are more expensive.

loans.use: Annet will use her loan to buy more braids, weaves and chemicals for her hair salon.

loans.name: Agossi

texts.fr:
At 40 years old, Mrs. Agossi A. is married as well as a mother. To support the 6 people under her care, she manages her own economic activity of selling cereals. During harvests, she purchases her products from farmers, which she then stocks until she is ready to resell the cereals. During this harvest season, she is applying for a loan of $250 in order to restock her cereal supply. This will allow her to satisy customer demand during the period in between harvests.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Agée de 40 ans, Madame A. Agossi est mariée et mère d’enfants. Pour supporter les charges des six (6) personnes à sa charge, elle exerce comme activité la vente des céréales. En période de récolte, elle achète les produits auprès des paysans qu’elle stocke jusqu’à une période avant la vente. A cette période de récolte, elle sollicite $250 pour faire le stockage des céréales. Ceci lui permettra de satisfaire sa clientèle en période de pénurie.

loans.use: To stock cereals.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester owns a retail shop where she sells new clothing as well as dry staples such as sugar, salt, rice, maize flour, etc. In most retail stores, these staples are there biggest sellers and have the most profit potential. The problem is sometimes almost every fourth or fifth store sells the same item, so competition is heated. Often the difference between success and failure in this type of business is your personality.

Ester has a very pleasant personality. She is 30 years old and married with 5 children. She also sells new clothing that appeals to young women and their children. With her loan, she plans to add more clothes to her store. Her dream is to one day build her own home and to educate her children so that they can go to university.

loans.use: Ester plans to use her loan to buy more clothes for her store.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet runs a retail store and owns a small pump from which she sells petrol. In the country, out on rutted dirt roads, when your car is running on empty, these simple pumps are a welcoming sight. When I asked Annet what her hopes and dreams were for the future, she said without hesitation that she would like to own a cow. In rural areas, a cow is wealth. It is expensive to buy a cow as well as care for one, such as by puchasing medicines, and a large enough plot of land so that it can graze.

Despite this, people here view owning a cow as a blessing because it provides milk and sometimes feels like part of the family. People regularly talk to each other about how their farm animals are doing because a sick animal can have a large impact on a family, even a neighborhood. Annet has two pigs, and a goat. For now, she will use her loan to buy more supplies for her retail store, i.e. sugar, rice, paraffin, salt, etc.

loans.use: Annet plans to use her loan to buy more sacks of sugar, rice, paraffin, salt, etc, for her store.

loans.name: Woévi

texts.fr:
At 27, Mrs. Woévi A. is a young married woman and the mother of 4 children. She decided to begin her own economic activity, combining selling cosmetic products and bonbons. It is this enterprise that earns her money. Not currently having the means available to her to meet the many demands of her customers, she is applying for a loan of $250. The revenue she gains from this enterprise will help her to contribute to the household budget.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Agée de 27 ans, Madame A. Woévi est une jeune dame mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants. Elle a décidé d’associer la vente des produits cosmétiques aux bombons. C’est d’ailleurs cette activité qui lui procure de l’argent. N’ayant pas les moyens nécessaires, elle sollicite un crédit de $250 pour faire face aux nombreuses demandes de sa clientèle. Les revenus de cette activité lui serviront de mieux contribuer aux charges du ménage.

loans.use: The purchase and sales of cosmetic products.

loans.name: Rwentobo Women's Group

texts.en:
Constance is the chairperson of the Rwentobo Women’s Group in Ntungamo. Ntungamo is surrounded by lush green rolling hills in western Uganda, not far from the Impenetrable Forest made famous in the movie Gorillas in the Mist and the African Pygmies. The residents here are primarily rural subsistence farmers who coffee and matooke and raise the famous Ankole cattle, with their 3ft curved horns rising gracefully upwards.

Most of the members in the group live on farms and the tranquility and beauty of these mud and twig villages is enough to make you want to move there. Although poor financially, these villagers are not lacking in food and their shelter is quite adequate for the climate. There are no jobs, so people either establish a business, or just live off the land. Poverty is relative and these villagers are gentle and rich in spirit. They have time for family and community, which is important because there are a very large number of orphans due to AIDS throughout Uganda and orphanages abound.

Constance has operated a hair salon for 3 years and been a part of her lending group for 5 years. She is 30 years old, single and has one child. With her portion of the group loan (about $375) she will buy shampoos, chemicals and other items for her business.

loans.use: Constance will use her part of the group loan to buy more shampoos and chemicals for her hair salon.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria E. lives in her mother’s house with her three daughters, in the San Simon zone on the north side of the city of La Paz. Mrs. Maria E. works at a mobile phone center in the Villa Fatima zone. This job provides income for her family.

Her home has an area in the front of it which could be used to open a neighborhood store. This would increase her family income.

The requested loan is for the construction of a stand alone, brick room for the store.

This is the first time that she applies for a loan. The favorable review of her socioeconomic status qualifies her to be granted credit.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Maria E. vive en casa de su madre en la zona de San Simón ladera norte de la Ciudad de La Paz con sus tres hijas. La señora Maria E. atiende un centro de telefonía móvil en la zona de Villa Fatima, ocupación que le permite ingresos a su familia.

Su vivienda tiene un espacio en el frente que le brindad la posibilidad de instalar una tienda de barrio y así poder mejorar sus ingresos.

El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de una habitación (tienda) independiente de ladrillo.

Esta es la primera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: Construction of a room for a store

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is a 38 year old married mother who looks after her own 4 children as well as 4 orphans. Most orphans here are the relatives of the people who care for them. Uganda was one of the earliest and hardest hit countries in the ongoing AIDS epidemic. It is believed that the first outbreak of HIV/AIDS occurred in the area near Ntungamo near the border of the Congo and Rwanda. Uganda is a country with a “missing generation” of people between the ages of 35-55. To its credit, Uganda recognized the crisis early and the occurrence of AIDS in the country has dropped from a high of 26%-33% in Kampala in the late 1980s to a current country wide occurrence of around 5%-7%.

For the past four years, Diana has operated a restaurant specializing in goat meat. She buys a goat for between 25,000 to 35,000 shillings or $15 to $20, slaughters it herself and serves one to two goats per week. The goat population is plentiful in this area and you constantly hear the bleating of a herd going down the road. Diana also serves the typical Ugandan food of matooke, rice, etc. With her loan, Diana plans to buy, more goats for her restaurant.

loans.use: Diana plans to use her loan to buy more goats.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario M. lives in his own home in the zone of San Martín on the west side of the city of La Paz with his wife and two kids. He works in a bakery in the zone of Cotahuma in the same city. His wife recycles the flour containers and sells them in a rural area. With their previous credits, they constructed two rooms, installed a sewer system, and completed 40% of a containing wall. This credit will be used to construct the second stage of the containing wall and to finish stabilizing the foundation of their home. This is the sixth occasion that Mario is requesting a loan, and our socioeconomic analysis shows that he qualifies for another loan. He has been an IMPRO client since 1999.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

El señor Mario M. vive en casa propia en la zona de San Martín ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposa y su dos hijos, el señor Mario trabaja como empleado en una panadería de la zona de Cotahuma de la misma ciudad y su esposa recicla los envases de la harina y los comercializa en el área rural. Con los créditos anteriores realizaron la construcción de dos habitaciones, la instalación de alcantarillado y un 40% de un muro de contención. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción en segunda etapa del muro de contención y concluir así con la estabilización de suelos en su vivienda. Esta es la sexta ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 1999.

loans.use: Construction of a containing wall in their home

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet owns a produce stand in the rural area of the Ntungamo District which she has operated for the past 7 years. She is 30 and married with 3 children. She has been a member of her lending group for the past 6 years. At her produce stand, she sells uts, beans, matooke, millet and peas. Produce stands in rural areas are not nearly as prominent as in urban areas for the simple reason that almost everyone is a subsistence farmer and grow whatever they need on their own plot of land.

People in this part of Uganda do not want for food. People will tell you that the food is free, it grows everywhere. Most is planted, but there is plenty of wild mango, papaya, avocado, matooke, jackfruit, etc. With a few chickens, and a goat, you're set. Even the land is shared and Ugandans are also very welcoming. Juliet plans to use her loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: Juliet plans to use her loan to pay her children' school fees.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Mrs. C. is a married, 45-year-old mother of two who sells pet supplies—such as pet food, vaccinations, apparel, etc.—for a living.

She has had this business for over 8 years, and she tells us that she has a steady flow of customers who purchase products from her every week.

Lucia says that thanks to this business, she can help her husband cover both the household expenses and the education of her children, who have already finished school and are now entering college.

She is requesting this loan so that she can restock her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Lucia tiene 45 años, está casada y tiene 2 hijos, ella se dedica a la ventas de artículos y suplementos para veterinarias como comidas para mascotas, vacunas, ropas, collares, etc.

El negocio lo tiene hace más de 8 años, y según nos cuenta la misma, posee clientes fijos que cada semana compran de ella sus productos.

Lucia dice que gracias a este trabajo ella puede ayudar a su marido a cubrir los gastos de la casa y la educación de sus hijos quienes ya culminaron el colegio y ahora deben empezar la universidad.

Desea el crédito para poder comprar más mercaderías para reponer el stock.
